text: I was super excited when I got this product but unfortunately, it does not work. It's a great idea since Apple has decided to be lame and eliminate the headphone jack. Sadly, every time I try to plug it in, I keep getting a pop up that says something about being unable to connect/support my device. I will be returning this. :(

i love everything from smartthings and the presence sensors work perfectly.  the few lights i have hooked up already now automatically turn off when im not "present" heheh, just one example of the many perks - i don't have to run around each morning making sure all lights are off before i leave

I bought this to replace the factory stereo in my car. It has many good things and very few bad things going for it. First, the good.

It was easy to install and easy to connect to my phone and iPad. When I start my car it automatically connects and starts playing where it left off. It has some cool options like different color lights for the display and buttons and the ability to have them change automatically. It plays CDs great and the radio sounds good. My rear left speaker was sounding bad with my old stereo, like the bass was distorted and it needed replacing, but when I installed this stereo the speaker sounds fine now.

The bad? The screen is very small, I thought it was bigger based on the pictures. Also, you can't have the time displayed AND the song info, something my factory stereo could do. I hate not being able to see the time.

That's it. A good stereo and a good price.

--- UPDATE ---

I figured out how to display the clock on the screen so it never goes away, and I can still see track and other info. I set it up with my phone so when I start my car it connects and autoplays the track my phone is on. It takes a while to download my phone info on to the stereo for calling, but once it's on there I can use the stereo to select numbers to call. The mic works great, no one ever has issues hearing me and I can hear them through the stereo speakers just fine.

I love technology, and this stereo. After 6 months of use the only issue I have is that I could not find an install bracket that fit the stereo for my car, so it's not secure but it is snug and not easily moved around.

First, mine didn‚Äôt smell.

Now that I have the positive attributes out of the way let‚Äôs discuss why you should avoid this case.
I reluctantly paid $33 for this and I have to wonder what I was thinking. It‚Äôs nowhere near worth that much.

It will not/cannot survive a side impact. Well that‚Äôs not true. It cannot protect your APM from a hit or drop that could damage them from the top. I‚Äôm not sure if it could from the bottom or sides. It‚Äôs either molded cardboard or thin plastic covered with fabric. No padding, just fabric.

Internally there is another layer of cardboard (or plastic, thin, very thin) covered in a felt like material. There‚Äôs absolutely no drop protection.

The magnets designed to put the APM into ‚Äúsleep‚Äù mode lay flat. You will have to pinch them up while putting your headphones into it if you wish to keep them from clanging together and not using the stock case. Even then the magnets don‚Äôt work every time. See my pic.

Overall this is a $10 case marked up cause they can. I mean we have expensive headphones so why not charge us more? We have already proven we will pay.

Skip this thing. Mine is going back. If you want something to protect them in a backpack then still look elsewhere. You can get something equal to this for less.

Thanks for your time.
I have two pair of apple headphones that stay tangled up in my work drawer : /  These little babies cleared that all up! Excellent

Most every thing is Speakon these days but once in a while I needed to connect my Speakon cables to speakers that only have 1/4 inch connectors. Having these in my kit allows me to do this easily. They're quite handy.

I had such a problem trying to charge, wait, and then use headphones....
This splitter I got for my Samsung Note 10 works !!!
Thank you!!

I am no one's fitness freak at my age, but I do have things that I need to monitor for my continued good health. I decided to go all Samsung with this device cycle and I'm glad I did. I went with the Bluetooth only version because I always keep my phone on or near my person, and spending the money on an LTE capability and line for the watch does not make sense for me. Even without the phone line, this watch does just about everything but sign my paycheck. It's easy to set up and use. It interfaces well with my S22 Ultra and my Galaxy Buds 2 Pro, providing useful control of both. The available apps, faces and features should satisfy the most demanding user. Battery life is outstanding. I'm getting more than 2 days of continuous use on each charge. Charging is wireless and quick. If you have run it all the way down, it will take a couple of hours to bring it back to full charge, but a half hour will give you useful service time. I have picked up a few things that make my use nice and easy. You can read my reviews on them if you want. I cannot recommend this watch highly enough. Samsung has a winner here.
Nice product, works well, it takes a little time to adjust to hearing both music in speakers and also hearing outside noise , not noise canceling, that is the purpose

I have had these since October. The sound quality is GREAT! Cancels noise around me when they are in my ears. Battery is OK but not even close to what they say. Maybe 4 hours with the charge in between. Mine decided to rename themselves and then sometimes decide not to connect. Kind embarrassing when I start the music and it's blaring from my phone and everyone around can hear but I can't and realize they didn't connect again.

Update have had these over a year and seriously the best headphones ever. After upgrades and set up again on my iPhone I have not had any troubles with sound or connection. Battery lasts a long time and headphones never disconnect.

The ear pieces are not replaceable there are no different size tips for these so they fit or they don't. If they do they sound pretty good. Fit, for me, wasn't uncomfortable though I have worn earbuds that were much more comfortable. There's some good bass and the high ends are reasonably sharp. The mid-range isn't muddy though it's a little. . . in the back. I've used these for hours at a time even fallen asleep while wearing them. They're okay walking around the house, no idea how well they hold while running or exercising.

Far too bass heavy; the sounds seem to come out like a rock. Jazz sounds like a drowning cat; anything with horns or strings just forget about...rappers will love this useless speaker as it muffles all hope of actual music.

You will need a soldering iron, solder and a 12V power supply with a DC 5.5 connector.  I was pleasantly surprised after I have gotten through putting it together that actually does work.  This kit includes a stick of glue you heat up to attach the coil to the circuit board and thermal sink grease you apply to the back of the two integrated circuits.  This is a good thing to include because those can get rather hot.  The power supply I'm using outputs DC 12-volt 0.5 amp, which is just what I had on hand. It works all right even though a DC 12-volt 2.0amp supply is recommended.  I took off one star because the included 3 mm audio cable didn't work, but I had one already that I did use.

To say that I am pleased with this system is an understatement!  It arrived well-packaged and is easy to assemble.  The system features are more than I expected - Dual USB, Auto D.J., Bluetooth, and Wireless Sound Sync.  The speakers are crazy good and the Bluetooth capability is outstanding.  The only complaint is the CD player allows only one disk at a time however with the other features, maybe that's not so bad afterall!

Update on 12/29/14...This was the biggest waste of money ever. It crashes regularly, sometimes hourly, at least daily. There's no seeming correlation between activity and crash, and it often happens when I'm not even using it. Screw this; I am done with ASUS......

I'm on my second one of these, after the first was replaced. When it works, it's a great little device. Fast processor, better wi-fi reception than any of my other devices, brilliant screen, excellent battery life. However, this replacement has the same exact problem as the one I sent back: it frequently shuts down and restarts itself. It's not just going to sleep, but rather fully shutting off with a crack of the speaker and reload to the google screen. When it happens, all of the open/recent apps are cleared. This problem doesn't happen all the time, but when it does it will be a handful of times a day for a number of days...then it'll be fine for a couple weeks, then it starts all over again. It can be pretty infuriating, but i'm not using it for anything so critical that I'm willing to spend a couple hundred more for something else, or the same price for something that is inferior though more reliable.

Wireless headphones are all the rage right now, but sometimes I just want a good wired pair. When I'm using laptop especially, using Bluetooth headphones introduces lag and another thing that needs to be charged. These are excellent premium feeling wired 'phones that include an inline mic and controls if your device supports it. When used with my desktop that offers only a TRS plug (only two lines), it works as just a pair of headphones, with decent sound quality and bass response. On my LG phone or laptop which accept a TRRS plug (3 lines), the mic works as an input as well. My laptop didn't respond to the volume control buttons, but I think most phones will. Regardless, I'm impressed with the quality and presentation for the money this costs.

My friends and I have had so many pool parties this year and this speaker has been amazing. The speaker is like having a full sound system out at the pool and it's amazing. It's got amazing sound, bass, and it's loud, which is what you want out at a pool party. We love this speaker and are so happy with it.

I chose these because of an excellent technical review I read on Amazon. Very happy now. They fit snuggly. Have a great sound. Easy to pair with Bluetooth. There is a large ambient light on the exterior of one side that reminds me to turn them off when thru meditating so they don‚Äôt run down.  UPDATE: after about 5 months they quit working and will not charge. Dead battery. What a great.
AMINY U-Two Earbuds Wireless Headphones with Microphone True Wireless Earbuds Waterproof IPX6 Earbuds Wireless. Amazingly comfortable on the ears.  OZ

Very simple and easy to use.

Bluetooth setup is straight forward. Add your batteries to power it up and you‚Äôre good to go.

Got this for my wife for her mac book air and it provides the number key she felt she was missing
Really enjoy the Echo.  I did buy the speaker which allows you to use the device using Bluetooth rather than having to plug it in.  Better volume and sound quality. Great for under $100.

I received this as a free review sample five and a half months ago and it's been invaluable. If your laptop has a fully functioning internal fan this array will augment that and keep your laptop cool even in unairconditioned spaces on a hot day. That will definitely prolong the life of the internal electronics and the hard drive.

This fan array moves a lot of air, promoting excellent heat transfer. However, it can interfere with other USB peripherals if you power it directly from your laptop, and especially if you add even more peripherals to the ports integrated into this unit. That is because the power draw form USB ports may exceed the capacity of the laptop, especially if you are running it off an unpowered USB hub. I had that problem when I tried running this, a mouse and a speaker from my laptop. I moved this one to a powered hub and the problem was immediately resolved.

If you are set in your ways regarding keyboard height know that this raises a laptop 1 3/8 inches higher at its lowest setting. For me it took a day to become accustomed to the raised typing height, but since it solved a genuine problem the tradeoff was worth it. Just know that you will need to adjust to that and it may slow down your productivity for a day or two.

One final note: if you live or work in a high dist environment take the time to shut this fan array down and blow it out with compressed air. It will greatly prolong the life of the array and will also ensure that it doesn't become noisy.

This is a fun, useful tablet for the price. I love that you can make all different homepages. Love that you can pick wallpaper which you can't do with Kindle Fires which are the only other tablets I've owned. Of course, if you want a tablet
mainly for books, Kindle is the tablet you want. I also love all the apps you can get with the Samsung. What I don't like is the 8gb storage. I was under the impression if you got the 32gb extra it would integrate with the tablet rather than just be like a drive for mp3s and such. 8 gigs is barely enough for the apps you need. Also the manual tells you nothing about how to add things to the extra drive. Had to go to you tube. My tablet has connection issues from time to time.
I still really enjoy it most of the time. It can be super fast and plays things well from the cloud. Very light and attractive.

I am returning tablet. 8 gbs is just not enough. Extra storage cumbersome to use and doesn't work half of the time. Not easy like the cloud. Speakers unimpressive. I am disappointed because I thought I would like the Samsung. Also a battery hog. Will try the nexus 7.

This works great. We used this on vacation to watch a movie. Just plugged it into the iPad and both of us plugged out headphones into and voila.....great sound. Didn't lose any sound quality at all. It seems a little thin and I figured it would not last that long when it came but thought if it got me through the vacation I would be happy. That was a while back and it still is going strong.

Best splitter I have ever had

I was happy with the quality of this microphone. It worked very well. It seems like a little nicer one. It was very sturdy, which was good, because some of these are so thin they constantly fall over. It has a good stable base.

The sound was good. It picked everything up well. It was good for all the conference calls we are making now. I liked that it had an adjustable button. I felt like it was a decent value for the quality you get. I would recommend it.

I received my package yesterday. This was a 1 day delivery which was great! So far so good, everything is going great with my new headphone adapter. Thank you for such a great deal with the two for one.

This is a decent black backdrop for use in studio setups for photography or video. It can be held up using standard equipment like a rod and muslin clamps. I found, however, that the material has a touch of a sheen to it. It isn't a huge deal and honestly can be easily worked around, but it seems to reflect a little more light back at the camera than other backgrounds if you aren't careful. For example, a hair light that I've used before on other backgrounds spilled a bit onto this and it made a visible area of the frame brighter. I had to use some larger barn doors on the light to deflect it better, but the point is a more expensive and professional level material might not have needed that.
For the budget I'd say it is still good and worth using to get a black background on the cheap.

These fit really comfortably in the ear and around it. I find that these actually want to stay in my ear unlike other earbuds and I love the fact they wrap around the ear because it makes them so much more comfortable to wear. They also have really great sound and works perfect with my ipod.

The speaker is small and portable enough to fit into a large pocket yet can produce some very respectable volume with its 14W power. My daughter found this is a great way to turn a fanny pack into a hip-mounted sound system (she's a counselor in a summer camp and using this speaker a lot). The sound is surprisingly immersive and the fact that it is waterproof enough to use around the pool or in the rain is a huge bonus. Great speaker!

I have other speakers from this brand- they are a great price with really nice sound quality- even when your outdoors.
I opted for this particular one due to the fact it looks like a rock ü™®!
It blends in nicely into our patio set up and the kids can hook up to it and listen to their music while playing outside.

When I accepted a review sample of this holder I had visions of using it to entice my constant companion to sit in the back and play with her iPad. Indeed, this hooked right onto the two posts of the front seat headrest that would allow a backseat passenger to watch movies and do whatever else they use the iPad for. My companion did not take the bait, so I was left with a review sample that, frankly, I could not give away.

Necessity is the mother of invention and the best use for this mount was in my music room. This hooks into my [[ASIN:B000CDUDQG Belmonte Orchestra Stand Deluxe Black]] to mount an iPad and still have room left for sheet music and a [[ASIN:0961470143 The New Real Book - Volume 1]]. I have uploaded customer-supplied photos to show how this securely attaches to the stand and holds an iPad in place (it will work with any tablet up to 10 inches.)

I love how this holder allows you to place your tablet at practically any viewing angle, and also how it positively and absolutely holds the tablet in place. For the record, these claims apply equally to the dual headrest posts in my 2014 Outlander and to the music stand cited above.

Personally, the manufacturer is missing a major market because tablets are now common on stages and in studios and I suspect that there is a much larger market for this holder than significant others who refuse to be relegated to the back seat. I am so pleased with this holder that I have already recommended it to fellow musicians.
Wow, wonderful computer speakers. For music and games these speakers are absolutely fabulous for a desktop computer system. You will not find better 2.1 desktop computer audio anywhere.

IBI - THE SMART PHOTO MANAGER (US Version) makes it super easy to extract, back up, and share photos stored on my mobile devices. Instead of emailing cell phone photos that I want to share among electronic devices (an iPad Air (3rd Gen), a desktop PC, and a Samsung Galaxy cell phone), I can upload the photos to Ibi via a network connection with only a couple of clicks in the Ibi app.

No longer do I have to address an email, select and add the photos, send the email--and then reverse the process on a second device (open the email, download the photos, and save the photos to the device). All that‚Äôs necessary is to take the photos, open the Ibi app, choose ‚Äúimport photos‚Äù, select the photos, and hit the import button.

The photos are immediately uploaded to Ibi, and I can access them immediately on all of my other devices. There is no need to clutter up email or to consume precious storage space on my mobile devices, when all I want to do is share photos.

Ibi is extremely versatile. It allows you to sort and organize photos, and create Albums. It allows you to authorize certain people to email photos directly to Ibi. It allows you to set up different areas of Ibi for the use of individuals. It allows you to upload its contents to a PC or other even larger storage device by plugging in a USB cable (not included). It even allows you to stream your videos to a television set (using Chromecast or Roku apps).

Ibi is easy to set up, using Bluetooth. My iPad and my Galaxy phone both found the powered on (plugged in) Ibi in less than 30 seconds. Once set up, Ibi communicates via your home network‚Äôs Internet access. When your Ibi app is set up, click on Help, and download the complete user manual (a PDF file). The manual is easy to understand, and will enable you to get the most out of your Ibi.

Ibi is a small drive that easily fits on a bookshelf. It uses just one power cord. I really love this Ibi storage drive. It is simplifying my life.

+++++IMPORTANT NOTE: You should NOT choose ‚Äúautomatic backup‚Äù in the Ibi app Settings until you understand how the app works. With automatic backup enabled, Ibi will copy all of the photos stored on EACH mobile device, and you will probably get a lot of duplicate photos. For example, if you have been sharing and storing the same photos on an iPad and a cell phone, Ibi will copy the photos from each device. Worse, if you go into Ibi and delete the duplicates, Ibi will keep automatically adding the photos back as long as the photos still exist in storage on the two different devices.

You will probably want to use ‚Äúautomatic backup‚Äù when you first set up your Ibi. That way all of your photos will be automatically copied to Ibi to start you off. But you should turn ‚Äúautomatic backup‚Äù off before you start deleting duplicate photos. You will never have a problem with duplicate photos if automatic backup is turned off.+++++

I got this to replace a Toshiba fire TV that was showing it‚Äôs age. I didn‚Äôt like the fact that the Toshiba lacked some normal features that you would see on a normal TV like being able to adjust the aspect ratio. Crazy. It also came with extremely limited app storage and you couldn‚Äôt delete half the apps that were taking up the limited storage. So far the Google TV operating system seems faster and easier to use. The picture is gorgeous. I don‚Äôt have cable, so I rely on digital OTA channels or streaming channels. I had to tweak the color slightly for my taste, they had the oranges and reds boosted a little too much. But it‚Äôs really fantastic. The sound is really good too, although, I am not an audiophile, and I don‚Äôt rely on my TV as my primary music source like some people seem to do. It has a cool feature where the sound is customized to the acoustics of your room and your position in it. You run this calibration holding the remote at chest high and the TV plays some sounds that sounds like space invaders and the remote records them and adjusts the sound accordingly. Oh, yes, the remote has a microphone built-in do it so you can use voice search and other voice activated features. The TV was easy to set up, although the whole linking of the Google accounts and all the other things they want you to sign up for was a bit of a chore. I opted out of some and kept others. Your mileage may vary. The table top stand is the easiest to install that I‚Äôve ever seen, you just plug it into the bottom and there it is. No dealing with screws or anything like that. There are a decent number of HDMI inputs and two USB ports, so that‚Äôs a plus. Finally, while it says you need to people, I didn‚Äôt have two people and it was not that difficult to handle the TV. You do need to be really careful not to press on the LCD, which is a given for any TV. But the TV only weighs less than 30 pounds so it was easy to carry. All in all, it‚Äôs a really nice TV. I think it‚Äôs a little pricey, but you‚Äôre paying for the Sony name. And it does appear to be excellent quality.

Not recommended for daily use, as durability is lacking...

Vinyl ear covers on these headphones allow human sweat to build up around this area and find its way into the ear. Previous model was better in this respect. Balancing of R and L headphones seem better, but N/C feature looses effectiveness as wear and tear brings a looseness to any grip around human ears. Nothing from this system is expected to last more than 20 days of use. Expect failure soon after store warranty or sony warranty expires. Not durable. Not a sports headphone. Also, expect wires to loosen their ability to transmit sound in about 20 days or so, due to wear and tear. Again, not good for sports usage, like at the gym and on an eliptical machine. Sorry.
Hated these. Returned them. Made the earbuds more uncomfortable in my ear. The tackiness of the rubber material collects ear junk too.

Before buying the Kindle Touch 3G, I visited a Target store to see and handle the different Kindle e-readers. I immediately loved the simplicity, elegance, and convenience of the Kindle Touch 3G.

My sole desire is to read books easily without any distraction by the device that I am using. The Kindle Touch 3G is simple to use: "intuitive" is the word that ideally describes the operating features of this e-reader.

You can swipe the page to turn (as with any paper page) or tap.

Two toolbars disappear while you are reading, but both are accessed simultaneously with a simple tap at the top of the screen. A functional toolbar (allowing you to shop at Amazon, see battery status, etc.) appears at the top; a reading toolbar (allowing you to change font, etc.) appears at the bottom. Both are easy-to-use: just tap the choice you wish to make.

You have only two buttons to click on a regular basis: the on/off button at the bottom edge of the device and the Home button (looks like a tiny speaker) located just beneath the viewing screen.

You must hold the on/off button for approximately 7 seconds in order to power-off completely; otherwise, the screensaver will appear indefinitely.

Other features are available and are easy-to-master; however, you can begin reading out-of-the-box if you have a Kindle on your PC. The system automatically duplicates your archived items.

If you do not have a Kindle on your PC, you can begin reading once you register by entering the email and password that you use at Amazon.com. It is VERY, VERY easy to register: very user friendly. The screen and enclosed guide "walk you through" the simple process.

The Kindle Touch 3G is elegant. I also bought the case ($39.99). Together, the two items are almost as slim as a DVD and case rented from a Red Box. The design is sleek, slim, and pleasing to use.

Convenient? I found myself yesterday racing to an emergency room at my doctor's request. While waiting to be seen, I pulled-out my Kindle Touch 3G, began reaading a Sherlock Holmes short story, and had "no worries" about battery life or connectivity.

I heartily recommend the Kindle Touch 3G to anyone with an older relative who loves to read and may not have WiFi access OR who needs larger type in order to better enjoy the reading experience.

You know what happens when two former computer and electronics geeks get old and try to install a new Sony Z9F Soundbar? They darn near had a big argument. Voices were raised. Ugly things said. In the end, with my help (previously refused my help), the Soundbar got installed. He could not figure out why the Bluetooth wasn't connecting to the sub woofer. I found it in the book and we went through the steps manually. Now we have base and surround sound without using 5 speakers, a sub woofer and an Onkyo amplifier. The sound is already better and we haven't even hooked up the rear speakers. We are still exploring the different sound modes. Tomorrow the rear speakers will be installed and we will be watching a new movie I just got from Amazon: The Greatest Showman. I am expecting a concert-like experience. I believe my expectations will be met. There are so many features to explore, but so far, it is wonderful!

I received this as a free review sample and have been using it often for the past eleven months.

My main use is to house some microphones, adapters and miscellaneous electronics I use when performing as a musician. For that use this is ideal. Plus the inside and outside zippered pouches make this even more versatile.

The does an excellent job of protecting the delicate microphones and adapters that I store in it. I am not using the dividers as vertical separators the way they were designed. I lay them on top of the mics, and then store the cables on top. That arrangement is perfect, and the bag and insert are relatively light and sturdy.

Eleven months of use are testimony to just how truly gig worthy this bag is for what I use it. Based on this the insert will probably last a long time, and the overall construction, though lightweight, will probably last if this is used for its intended purpose of protecting a DLSR or other photo equipment.
I like this speaker! The case is very worth it, also!

These actually worked better than i expected. They are very thin so you can still put your earbuds in the case to charge without taking them off. I didn't have a problem putting them on because i read someone else's suggestion of putting them on inside out. My only complaint is that they slip off really easily. I've pulled them off several times just handling the earbud and they are harder to get on when they are not new.

These earbuds are a little on the bulky side (at least for me), but the sound quality is decent and I like the wire that attaches the buds. I've lost the separate bluetooth earbuds multiple times but the ear phones with the wire that connects to the device gets caught on EVERYTHING so these are a Godsend! Lasts for hours and charges up quickly. They eventually do hurt my ears after wearing them for an hour or so but then you should be wearing them for that long and my ear holes are on the smaller side even with the small silicone ear attachment. Really decent and worth it to have!

This DAMFEYA APPLE CERTIFIED LIGHTNING TO 3.5MM HEADPHONE JACK ADAPTER DONGLE (for iPhone, iPad, iPod) really works! It eliminates the need to purchase Bluetooth earbuds/headphones for any late-model Apple product that has a lightning cable port but lacks an audio jack.

To use the dongle, you plug it into your device‚Äôs lightning port, then plug your cabled earbuds/headphones into the dongle. Sound levels and playback are controlled by the Apple iOS.

I'll get the things I do not like about the review sample that I received out of the way first so I can finish on a positive note. Basically these phones have a distinct bias towards the higher frequencies, with a crossover to bass in my right ear and flat mid range response. In other words, if you are a critical listener you may want to consider other phones on the market.

I was able to get decent bass response in my right ear using my phone's EQ app, but could not get any decent mid range. The net result is music sounds one dimensional (even with the bass response in one ear.) I am guessing that the crossover threshold is such that you get high frequencies in one ear and low in the other, with the mid somehow cut out or deemphasized. For folks who listen to audio books and inspirational or educational material this will not be an issue. I will say that even with the volume cranked the high end did not break up or become tinny.

From a comfort perspective I had no problem wearing these for three hours with the medium buds that ship with it along with small and large ones. And I love the way they were securely held in place with the ear hooks.

Another feature that I like is the cable is flat and tangle-free. Of course, the nicest feature is they are, indeed, waterproof.

Bottom line: sound quality for music is lacking. However, if you are a casual listener and are into jogging, strenuous activities and wet environments these may be perfect. As much as I complained about the sound, I cannot find fault in the construction or ability to withstand harsh environments.

I've had these for years and I swear by the one pair I have (yep - I've had one pair for years, still just as good). I have tiny ears and most other earbuds will hurt after too long, but these are perfect. They will NOT fall out of your ears either. The sound quality is just as good as my apple headphones. They're also really easy to clean. Get them!
These speakers are mobile. I use them in the park, beach or anywhere I choose.  Light weight with incredible sound for their size. BRAVO

I bought one of these from another company for around $25.00.I was hesitant at first because it's a lot of money for a radio that you can only use with a headphone or ear buds but i took a gamble knowing it's a brand name and i figured that if i don't like it, i can always return it.Damn...this radio sounded great & i didn't know at first but it has a stereo sound and not like one of those radios that sounded tinny w/ a lot of echos (G.E.Radios are notorious for this!) I decided to keep it and the channels lock-on in the push of a button if you set your favorite channels.I never regretted buying this and after 6 years of daily use and dropped it numerous times, it's durability still amazes me and the thing just works EVERY TIME! you cannot buy anything better than this radio for the price in my opinion...if you do please let me know but it has to be $25.00 & lower.Good luck if you can find something like a Grundig radio for this price(they usually starts @ $60.00 & above)...

I love these earbuds! I had been using the tozo T10s for about 3 years before I got these (those still work awesome btw) but the sound quality on these is unmatched! they sound really clear and the noise cancelling just adds to that. the noise cancelling could be a tiny bit better, but the transparency mode is where it really shines for me. even with my old ones (that didnt have noise cancelling at all btw) i always found myself taking out one earbud so I can pay attention to my surroundings, but with these I don't need to do that! I also appreciate all the extra rubber caps and the fact that its USB-c charging :) overall 5 stars and I recommend these to anyone who wants good sounding headaches to travel with or bring to work.

These seem to be a pretty great option for over-the-head style headphones that fold for storage and are still affordable. My son's back to school list required a pair of headphones for some computer lab work, and he hates the earbud style ones. This is comfortable for both kids and adults, has a decent amount of noise isolation, and even has the inline mic for TRRS plugs like a phone if used in that type of setup. Extra points because they actually look more expensive than they are. My son loves them!
These headphones are amazing, sound is good quality and the bass is good. My son has the Samsung galaxy buds and my daughter has these. He actually likes these better. Would highly recommend

[[VIDEOID:9b88dadfbf58bb503f1928922845b685]] I ordered this dash camera after stumbling across a dash-cam video on the internet & realized I could potentially save myself a lot of hassle either in an accident or even a police encounter. I had one a few years ago when I had a long commute but these days I do most of my driving in rental cars & in unfamiliar areas I wanted something small, portable & quick to install. This camera just takes a second to stick to the windshield with the suction mount & it takes a mini USB plug for power. It comes with a 12V port adapter with a very long cord but I mostly power it with a short USB cord & my own adapter.
I'm very pleased with the video quality & sound. I have tested it with 1080p30 1020x1080 & 720P60 1280x720. Given the long record time with the included 32gb memory I will probably keep it at 1080p. The microphone picks up the sound of the turn signal switch which is good & also my singing to the radio which is bad.
I don't know how well the video resolution will come across in the attached video but I'm impressed with the image I get on my computer, especially files made at night. In reviewing the videos taken at 1080p (& with my filthy windshields), I have to be right behind car to make out its license plate. I have since maxed out the resolution to 1440P because of this but I'm not sure it made that much difference. The wide angle also tends to make things look further away than they are, the car in the last clip was much closer to my car than it looks in the video.
The included 32gb memory card holds over 4 hours of video at 1080p30 1020x1080 resolution & that's day & night. The camera will over-write files that aren't saved & it has a "save" button that stores files where they won't be over-written. The software also has an adjustable feature that automatically saves files where an impact is detected. In the 2 cars I have used it, a big pothole or bump in the road will trigger an incident on the medium setting (see my video). The camera will also take still a still picture when the impact detection is triggered or the file is selected for saving.
The camera doesn't have it's own battery but so far it has managed to save the last file if the car shuts off the 12v port or usb when the key goes off. I have mine to record short, 5 minute clips as a precaution against this, The clip length is adjustable up to 10 minutes. Without the battery, won't record any activity when the car is parked even if the car is bumped if the cord is not plugged into an active port.

Range limitations notwithstanding, this receiver has dramatically expanded the usefulness of my Droid X by allowing me to play my music through my home stereo system, as well as through my friend's [[ASIN:B001DLTDQC Bose SoundDock Series II Digital Music System for iPod (Black)]] (using an [[ASIN:B000068O51 Hosa YRA154 1/8 Male To Dual RCA Female]] to adapt the Belkin to the Sounddock since my Droid will not fit the iPod cradle.)

One reason I do not have a problem with the range is I am usually in the room where the stereo is, and sit fairly close to where I have the Belkin receiver located. And, with the Bose rig, that is for taking out to the patio or in the kitchen, so I am in line of sight and pretty close as well.

The signal is consistently strong between my Droid X and the receiver, and the sound quality is more than adequate for my old ears. The only thing I would want is for the Belkin receiver to automatically connect with my Droid X in the same manner that the [[ASIN:B003PPGOC0 GOgroove FlexSMART X2 ADVANCED Wireless In-Car Bluetooth FM Transmitter with Charging, Music Control and Hands-Free Calling for ANDROID, iPhone, Blackberry and Windows Smartphones]] I have in my car does. As it stands, I always have to go into my Droid's settings and manually connect the paired Belkin before I can transmit my music stream to it.

Overall I am very pleased with this receiver and intend to purchase two more (one for a PA system I own, and a dedicated one for the Bose Sounddock.)

I purchased this for [[ASIN:B011IH6MBO Bose Wave Music System IV]] so that I could wirelessly stream music, movie sound, etc. from smartphone, tablet, laptop, or other Bluetooth device.

Setup was easy. All I had to do was plug it into the Bose Link port.

Since this external adapter can only pair one Bluetooth device at a time, I had to turn the Bose on, then press AUX to cycle it to Bluetooth. Once there, I pressed the 5 button to make it discoverable. Since it remembers the last device I paired, I did not have to make it discoverable again. However, if I wanted to pair a new device, I had to press the 6 key until the unit beeped (about 10 seconds) and then it would clear the Bluetooth memory and become discoverable again.

One negative I did see with the external adapter is that the volume is about half that with Bluetooth enabled. What I mean by this is that a volume of 30 on the radio sounds like 15 when paired with Bluetooth. I found that I had to double the volume when using this adapter.

In summary, it works even if it is a bit cumbersome to get use to and the volume requires an increase.

I couldn't wait to get this! I had the PS-100 for several years and loved it, wore it out! So I stuck with the brand. I loved the idea of an amplifier and control so I could change the volume without having to reach for the radio. And I love the slim design of the speaker. My only complaint would be it doesn't have as much bass as the PS-100. But it's well worth it's weight in gold for us night music lovers!

These are very nice looking earphones with denim and fabric accents (denim on the band, fabric wrapped cord), recycled aluminum and even some 'wood'. All in all, very nice. They are lightweight as well and they fit comfortably - then again, I'm on the small side. The sound is good, nothing spectacular but consider the price range. The music I'm playing comes in nice and clear so I'm happy. You have a microphone feature with them to take calls, but being able to pause music or adjust volume would be nice as well.

My original Echo, purchased when the first invitations were sent out, was much beloved for years. She finally began to have performance problems last month. Stuttering, failing to perform tasks and simply not hearing her name anymore. Definitely time for an upgrade.

I like this Echo Plus, but I'm not thrilled with the short, fat, squatty shape over the tall, slender original Echo. This one doesn't fit in the same spot and just looks like any generic, knockoff speaker rather than Alexa. However, the sound quality of music and Audible books is superior and can be clearly heard at lower volumes than my old Echo.

I will say the coordination/communication between the physical Plus and the Alexa app is spotty and slow. In particular when using the Plus's built in temperature monitor. I had hoped specifically to use this to monitor our RV temperature when traveling for the safety of our dogs. Alexa does tell me the temperature has reached the preset warning level - an HOUR later!!! That's useless. I ended up spending more money to but a dedicated Wifi temperature/humidity monitor that alerts my phone via text and email literally within 90 seconds of the preset parameters. I love Alexa in general and we have 3 Dots, the Auto and this Plus, so we're fully integrated in the ecosystem, but this Plus isn't as good as the original, 1st generation Echo.

Pairing was easy.  Holds a good charge (6-8 hours).  Sound quality is fantastic.  Volume is louder than any other earbuds ever used and fit allows for noise to be isolated (best alternative to true noise cancellation) - actually takes some getting used to when you put these in and the outside world noise goes away.  Very similar to in-ear studio monitors.  Only complaint is they don't always pair the microphone which can be troublesome when trying to take a call, though the sound always pairs.

I've made 2 orders of these cameras,
for a total of 5 camera's for our home.
I also ordered longer cables, outdoor housing frames, and memory cards. With accessories, the cost averages out to be around $50/camera.

Great investment for those who
A. Work from home - alone
B. Have mentally ill children or care for adults w dementia
C. Deal with abusers or drug addicts
D. Deal w package theives.

I personally, get a lot of notifications about my outdoor cats and shadows of trees blowing in the wind. I get super excited about catching delivery men on my notifications.

Positives:
#1. I like them okay enough for the price.

#2. The app works fine for me on a Samsung S10E.

#3. The USB power cord allows for camera use with a power bank, like a game camera. (although video would have to be retrieved manually without wifi connectivity).

Only complaints:
#1. 12 second video clip notifications
#2. No recording of continuous movement is short time frames.

Take away:
You are unlikely to catch anyone red handed using these cameras. They are not going to stop thieves or abuse or accidents ... however, they do provide knowledge/time stamps of activity at home and reasonable evidence if you have the need and take the time to manually look.

We bought this one to take camping, great little radio. Long battery life and easy to charge, easy to work... I think the only thing that could be easier is changing folders on the sd card... otherwise, great value for money.

This is the perfect backpack if you are thinking about putting your life on hold and embarking on an adventurous trip across Europe, South America, or anywhere the spirit of travel might call you. The bag is made from a tough leather with ample storage space. There is a laptop sleeve in the inner compartment, and a hidden zipper on the back for critical documents.

All the pockets feature decorative straps and buckles, but they open and close with a magnet clasp. The shoulder straps have minimal padding, but this pack is small enough that it's not extremely heavy when full. It's a nice looking pack that will protect your gear and allow you to travel in comfort and style. This would be a great choice as a gift for a high school student or college freshman.

I received this pack as a review sample and quickly came to the conclusion that these are excellent for noise-free applications. The most critical test was when I used this cable to connect a pair of [[ASIN:B006MA9XXM Brainwavz HM5 Studio Monitor Headphones]] to my stereo. The sound was as neutral and noise free as when I used the high grade cable that came with the phones, so the claim of double shielding hold weight. I would not hesitate to recommend these to audiophiles or sound engineers.

In addition to the listening test I thoroughly inspected the physical characteristics. That revealed attention to detail like what appears to be copper cladding or gold plating on the tip, ring and sleeve portions of the connector. The barrel housing is also well constructed and is probably stainless steel. The strain reliefs on the ends are also well done and should protect the ends from internal breakdown even if you frequently handle the cable. The cable itself will stretch to a full twelve feet, but at rest is a little over a foot and a half.

What I did not test is the claim that this will fit most phones through their case. That's because the cases that I have on hand will accommodate regular cables. There is a chamfer on the barrel that houses the connector and it looks as though it will fit some of the more finicky iPhone 5 cases, but I cannot guarantee that it will for all cases.

These are top quality cables that should last a long time if properly handled and stored. If I do experience a premature failure I'll update this review to reflect that.
Goodness this was easy to install.  Nothing to plug into the wall.  I hooked up my almost dead from old age DVD player and my new one.  Works great with the amp.  No complaints.

I needed one of these to hold a projector.  For the price it‚Äôs very solid and well made.  It‚Äôs easy to use.  It would‚Äôve been perfect if I could attach the extended arm to the highest pole (3rd).  The arm will only clamp to the first and second pole.  I followed the advice of one of the reviewers to put something in the clamp such as a piece of sponge to get it to attach securely.  I would‚Äôve also liked for the extended arm to be adjustable in length.  Overall great quality for the price.

The Floor Cord Cover is exactly as it is listed in the description. I use this in my crafting room since I have my desk puled away from the wall. This covers the extension cord I use to power my sewing machine and desk lamp. I'm very pleased with this, and would recommend it to anyone that wishes to cover a cord.
Not much to say, bought to connect my Atmos speakers.work well in the spring loaded clamps.

So far so good. Don't know anyone with a soundbar and never had one so I can't compare to other items. I installed this in garage since my kids and i hang out there. Sounds great even with hip hop on pandora. I would suggest you read instructions since not reading instructions couldn't get it to work. Kicks ass after reading instructions
Great receiver.

I bought these for my children to use their tablets while staying quiet for appointments for their siblings. They are awesome. My husband loves them so much he‚Äôs been taking some from the kids and watching movies in bed while I sleep. I can‚Äôt hear a thing. Best headphones ever.

My son uses this for his 42‚Äù TV in his room. Good some for a small speaker. Not something that provides a bunch of bass but good enough for a small tv where you want a big improvement over the on board tv speakers.

this is a great speaker and i can't wait to get another one so i can pair them together. it cost a lot but you get a lot of speaker and if you like loud and clear music then you will love the JBL Extreme. i pair it with my echo dot and Alexa sounds very good. i highly recommend this speaker.

Hi, I am 54 and new technology makes me nervous. This is my first set of wireless earbuds. When I first opened the package and saw the enclosed instructions I got even more nervous. The print is for much younger eyes than mine. It is very small. Once I got into the instructions they were very simple. The book is only big due to the fact that it covers more languages than I could imagine.

It is very simple to charge up and get ready. Pairing them to my iPhone was also very easy. Switching from music to a phone call just requires a simple tap.

I can't compare these to any others since these are my first pair. I can tell you that these are very easy to use. They fit me right out of the box. I did not need to change any of the included pieces for them to fit me.

The charging/carrying case is nice. Everything with this feels and looks like top quality.

If you are looking for earbuds, check these out. I like them.

I have had my main Echo since the first days after the initial invitation to buy was sent out. I absolutely love Alexa and use her for tons of things daily. - she lives in the hallway between the living room and kitchen where we spend the most time. I added the Dot a month ago to bring the Alexa functions into our master bedroom.

The Dot is as easy to use as the big Echo and now that the two can be connected, we have music throughout the house at the same time. I also like the intercom skill so we can talk to each other across the house quickly. My one dislike is the tinny sounding small speaker n the Dot. I've grown so accustomed to the balanced, clean sound from the big Echo that the Dot sound quality was a let down with music. However, reading me the news, ordering Starbucks, reading my audio books, working as an alarm clock or intercom is smooth and works just fine. I especially like being able to control our tv with Alexa voice commands - we cut the cable cord and stream via Prime, Netflix and Hulu Live and Alexa has made searching for a specific show much more simple.

The head unit works great. Touch screen is sensitive like a touch phone. Bluetooth is easy to setup and very adjustable for mike placement. GPS is Garmin good. Apple car play work good. Buy a good backup camera to go with it. This is a solid multi purpose unit at a good price, $120 less than anyone else at $479.95.

I originally used an FM Bluetooth transmitter but that suddenly got complicated as it kept losing connection. So I returned that and switched to trying this product. This is not an FM transmitter so a radio station is not needed. Just plug it into your aux port, turn your car on and just connect to your phone. The volume and sound quality are far better as it does not rely on an empty FM radio channel. It comes in somewhat charged but I fully charged it anyway. Once fully charged, it does seem to last a long time. I'm not sure how long until it takes to disconnect on its own but keep in mind that it stays connected to your device even when you turn your car off. So, manual power off is ideal when not using. I keep this device plugged to a USB port in my car so it is consistently charged. You can plug this device into just about any non-Bluetooth audio device such as old 1980s speakers/earphones and it will make them Bluetooth compatible. It's very small, fits in my palm very comfortably so it's very portable. Currently using this in my wife's old car without built-in Bluetooth.

Felt like cheap plastic. Came with no original box just a plastic bag, I don‚Äôt know if maybe just Logitech sold it in bulk to the seller this way as it was easier for shipping and all for them. However, made me somewhat suspicious it could be a fake as it felt very cheap and other reviewers mentioned the same thing. I tried using the mute button on a face time call with my computer and after I clicked it the audio was lost completely, I tried messing with the audio settings on my computer and not even that would fix it. No other headphones I have ever used have done this and I have used headsets to work on a computer for 10 years. The sides of the headphones just said logi on them. I returned this!

This is a great value for 2 "classic" wired earphones. They come with multiple tips so you can install ones that will fit your ears (we have small ear canals in my family), and they do a decent job blocking outside noise when properly fitted. They get plenty loud (like, loud enough that the warning on my phone makes sense to give), and the sound quality is fine. It's not audiophile quality, but I'm not expecting them to be. I'm expecting them to be functional at this price, and they definitely are that! I'm giving one to my daughter to use with her music player on the bus ride, and the other I'm using as a backup in my camera case for video gigs (I had my over-the-ear studio monitors die on a job once, so having a no-frills backup pair is welcome) and maybe to throw in a backpack when I don't want to charge my wireless earphones for my phone. Thank goodness some phones still have a standard 3.5mm jack! So glad they are still selling classic earbuds, and these are a great value at a great price!

Battery life is still awesome but suddenly the sound cuts out on the left.  I can't believe the wire or connection has weakened since I haven't coiled or manhandled these at all.  Not only that but the first time a call came through, there was an ear splitting sound before the call announced.  The headset would also disconnect itself after calls interrupted the audio and the buttons simply wouldn't respond. Tried turning it off and had to plug to charge to have it reset. The buttons often glitched and I had to use phone controls.  I am so disappointed that these are no longer functioning, they didn't last long.

I have been on the search for wireless earbuds that sound ok and can handle calls, yet don't cost as much as Apple's... and I think this is IT! I had tried cheap brands, and wasn't surprised that the sound wasn't good. I tried expensive brands (even those costing almost the same as airpods) and while they had some excellent sound quality and noise cancellation, the callers couldn't hear me! I sounded under water and very compressed.
I kept having to resort to an old-school wired headset for calls, or bigger over-the-ear headphones with a good mic. But this set is that perfect blend! Decent sound quality, pretty intuitive to use, and the mic actually works for calls! And on top of all that, they are pretty affordable and from a name brand I recognize!
My daughter isn't into the look of the hoop-over-ear design, but honestly they are comfortable to wear and work exactly as expected so I can't help recommending these and singing their praises. Well done Skullcandy!

Upon connecting or disconnecting to Bluetooth, the speakers make an very loud annoying noise. It can‚Äôt be turned off or lowered if you want to use the Bluetooth. As my office is right next to the baby‚Äôs room, this is a deal breaker for me. Sad that Logitech has decided not to fix this via a firmware update as many others have also complained. Will be finding a different set of speakers to replace these.

This is a great cable for hooking up a USB-C peripheral or extending a rear USB-C port on a computer to the front of it. It is weighty and feels quite durable. A little thick and a little stiff (on account of the length) for what I would call everyday use - I wouldn't typically use this sort of thing for my phone for example - but quite suitable for hooking up an external USB-C SSD for example.

Not a fan of the long-ish USB-C connectors, they create quite the lever to apply substantial forces to USB-C ports. That's not exclusive to this cable, though, but the USB-C standard itself.

I need more of these! How often do you have an oversized plug that takes up two or three plug outlets? This solves that problem. With the swiveling heads, you can now rotate that oversized one out of the way. How wonderful. We always need more USB outlets in the house. This solves both problems.

I love this and need to order more. Get a few for yourself, you will like it also.

I just looked at the ones available and I don't see this model. Mine is all white with 6 regular household 3 prong plugs and two 2.4 amp USB outlets. The cord is a heavy grounded one. I guess I can't order more right now since I don't see this exact model.

I am impressed with the model I recieved.
Got this for pairing up my bluetooth headphones. Installed driver, plugged it in. Found headset and works great.

THE GOOD:
---------------
* The keyboard feels very premium, like an aluminum slab.
* Works on iOS, Windows, Android and even though they don't mention it in the manual, it works with Raspberry Pis too. I'm very happy about that because that's what I got this set for, to troubleshoot Raspberry pis.
* USB-Charging for both keyboard and mouse. This is what I look for now. I'm tired of changing alkaline batteries. I will no longer buy accessories that require traditional batteries.
* Can be connected by Bluetooth or 2.4G usb receiver, which is located under the mouse.
* Read the operating instructions on the Amazon listing page itself.

THE BAD:
------------
* Quality of mouse is not up to par with the keyboard. Mouse feels light & cheap compared to the keyboard, which is dense and high quality.
* Text on the manual is so tiny, so I read the instructions on the back of the packaging instead. This caused some headache because on the back of the packaging, it says to press FN + C to connect the Bluetooth. This does not work at all As it turns out, all the proper instructions are on the Amazon listing page. It's the same instructions as the included printed manual, except the text is big and readable on the web page. So you'll see the proper way to connect to Bluetooth is FN + "1" or "2." They need to remove the incorrect instructions from the back of their box to avoid confusion.

Overall, we'll go 4-Stars!

I'm very satisfied with this product. The auto-connect feature is my favorite part. I can leave my phone in my pocket, never having taken it out and still listen to my music on my iPhone (where it left off) and take/make phone calls as well. Very easy to pair my phone with the device. When my car turns off, the device is disengaged and disconnects from my phone. When I turn my car on, it takes about 3 seconds and then I hear a small beep noise, and now I can click the button on the puck which resumes my music/media.

Like my title says, this is exactly what I wanted. I wanted complete hands-free in my car, but didn't want to use any annoying bluetooth earpieces. The sound quality is good as well. I did get some loop noise in my 2008 Mazda 3 so I did have to buy a female-to-female 3.5 mm part from RadioShack for $5 which resolved the noise problem. I already had a cable with a noise loop shield so all I needed was this part. You can also buy little filter clamps at RadioShack which you would just place right on the cable and should reduce noise. The part was only $3, I just chose to use my existing part instead which I also bought on Amazon
([[ASIN:B0031U1ATQ Kensington Reducing SmartPhone including iPhone]]

Overall, 5 stars! Great product! The price is right. I'm a happy customer. It was shipped and received sooner than I expected. I am overjoyed about this product.
Great headphones. Quality is good.

Does exactly what they're described to do. Love them. This has made keeping my cords organized much easier, and my teenager loves the earbud cord keepers, as he no longer pulls his headphones out of his pocket in a tangled mess. Though I did have to use some superglue on one of the cord clips... My thick Samsung Galaxy phone charger cord seemed to be a bit too heavy for it and it kept separating from it's foam backing. Little bit of superglue fixed the problem right quick. :)

I so wasn't expecting this caliber of sound from such inexpensive earbuds. I use these at work when I need to view videos without forcing my entire office to listen along and needed to find an alternative to my Apple ear pods because they always fall out of my ears.

I tested them out by listening higher fidelity version of my favorite Steely Dan songs and OMG I wasn't expecting this. These super cheap Panasonic ErgoFit In-Ear Earbud Headphones are fantastic and deliver big sound. I heard nuances in the music that I've never noticed before. The sound is balanced, and I even had to turn the volume down on my computer because they are very efficient (loud).

I am not an audiophile, but it sounded perfectly balanced to my ears. The bass isn't boomy, and the mid-range and highs are crystal clear. They sound better than our larger Sonos sound system. In fact, I needed to drown it out because my musical tastes differ widely from my crew.

The cord was plenty long, and I was able to comfortably reach the headphone jack from my desktop computer on the floor to my ears without it interfering or forcing me to sit in an awkward position while using them.

It came with multiple ear cushions to accommodate smaller ears, and I needed to use one of them for my right ear. I am super impressed with these and still cannot get over the price of these outstanding earbuds. Just buy them, you'll be more than happy!
These are made well priced right and can make even a cheap LED lamp look nice and warm and soft reflecting off of them.

Using this little amp as an headphone amplifier.  Well built small unit.  Lots of inputs, little heat generation (no fan required).  Treble and Bass controls work very well.  This is a very nice amp at a very low price.  Most happy with this purchase!
I can use this adapter to connect my wired headphones into my iPad. The adapter works fine. Seems of good quality. Price is good.

For the most part I think webcams are pretty interchangeable for the needs of the majority of remote workers. Really all you need is a decent resolution and a microphone that isn't awful.
This webcam has 4K resolution the mic has intelligent noise reduction, so that's covered.
There are some extras that set this webcam apart from others I have used. The extra wide 120 degree view is very nice, especially when paired with the autoframing feature. This is the most easy, straight from the box device I have used for remote work.
Plug it in, and it interfaces seamlessly with Zoom/Teams/Webex/Skype, whatever you use. Everytime I used this I look and sound great, often far better than those on the other side!
~~~I hope this REAL review was helpful!~~~

Love everything about these headphones! They are well cushioned on the ear pieces which makes them comfortable to wear! The piece on the top of the head is also cushioned for comfort and to prevent hair pulling. It‚Äôs great that these are wireless. It‚Äôs so easy to pair with your Bluetooth device! They also sound amazing! Noise canceling works well too! They come with a USB plug for charging and a cord if you wish to listen to plugged in instead of wireless. The case is so nice too! Even came with a scented packet inside which smells lovely!! Outstanding quality at an amazing price!

These headphones are already getting a workout!  My granddaughter had her heart rate in just minutes out of the box, and, after taking them on a run, she had nothing but good things to say about them.  First, she enjoys the fact that there is nothing on her head - just a wire connection lightly on her neck.  Second, the sound of her favorite music left her almost speechless to describe - clear, sharp - the best sound quality she had ever heard - and to be able to take this with her on a walk or run, was wonderful!  Third, these headphones have turned out to be a motivator - she now looks forward to the exercise, is choosing music suitable for her yoga exercises, etc.  Wow, it's great to see the smile on her face and the difference these headphones have made in her physical activity.  She reminds me that they are also great for  just "chilling out"!  I had hoped to try these out for myself, but it looks like possession is nine tenth of the law!

First of all, the signal quality is great over my 300' of CAT5e cable going from my entertainment system in front of my room to my projector around the back (cable goes behind walls and snakes around furnishings to get where it needs to go). It is fast and responsive, and the lag seems minimal if any. I love that it can also be used as a pass through, and that it only requires power on ONE side! My old HDMI extender required a power adapter on both the tx and rx side, but this can actually send power over the network cable (PoE) so that the other side does not need its own adapter. Now THAT's awesome!
This is one of the primary reasons I was interested in this, as there are two times I use such an adapter: When I use my projector instead of my TV for movies, and when moving a camera around at an event that I want to send a live feed back to a screen or streaming box for. Currently I have to supply power at both ends of the network cable, but I imagined ONLY needing power on the receiver, and having THAT power the transmitter. For example, in the case of the camera, I could have the screen receiving the signal send power to the transmitter by the camera using PoE and be somewhat more free of tethered power on that side. Also, when using the projector, I could turn on the outlet controlling the projector via remote and have it power on the transmitter behind the TV as well. Less wires and outlet spaces where already difficult / congested is good! THE PROBLEM, however, is that this thing misses its potential by only sending power from the TRANSMITTER! In other words, I can send power from the tx with PoE to the rx side, but the RECEIVER can't power the transmitter! It only goes the same direction as the HDMI signal. This, to me, was disappointing as that's the side I wanted to save from having more wires to plug in. Not the receiving side. That side is never an issue to supply power.
So I was a little upset about that. But otherwise, it is a solid product that seems to do what it claims to, and so far seems more reliable than my previous setup. If it could send power using EITHER side, it would be perfect! So close this time!

I received this as a free review sample. Although the Note 4 is not on the list of supported devices my Note 4 came up immediately on my monitor's display, so I can confirm that it works with that phone. It also worked with my Tab Pro 12.2 tablet.

This is a quick and inexpensive solution to connecting compatible phones and tablets to monitors and TVs. Frankly I have been using a wireless dongle for that, but this, plus an HDMI switch, has allowed me to access my monitor using my old Note 3 phone as a controller (it's otherwise been sitting around collecting dust since I upgraded to a Note 4.)

The cables are thin gauge so I am not sure how much wear and tear they would sustain if you were constantly connecting and disconnecting devices. I have been using this for a week, but the Note 3 to which I am connecting it is relatively stationary.

For devices that are supported this is literally plug and go - no drivers, and I did not even have to invoke screen sharing. As soon as I made all of the connections my phone's screen was immediately displayed on the monitor.

I thought this was the coolest addition to our Alexa devices... BUT The sound is horrible; it sounds like a busted speaker or a faulty ear piece. The sound has no type of tone or roundness to it. Very disappointing. You have to speak loudly for voice recognition also. I‚Äôm disappointed when I was so excited to add this device.

THE GOOD:
--------------
* Nice build quality. Good metal case.
* 4 HDMI port in, 4 USB link ports, 1 HDMI port out.
* 3 usb ports to share
* 2 audio ports to share (1 optical, 1 regular stereo)
* 1 Mic port to share.
* Remote control included.

THE BAD:
------------
* I've seen other packages that provide you with all necessary cables. This package has no cables. For the price, I feel cables should have been included. It's going to cost more than $10 for you to buy 5 hdmi cables and 4 usb cables. I'll provide a link to this other set once I'm done reviewing it.

* Why would you need a KVM switch? You can share a single set of keyboard, mouse, speakers for multiple pcs. You can use your same PC monitor to view the Fire Stick, play PS5, Xbox, etc. There is no need to hook up different speakers, as long as you hook up your main speaker to the optical or stereo ports.

I will subtract 1-Star for including no cables. A remote is included, but when you use a KVM at the table, your hand just reaches out to press the switch, so a remote is unnecessary. 4-Stars.

I have tested and reviewed many bags and backpacks and this is, by far, the best one I have reviewed this year.

There are so many features to love about this pack.

First the outer shell is made from super durable polyester fabric that truly is waterproof - not only is it waterproof but the zipper system is as well. I have had this pack in absolute downpours without anything inside getting wet. The upper carrying handle is reinforced and ergonomically made to fit your hand so lifting and carrying this, even when packed is easy. The straps on the side are excellent for cinching everything in tight when it‚Äôs packed so nothing shifts around. The shoulder straps have extra thick honeycomb padding as does the panel that rests against the back when carrying, making it not only comfortable but allowing for airflow so you won‚Äôt get so hot with it on your back.

This packs interior has room to store far more than any other backpack I‚Äôve reviewed for quite a while. I‚Äôm able to fit my 17‚Äù laptop in that section with ease along with all of the necessary accessories. In addition to that there is another heavily padded area where I store my iPad. These areas completely open to lay flat - perfect for TSA screening.

As with the majority of modern backpacks there is an external charging port (as is typical, the external power supply is not included) and there is a perfect location for holding your power supply. There is a port for leading headphone wires from the interior out.

I have put this pack to all sorts of real life tests over the last couple of months and it has continually impressed me with its outstanding performance. This has become my go to bag and I most definitely recommend this one.

Thanks for reading my review. I enjoy writing them as I value reading other‚Äôs reviews when I‚Äôm making a buying decision. I regularly update my reviews to reflect any changes I may discover and to include helpful tips you may need if you purchase the product. I will always make every effort to answer any questions I can as it is my pleasure to help.
I was actually very surprised at the quality of sound this produces for something so small and inexpensive. I use it regularly, and I love it. It's a rugged little speaker that will get the job done.

Like most of the other reviewers I received this as a review sample along with a [[ASIN:B00N38TQJC Sabrent Premium 4 Port Aluminum USB 3.0 Hub]]. This will actually work with just about any of Sabrent's hubs as well as most other 5 volt (DC) devices on the market that require up to 4 Amps of current.

The barrel connector comes with an adapter to a larger size barrel connector to cover Sabrent hubs. I have checked every source I could find to get the barrel connector specs, but none are to be found. This is frustrating to say the least because this is truly a multi-purpose power supply that can be used on non-Sabrent products. Since it is not claimed to be universal I am giving it five stars because it works perfectly with the hub with which I tested it.

One feature that I particularly like is the fact that the cable is heavy duty with good strain reliefs on both ends. This is not your typical, flimsy power supply cable. Another thing I like is this runs cool even with constant use. I am using it to power a hub with a disk drive and both the hub and this power supply are running cool even after a twenty-four hour period.

This is capable of providing up to four Amps, but will only 'push' what the device requires. What that means is if you are powering four devices that draw .6 Amps each this supply will only push 2.4 Amps, so there is no worry about overloading. On the other hand if you are attempting to power a hum that requires over 4 Amps this is not the proper power supply and will not work.

If you own a Sabrent powered hub this is a safe choice, Do make sure you know the total current draw of the devices into the hub and make sure that the total does not exceed four Amps.

[[VIDEOID:aedbd047bdcee111326af43f1b70c93c]] After experimenting with several small speakers to use with my Echo Dot, I became enamored with the Doss Soundbox Touch because it had the best overall sound quality compared to other speakers in its price range. Naturally, I couldn't wait to try the Doss Touch Plus when it came up for review.

It is larger than my original Doss Soundbox, and I was expecting the same well rounded dynamic range with a little more volume. This speaker paired effortlessly with all of my devices.

The touch controls are my favorite. It not only gives this speaker a sleek modern look, but they also make it a breeze to change functions effortlessly. It's like swiping my phone screen between apps and I have become spoiled by not having to push or press anything. It sounds like a small thing, but once you live with it you will find anything that that requires more effort to be an inconvenience.

The Soundbox Plus boasts an increased battery life when using it without the light feature. The light show is fun, but it's not a big draw for me since I use this near my computer monitor and it's somewhat distracting.

The sound quality is decent, but it is not what I had expected. It has larger drivers and moves more air, so there is increased volume but the sound quality degrades and becomes too bright. I hear mostly the mid and high ranges with slightly muddled bass. However, at a lower volume, the sound quality improves and becomes more balanced. I love the touch control features, and it's attractive enough for use in every room.

As a side note, Doss customer service is second to none. The best I have ever experienced outside of Amazon's support team.

Ok, to be fair I work with cameras for a living. I wasn't expecting this to compete with my cinema cameras or even popular DSLRs for video, but I was expecting it to at least hold up to the standards people are expecting from cell phone cameras these days. It doesn't. Aside from filling a 4K frame, there aren't a lot of positives to say about the video quality.
To be fair, this has a LOT of advantages over using a cell phone. Recording for long lengths of time onto an SD card is a big plus, not the mention the ability to mount it to a standard tripod and have accessories like a mic and light attached to the body (which are all included!). It comes with a wide angle lens (that is oddly called "macro", but no- it's not for macro shots, its for going wider) which screws on to the front, as well as a handle mounting bracket, an LED light and a microphone. It even comes with a 64GB card, a spare battery, and not one but TWO useful carrying cases (a large one for everything, and a smaller one for just the camera solo). But that's about all the positives I can say about it. If you are outside with a lot of light, you can get decent shots, but this isn't a zoom lens, the zoom is digital only. You can go wide with the external lens or just stay at a fixed medium without it. So no closeup shots for soccer moms. The dynamic range when using it indoors was pretty bad, worse than your average mid-range cell phone. Forget about low light. But that's ok, because the ergonomics of a camera make it better than a cell phone, right?
Well, sorta. Holding it with the strap and the flip out screen is nice. But the UI is confusing, it's hard to go back and watch clips you took because everything is kind of sluggish and not intuitive- once we went past the first page of recorded clips, it was really difficult to move to the next page without accidentally clicking and opening a clip for playback. It just feels really laggy to navigate. Then there's the mic input... it's actually a proprietary plug that goes into the charging/USB plug, and gives you a pigtail for USB on one side and a mic input jack on the other. Odd, considering it COMES with a mic, you'd think it would have an input directly on the body. But no, just this weird mess of wires. Everything about this feels like jumping through a hoop to make it do what you want, and at the end of the day you have to wonder if you couldn't just be better off getting a mic adapter for the cellphone you already own and putting it in one of those holster cages.
Speaking of cell phones, this does have an app which supposedly lets you remotely control and perhaps even copy files from it, but I didn't get that far. I tried to install the app but then gave up when I decided I didn't want to grant this all the permissions it wanted from my personal phone. And I didn't think the video quality was worth it either.
Oddly enough, I kind of like the accessories it comes with. The LED light is pretty nice, the mic isn't terrible either. But for the money, I feel like I would have rather skipped those accessories and just gotten a better camera for a little bit more. It feels almost like they realized this camera was a hard sell so they beefed it up with lots of a accessories for the price.
In conclusion, you DO get a lot of accessories for the money. It's not the worst camera I've ever used, and you can't really get a set with everything you need for any less so I'd say it's worth at least 3 stars for being a functional kit. But I can't really imagine a scenario that I would recommend it.
