I got sick and tired of buying unique cages for each camera I use. This cage is great because it is the most universal design I've seen while still being solid and relatively compact, and most importantly: THE BATTERY DOOR CUTOUT FITS VIRTUALLY ANY CAMERA I'VE TRIED WITH IT! This was the biggest reason I wanted it. I happen to own many different types of cameras (Canon, Panasonic, Sony, etc) and all of them occasionally get used on jobs that require attached recorders, microphones, power supplies, etc. But until I found this, I needed specific cages that allowed access to the battery on each one, otherwise I'd have to remove the camera during a shoot to replace a dead battery, which is just unnecessarily complicated. I feel like this cage is a great addition to whatever I'm using now, and likely whatever I end up using in the near future.

As a few people pointed out, the rail system on the bottom has a knob that somewhat obstructs part of the battery door opening on some cameras (I noticed this on my A7s, other types of cameras may still get enough clearance). Someone on youtube showed that they were able to remove the knob to keep it accessible, but personally I just wanted the cage part. The cage itself has the same mounting holes as the bottom of the rail adapter, so you can just leave the rails off and attach a tripod QR plate directly to the bottom of the cage, which is what I usually do. I did one time try using the entire package decked out, with the rails, a matte box and follow focus attached... I got around the battery door problem by using a dummy battery with a DC wire that attached to an external power supply (I built my own adapter, I won't go into the details now but I'm pretty proud of it!). So I was able to swap batteries via an adapter mounted on the cage instead of under the camera. But this was a much more complicated setup than I usually work with. For normally daily use, I use the cage without the handle or rails, and with the camera attached it actually fits where my camera usually goes in my gearbag. I have the handle and rails handy if I ever need them, but the price is great for the cage alone!

**update - no more drop issues - in my review below I was having internet drop-outs, but I found out it was an issue with my source wifi connection. The CC Vector device is amazing and I'm super happy with it. The best way to sum it up, is that it's not a super "smart" device - so you'll need to connect to a strong source wifi signal - if you get ANY kind of drop out issues with the source wifi, you'll have issues. But if you have a WIFI source that is strong and consistent, this will allow you to connect to it from very far distances. I'm very happy with it!

**original review below**

We needed to get a wifi signal across a property to another building about 600 feet away, a property with scattered trees between the 2 locations. Nothing seemed to work, and I was hesitant to spend $300 for a solution, and I didn't want to pay for another internet line to the other building. I tried a few cheaper $100-$150 solutions, but they simply didn't work. The CCrane kit worked right away. It did take about an hour or so to assemble and setup, and it was by far the easiest long-range wifi solution in terms of the technical setup - it's no different than setting up a basic wifi range extender/repeater.

We connected the CCrane repeater to a 200Mb/s wifi connect connection, and with a 60% signal we were getting only about 10Mb/s download rate - it was slow, but usable. We generally range from 45-75% signal performance with where we setup the receiver antenna. I would HIGHLY recommend putting it as high as you can - we got about double performance when we put the antenna 15 feet high vs. 6 feet high (6 feet high gave us 10MB/s performance, 15 feet up we got about 18MB/s performance)

After a few months of on and off performance, I started to get tired of the slow and unreliable WIFI signal. It worked...good enough for browsing, but not good enough for taking business calls, Zoom meetings, etc. Wifi calling would constantly be unclear. We also ran into dead internet issues: a few times a week the wifi signal seemed fine, but would not allow for any internet activity and I'd have to turn off and turn on the wifi rebroadcaster to make it work again.

I almost gave up, but I decided to try to use the ethernet ports on the back of the unit. There is one wifi antenna and 2 ethernet ports on the CCrane unit. I simply stopped using the CCrane wifi, and I plugged an Asus AC1200 wifi router into the back of the CCrane unit. BOOM - we went from 10Mb/s performance up to 60Mb/s performance. NOW everything feels right. This number would be accurate - CCrane does say you get about 1/2 the performance of the base internet because it's a repeater and that's what they do.

Unfortunately I still get random internet drops - the CC Vector repeater will say it's connected to the internet, signals are strong, but the internet will not work. This happens about once a day and we have to reboot for it to work again. I'm currently working with their support to see if this can be resolved. (review update - this was because of an issue with the source wifi signal - I ended up connecting a Wavlink Ariel HD2 bridge to the source WIFI router, and now we're getting very strong and consistent speeds without any dropouts).

So all-in-all - I'm happy with it. The included CCrane wifi could use some technology improvements and updates, but I think they make these things for random couples who RV around the country and don't need blazing internet.

Once you bypass the CCrane wifi and use the ethernet in the back with your own high performance WIFI router, you'll notice much improved performance.

I hope they update the built in WIFI - it would have been nice to just use one router with a $300 setup!

This is one AMAZING tablet! I bought one of these yesterday which is Cyber Monday out of curiosity. I already have a couple of tablets but Amazon's fire 8 HD is one that I'm missing and since it was on sale, i bought one. I wasn't expecting much that it would be good or better than my Apple Ipad Air 2 which I bought about 2 years ago but I was really surprised when I got this tablet. Well for one, it's great for the price PLUS you can actually afford losing this because of it's cheap price. But mind you: This is one of those things that it's just too good to be true for the amount of money that you plunked to get this. I put it into a gruelling test and it actually passed with flying colors! From installing Netflix then Pandora then Popcornflix to mytuner-radio to spotify, This baby did it all and it ran smoothly. For the money I payed for my Apple Ipad Air 2, I was really regretting that i should have got this instead of plunking down hard earned $700.00 money + warranty and all applicable taxes. This one amazing tablet ran everything that I installed and then some plus a 12 hour battery isn't too shabby. I looked on YouTube on this tablet on how they dropped this thing from a height of 7 feet facing screen FIRST and nothing happened to it. No cracks no dents it restarted and it ran like a champ! This is what convinced me to get one of these and now it's my very favorite tablet because it's a lot lighter than my Apple Ipad Air 2. I'm ordering a ring that you could attach to the back of this tablet so i can hold it all day long and I'm planning to run this tablet to the ground if it's possible. for sheer durability and dependability as a choice, you can't go wrong with this tablet and apparently, amazon really did their homework on how to make a very sturdy tablet! Highly recommended and I'm seeing this as a contender to the Apple tablets.

Got this for my husband as a surprise. He is thrilled! Had it up and running in minutes thanks to well written instructions. It has great sound for something so small. Plays CD's charges iPods, has a clock and a radio. We live in a really off the track area and radio signals are hard to get sometimes. This played with excellent sound and had a really clear, static free signal.

Only downside is that you need a special audio cable to hook up your I Pod to this. It clearly states that in the directions, so no big deal.

All in all a nice piece of equipment.

I can't stand the trend toward those little cylindrical in-ear headphones that constantly fall out of your ear unless you push them directly into your brain stem.

That said, I loved these earbuds when I initially got them. The head hit nicely in my ears. It was flexible; it had some give. They were comfortable and worked well. Note: I use my headphones about 7 hours per day between phone calls and music/podcasts while I work.

The punchline: about 4 days after it was too late to return them, the right speaker blew out. I don't listen to anything very loud. I'm not an extreme athlete who wears these while running through mud or fire. I would classify my usage as "typical". And they broke.

I moved on to a different brand, however I may try these again when those break. I'm not sure why I cannot find < $100 earbuds that don't break after a month. Had these not broken they would've been 4-5 stars.

I received this as a free review sample. M.Erb's extremely detailed and helpful video review of May 14, 2016 covers this in a great deal of depth. I'll add my thoughts and reasons why I also rated this five solid stars.

First, I have tested and used at least a dozen dashcams, many of which were excellent in their own right. However, the shortfall in each was the screen and a complicated array of controls. With this one your screen is your smartphone or tablet, and your controls are those that are provided with the app you need to download (for free) to control the camera and settings. There is a separate remote control, which is really just a clicker that does one thing: triggers a short video and a snapshot.

Another thing I personally love is the mounting kit. This one, properly used, will run your power cable in an unobtrisive manner (well, as unobtrusive as possible), and the cable is sufficiently long to run the cable from close to my rear view mirror to my dashboard lighter socket in my 2016 Outlander. Other dashcams either forced you to put up with dangling cable or - in one case - have the power and video feed cables professionally installed. Plus this uses a standard USB cable with USB A on one end and micro USB on the other. Some dashcams require a proprietary cable with a barrel connector that makes it difficult to replace if necessary.

Video quality is not award winning (indeed, the camera lens is a fisheye), but is still more than sufficient to capture accidents and even scenic drives. You can also use this for other than a dashcam. I discovered that will fit in a standard microphone clip that fits a Shure SM58 (i.e., a very common size.)

You can use up to a 64GB micro SD card, which will store almost eleven hours of video. Most dashcams are limited to 32GB. The instruction manual is adequate, but not comprehensive, and it also does not cover the software and its capabilities. I hope the company rectifies that, which will make this dashcam even more user friendly, especially for novices. However, most folks do not want to wade through a manual anyway, and the one that comes with this will get you going.

Bottom line: as far as dashcams go, this one is probably the easiest one to use that I have come across. My FAVORITE feature is simplicity that allows my phone or tablet to be the screen and controls.

Amazing sound quality - P7 manages to keep details and dynamics of original sound. B&W design team did a very good job to combine great look (one of the best looking headphones) with very comfortable fit. I use P7 for hours without feeling any discomfort.

when I had used this to keep an eye on a new pet from work, it was awesome!  I'd buy it again!  very good images across a 20 foot range.  audio is good too.  worked very well so I could keep an eye on cats for 3 traveling days.  gave me a piece of mind to see them playing and sleeeping.
The only slightly negative comment is that the audio is a little tinny and not very loud. Alexa is much louder and have a wider range.

Works perfectly to store my headset and it's charging wire. Sticks firmly through rubber to the front of my nzxt s340 case. I like that I do t have to hide the headset, clutter the top of my PC or stretch the headset out to clamp on something it shouldn't be on anymore.

These fit great and prevented us from buying a new headphone set. The old ear protectors were coming off in tiny bits on my wife's ears.
Also went on easily. Just held flap to earpiece with one finger and wrapped the band around the headset a little at a time. On in 10 seconds.
We have two sets one for living room and one for bedroom, so will be buying these replacements for BR when they wear out next. As far as I can tell they are original pieces. Work great.

I selected this clamp for working with my mirrorless camera. There are times when clamping to a surface or a pole is more practical than setting up a tripod or monopod, so this kind of solution is useful in those cases. It's a decent clamp system and it works well, though it does require some messing with it to get used to it if you've only worked with a tripod in the past.

This idea is simple here. This is a clamp system that includes a couple of adapters for attaching cameras and accessories so that the camera can be held steady without having to set up a big, bulky tripod or having to hold the camera by hand. It comes with two clamps that can be connected via the ball joint adapter so that the system can convert to an anchor support for a pole as well (not the intended use, but practical nonetheless).

Included in the kit is a 1/4" adapter that connects to a standard camera mount (like my mirrorless), and an adapter for connecting a GoPro. It can be used directly with a cell phone, but it is not ideal for that and does require being creative with the clamps (not recommended); better is using the clamp to hold a selfie stick which in turn holds the camera.

The clamps hold tight as do the ball joints. It takes a little bit of fiddling but getting this set up exactly as desired is possible so that you can get the perfect angle. Further, the system can hold a little weight and has no trouble at all holding my mirrorless camera steady.

It seems to be made well and so far I have not had any issues with loose screws, stripped components, wobbly connectors (when properly tightened) or slipping grips. It's still early on in working with this system but so far I see no red flags.

I am happy with this clamp set-up and I will get some good use out of it. It's a practical solution when a tripod or other mount is not workable. It's not particularly expensive, either.
All the electronics were alluring. But I didn't know what I know now. Does not come Bluetooth accessible. Sound is poor quality.

Love these headphones! Got them to use at my office to help block out distractions. Look great, work great, no complaints. The parts are plastic though so it doesn't feel as luxe as it looks.

This WAS a nice wireless combo: keyboard a decent size and the F-keys not terribly small. Mouse a decent size and very responsive.

Now not quite four months later, the mouse and "unifying receiver" stopped working completely despite battery changes, rebooting PC, uninstalling/reinstalling the 'unifying software', and trying various USB ports. FLAT OUT STOPPED WORKING.

If you want to replace your receiver and mouse (and maybe the keyboard) frequently, this is the combo to purchase. If you want longer lasting ... look elsewhere.

I ordered the 'ChromLives 1/4'' Dual Camera Mount Flash Bracket Extension Bar 10.6'' Straight Flash Bracket Tripod Mount Bracket for DSLR Camera LED Light Flash Light Microphone and More' for review.
This is just such a simple piece of hardware yet so very useful. It works as intended and I have put it to good use by mounting my flash to the side of my Canon 60D rather than where I used to have to mount it, which was on the Hot Shoe. This gives me the Hot Shoe to ad a boom mic or my remote shutter receiver. Overall I am very happy with this bracket and think it is of great value!

When i first got these i was living out in the woods in a very rural area and i gave them 5 stars. The sound quality of both the headphones and Mic are beautiful, the surround sound is mind-blowing, and i loved being able to walk around my house listening to stuff without bothering my family.

I have moved into an apartment complex recently and these are now a useless decoration. whenever I try to use them there is so much interference that it causes the connection to the wireless usb to cut out all the time, to the point they are unusable. it comes with a nice long cord to charge it, but even plugged in it only sends data wirelessly, so they are fully powered and unable to maintain a connection.

amazing headset, but with this crippling flaw they are useless in dense population areas.

If you have a lot of devices to control in one area, this is the device for you!  I have it controlling a Epson projector, Fire TV Cube, LG Blu-Ray Disc player, Bose BT speaker, and a few smaller gadgets.  It was easy to set up, but I am in IT, so YMMV.  The hub is my only complaint.  If the hub is lost, the remote does nothing.  With their old version, there was no hub.  That meant no control through cabinet doors if the device uses IR, but it also meant the remote worked no matter what.  My big complaint is that the hub went offline twice and both times I had to open things up and reset it before my remote would work.

An excellent microphone that can be used for recording lectures and conferences.
Pros:
- Good stereo sound quality.
- Very good directional mode
Cons:
- Requires 3V battery.
- It is not good for voice recognition

For more than a month I've been bounced between rehabilitation facilities and the hospital and quite often there's some patient who's unwell and acting out, yelling, screaming, throwing things. If you've ever spent a while in either type of facility you know the experience. When I saw these headphones available for review I jumped on the idea. I had a friend deliver them and where do I begin?
* They barely fit in the mesh like bag that offers NO protection to your headphones.
* I think I have a fairly normal sized head but they fit tight on my ears not painful for short term but extended wear could be an issue.
* Sound is muddy, bass is overwhelming, even after adjusting my equalizer over and over. I finally got them to sound ok, just ok.

Fit isn't great. Sound isn't great. Carry bag isn't great. I'll use these until I get home and can find a better pair. Not impressed.
Too big to be worth it...it's not very portable. You can get as good/better sound from a smaller speaker. Overall, nice design, though.
Bought to use as a bathroom speaker since it is water resistant. Even at it's loudest it is still hard to hear while in the shower unless it's in there with you.

If you read the product description carefully, you won't waste time (as I did) trying to use this PLAYSTATION 4 UNIVERSAL MEDIA REMOTE to navigate PS4 games (e.g., Journey, Minecraft). The PS4 remote uses Bluetooth to turn your PS4 on and off, and to control and navigate PS4 media (e.g., DVDs), but only controls PS4 media. The PS4 remote can also be programmed to turn your TV, Cable Box, and Audio Receiver on and off, and to control and navigate those devices (assuming they accept remote Bluetooth operation).

The PS4 remote performs the advertised functions very well, and I'm happy with it. The main thing I wanted was the PS4 on/off feature, so that I wouldn't have to fool with the skinny button on the PS4 box when I wanted to play a DVD. But I also wanted something that would make it easier to navigate DVDs. I'm not much of a gamer, and I find the game controllers awkward to use. With the PS4 remote, the forward, back, play, and arrow buttons work "normally" (like any TV remote).

NOTE THAT once the PS4 remote is paired, you will turn the playstation "on" by pressing the big PS4 button, but you will turn it "off" by navigating to the PS4's power settings (in the display). (The PS4 remote doesn't have a "sources" button for bringing up the output options on my Samsung Smart TV, so I still need a second remote for selecting the PS4 output.)

The Bluetooth pairing and setup for the PS4 remote is straightforward, but you need to follow the directions in the accompanying booklet "to the letter". You have to visit several locations in the PS4 settings to add the remote to the PS4 device list, and then complete the setup.

Programming the remote to turn on another device (TV, Cable Box, Amplifier, etc.) is exactly the same as programming any universal remote. You turn on the device you're programming, put the remote into learning mode, point it at the device, and wait for the remote to find, recognize, and turn off the device. If the remote doesn't recognize the device, you must perform the device code programming manually (lots of codes are listed in the instruction booklet). The PS4 remote recognized my TV without difficulty, but my sound bar required manual programming.

Once you've programmed the various other devices, you switch between those devices by pressing the little labeled buttons (PS4, TV, AMP, CBL). Which brings me to the only thing that I don't like about the PS4 remote--the buttons (especially the switching buttons) are quite small, because there are so many of them packed onto this rather narrow remote.
I used this cable betweeny tv audio out to my sound bar. Excellent sound!

I was looking to replace/upgrade my multimedia speakers without breaking the bank. These speakers fit my price range. I was iffy on buying these because I had never heard of the brand before, but the reviews were pretty positive, so I gave them a shot. Boy, am I glad that I did. They arrived in wonderful condition, as Amazon.com never disappoints when shipping anything. They hook up a bit differently than basic multimedia speakers,  but I had no trouble hooking them up. The sound out of these little powerhouses is fantastic. We're listening to Thelonious Monk, and it feels as if we're sitting right at one of his jazz shows way back when. It sounds good with any genre of music. The customizable bass and treble settings, make things nice. You're not put over the top with crazy controls, either. Operation is pretty straightforward. Anyone with a basic knowledge of technology, shouldn't have any problem using these speakers.  The only thing that I didn't like is that the remote gave out after only one use. We can't seem to get it to work now. That's the only reason I'm knocking them a star. If you want good bang for your buck, look no further. You won't be disappointed.

I bought this for my son to use at school.  He has special needs so he works on a computer and listens to the lesson on headphones.  The cord really got in the way so this is a much better option.  It is very easy to use and connect to his laptop.  The sound quality is great and the built in microphone is very handy as well.  The ear pieces and headband are padded for extra comfort.
I love that even though it is digital, the manual features are great. The audio quality is very clear.

This is another magical Anker product. It has such a great set of features. The radio, the calming sounds, the alarms, good looks, fast wireless charger, and two additional USB-A connectors for charging. In terms of a "all-in-one bedtime solution" this is it! Also, the speakers sound really great for the size. Definitely better than an Echo Spot or Echo Dot.

So far so good! Just got it today. I am surprised at not only how attractive it is but also how roomy it is, which is important as a law student. And the laptop sleeve fits my macbook pro and cushions it well. It also has a tablet sleeve which fits my ipad pro 2 (the largest size -- 12 inches) perfectly with room to spare. I carry both the Macbook and the Ipad everyday. Also carries my large noise cancelling headphones and their case plus two large pencil pouches with a LOT of room to spare. It's perfect. No more rolling schoolbags for me.

Time will tell if this holds up. But if it lasts at least a year, I'd say I've gotten my money's worth based off of the roominess and ease of accessing my stuff. It is rare I find a bag that is roomy enough and has enough compartments to hold all of my law stuff.

Ok after using this pair for over a year now, I can write a proper review for it. First few months worked great, no issue. After about a year, I got 3 highlighted problems that keep happening. 1/ the system/bluetooth connection started to fail, it won‚Äôt connect to my phone, or is able to connect but has really loud random static. 2/ Random loud static, freaked me out many times. 3/ Won‚Äôt charge when i put them back in the pod, the pod is full of battery, but the pair just won‚Äôt take power from it. Today i was using the headphone while doin yard work, worked for 15 mins then they has decided to stop working completely, the app won‚Äôt recognize them, they don't take power from a fully charged pod. I‚Äôm done with these. Their sound worked great, i don‚Äôt have a problem with sound quality, it seems like its the connection system fails, between phone and headphones and pod‚Ä¶ Spent $200 on these originally, i‚Äôll probably buy a different brand because I want them to last at least 3 years.

I have had all of the galaxy phones and this one is by far the best. The screen is great, videos and games come to life with such great picture quality. Charge lasts forever.

Only downside is that the speaker (when you are talking) isn't the best, not the worst but it could be better. The Samsung galaxy 3 had the best speaker.
This small amp preforms well.  No heat generation.  Great build quality.  Sounds good, with plenty of power.  Bluetooth works without problems.  Great low price.

First, let me say I own the 47" LG 47LE8500 for my living room with its stunning high def picture and extremely poor speakers. I was looking for a slightly smaller (and less expensive) TV for my bedroom and chose this 42" Vizio. Vizio has a similar 47" model under this newly released line. (So far, I am mostly happy with my purchase.)

Both the LG and Vizio have LED LCD with Local Dimming. I have to say that the high def picture on the Vizio is not as stunning as on the LG 47LE8500, but it is close, and still satisfying.

The black levels are better on the LG, but pretty close on the Vizio.

The Vizio arrived with one of the round rubber "feet" missing under the base. (Better quality control and inspection please?)

The WiFi on the Vizio is fabulous. The remote having a qwerty keyboard is fabulous.

First thing I had to do (for personal preference) is turn off the room light sensor. The picture was way too dark for me when the light sensor was on.

Also, the default screen brightness setting with the light sensor off is too bright, in my opinion. The brightness level is at 50 by default on the standard pic setting, and it looks brighter than the 50 setting on other sets. (But it is very easy to adjust, of course.)

The speakers on the Vizio are much better than on the LG.

I dislike that the Vizio does not have a swivel base.

Standard def is quite acceptable (and better than on the LG).

So, bottom line: If you want to save some money, this new Vizio line is a very good choice (and recommended). Once you customize the pic settings, I think you will be happy with the high def picture. If you have extra money to burn, the LG will give you a more stunning high def picture with better black levels, but you probably will dislike the LG's speakers, especially if you listen to a lot of music with the volume raised.

Adding to my review, August 28:

When the TV is off, the Vizio logo at the front is lit up in orange. I have found no way to turn this off. I hope that if enough people complain, perhaps Vizio will release a software update that will allow the turn off of this orange Vizio light.

I have encountered bad lip sync issues. But luckily, Vizio has included in the Audio settings a Lip Sync adjustment setting. I had to enable this setting, as the lip sync mismatch problem was really bad. The adjustment has helped.

I use this surge protector / timer when charging phones, tablets, cordless tools, and headphones. I bought this model for the settings of 1, 3 and 6 hours. It's nice that I recognize the brand name and it has some surge protection, but I bought it for the timer feature.

I have a nasty habit of plugging in chargers and forgetting them and I prefer not to leave electronic devices on their chargers.

Set this device for 1 hour and it shuts off its outlet in 1 hour. (I timed it at one hour and take it at its word for 3 and 6).

I don't know if it would ever save enough money to pay for itself, but it does what I want it to do. It works as advertised.

Also, I don't leave it plugged in when I'm not using it, but that's just me.

Great cover for my tablet. It fits perfectly. It was a bit difficult to insert the tablet into the cover, but I was glad because it made for a tight, secure fit. It is not a "cushy" cover but very sturdy, so I know it will protect my tablet. I was a bit afraid that the cover would dampen the sound, but not. I am very satisfied with it. The colors and vibrancy are exactly like the pictures here on Amazon, and a little girly, which I like. I'm very satisfied! It feels just like leather. There's no manufactured smell to it. Just a high quality case.

I got this as a Christmas gift and I was a bit stymied as I'd never seen or heard of such a thing.  Rounded up some batteries and an empty box and was amazed at the volume of sound.  I just took it for a weeklong camping trip and it was nice.  You don't (or at least I don't) want very loud music when camping....it's rude to the other campers and scares of the wildlife and masks the sounds of the outdoors.  And why are you there if not to enjoy the outdoors?  So at the subdued volume I like it was fine.  Here's the deal, if you think this thing is gonna sound like Bose, you're dreaming.  If you think 2 AA batteries and a Starbucks cup is gonna provide you with a rock-the-house experience, you're dreaming.  If you're looking for a little conversation piece you can toss in a bag and forget it's there that will provide you with a little background music, your dreams may have just come true.  Really fun item.  On a side note, the current price is too much, the $10 or $15 folks got them on Groupon for is more reasonable.

If you want a really cute pair of headphones for your kid, these are great.. but if you want them to actually work - don't buy them. The sound sounds far away/muffled and what very little you are able to make out doesn't include background sounds/music, only dialogue. I should have sent them back but trashed them instead.

I use this cable to connect my laptop to the projector in the classroom where I teach.  The cable works fine, image and audio quality is fine.  The plug / connector is kind of heavy and slipped out of the laptop when I moved it, although I'd imagine that happening with most cords.  All in all, a good buy.
Shows it comes with headphones & it doesn‚Äôt. Box was damaged at time of delivery. Package iwas damaged. Skips a lot of discs for being ‚Äúnew‚Äù. DVDs are brand new & their skipping. Junk.

This iPod case offers excellent protection. Nearly the entire iPod - including click wheel - is covered. The hold switch and headphone jack remain exposed. If you drop your iPod while it's in this case it'll practically bounce right back to you.

I have to give this case 4 stars instead of 5 because there is some difficulty with the click wheel - at times it seems to stick and it's hard to adjust the volume, scroll through songs, etc. I had an earlier version of this case and didn't have this problem. Other than that I highly recommend this case - it offers the best protection that you can get for your iPod!

They were a gift¬† for someone for their first pair of wireless earphones. I wanted ones with this style of earbud rather than ones that are rubbery.They were easy to pair with a cell phone.I thought the sound was average. .¬† The recipient thought the sound was ok and endorses them.

This keyboard arrived today and I couldn't resist immediately pulling it from the box and setting it up. It comes with the required batteries, so you don't even have to hunt them up. The instructions are two tiny pages, which is how simple it is. I don't think it took me ten minutes, and I could have cut half that off had I remembered to immediately turn on the tablet's Bluetooth and go to the Bluetooth setup so I could pair the two. :-)

This has a "Chiclet" keyboard, but the keys are very responsive. It is the same size as the laptop-style keyboard that goes with my husband's Asus tablet; he has large hands and still feels he can type on it comfortably. The top of the keyboard has four function keys specially programmed to work with Windows 7 / 8, but the rest work as on a regular keyboard: "end," "home," etc. While the keyboard has an off/on switch that works with the function key, it also comes with a thick, rubber-coated (or "rubberlike," perhaps) cover which turns on the keyboard when you take it off and then turns it off when you put it back on. It fits snugly and completely covers the keyboard, protecting it. In addition, the cover bends in the middle so you can use it as a stand for your tablet.

I used it to write in Facebook and Blogger, and also tested it with a Word document in Documents to Go. Very comfortable to type with, although it suffers from the same problem with my tablet that my fold-up Freedom Pro keyboard does: when I use it in Blogger or Facebook, it types the first TWO letters of a sentence as a capital letter rather than one. I think this may be a problem unique to my Galaxy Tab 2 10.1. I did notice that the CTRL i combination for italics and the CTRL b combination for bold does not work with this keyboard, which I do find problematic and why I did not rate the keyboard as five stars. Otherwise I am very happy with it.

First off, because it wasn't entirely clear in the product description, this is for a car audio system, not a computer office system. So if you were hoping to hook this up in your home, you are out of luck.

Second, I don't know a lot about car audio systems. Half the time I'm in the car, I don't listen to anything at all. My usual commute is through several construction zones and I like to have all my attention on the traffic. I'm a nervous driver.

But I do like a nice sound system to listen to audiobooks on. I don't know if there is a comparable brand. But I am super impressed with this product

I really wanted to like this little speaker. The reviews were amazing. I wanted to replace a portable speaker I have (the size of a hockey puck) with something smaller for travel. But the sound form the Ewa is only halfway decent if it‚Äôs in it‚Äôs case which makes it the same size as my speaker!  The sound is tinny and worse outside the case. Mine is much lighter weight and much better sound quality. Bye bye Ewa!

Got this to replace spouses S6 that was on it's last legs. Didn't want to spend a fortune on a new phone, just needed a more updated phone that does basic functions. I've ordered open box/renewed items before, & never had an issue so was comfortable with this option also. You would never know it wasn't brand new, & it works great. It was wrapped really well in a plain box with a charger. While the S6 served us well, this one is nicer overall (bigger screen, more sleek). The best part is that it didn't come with any other phone carriers bloatware, & we use Mint Mobile & it set up perfectly. It came with Oreo, & within a day got a software update to Pie. You will need a new case, as the S6 one doesn't fit J7 & we have a new case/screen protector on the way. It has a regular headphone jack which we like, & uses micro USB for charging. It has a separate slot for an SD card, & dual SIM slot that accommodates one slot for nano (which is what we put in), & another that would fit micro SIM.

Very pleased with the renewed phone & hope it lasts as long as the other phone did.

I get constant static with these even when they're not in use so I tried plugging them into various places/ ports to see if anything changed it and nothing worked! The colors/modes are really cool, the sound quality is decent, the speakers get plenty loud, they feel solid, and look amazing! But that static issue is a deal breaker with me, I have to turn the speakers off when not in use and it's just inconvenient to have to do. These will probably be going in the trash sadly.

So, let me start off by saying, this isn't the best quality webcam on the market. But for the price, no one is expecting it to be. And it is FAR from the worst! During the Covid Pandemic, all the regular brand name webcams were sold out so I found myself trying out a bunch of these no-name brands from Amazon. The last one I tried actually had a much harsher fisheye effect in the corners, as well as over-saturated color. This one seems far less cartoony and more realistic in color reproduction, as well as being somewhat more rectilinear (photo speak for straight lines being straight, not as much curved distortion). There is a bit of fisheye curve on the edges, but it is very usable and didn't make my ceiling look concave like my last one I tried. See attached images for examples of the room's wall distortion. It's there if you are looking for it, but not terrible when you're looking at a subject. The microphone is just meh. I have a desktop mic and the sound out of that was MUCH better, especially because you can get it closer to your face than the camera. But the fact that this HAS a mic is a good option in a pinch. I would just strongly recommend an external mic if you want people to hear you clearly. Also something I didn't know before trying this:
It is MANUAL focus! That means it won't follow and focus on you automatically, you have to twist the lens until you're sharp in the view. It actually isn't that hard to nail focus, the depth of focus is pretty deep so once you've set it for your standard sitting distance, you likely won't have to change it ever again unless you walk away from the camera. A fun side effect, however is that the focus lens gear lets you push it to EXTREME MACRO distances! So you can do insane closeups of things if you want to, for example, put a webcam on an ant farm maybe? I tried it out on my desktop speaker, and in one picture you can see the relative size of it compared to my desk and then the closeup you can see the detail of the scratched plastic where it says Harmon / Kardon. Ha, if nothing else this shows me I should probably get new desktop speakers too! These are beat up when up close! A fun and versatile camera for a good price. If you need autofocus tracking, this might not be for you though.

I wanted something with a cd player built in. Its okay and I like it. Sounds good but much smaller than I thought it would be. Was thinking of returning it but decided to keep it. It fits my needs as to what I use it for.  Like the built- in speakers even though there is no other controls for it such as bass, treble, etc. Would probably purchase it again.

I prefer this set of Phitric A801 earbuds to the more expensive Anker Soundcore Liberty Air. Both look very similar. Both sound good. Both pair quickly when removed from the case. The one thing that puts this one over the Soundcore ones is that it actually fits securely and will not fall off.

I'm not talking about during extreme exercise or sports because to be honest, I'm way too out of shape to do either. I'm talking about sitting at my desk at work, perfectly still, and the Soundcore ones just slip right off and onto the floor. I have not had this issue with these Phitric ones. One reason I think is because of the weight. The Phitric earbuds feel much lighter than the Soundcore and I think that is helping the Phitric earbuds stay in place.

I knew this was the one. After 18 years I turned my office into a place I enjoy being. As a small business owner it‚Äôs important to grow your office to help manage the multitude of tasks. This eliminated my speakers cord all cords. It‚Äôs large enough to multi task and the sound is amazing!  Easy to set up and came with the cords. Which is nice. Adjustable height is easy pull it up or push it down. Color crystal clear and bright. What took me so long?

Sounds fine for what it is a radio and 2 small speakers. If you plug phone into USB this won't charge phone but will play from flash drive (from my experience lots of radios won't charge phone) if you install to thin material unbolt wire clamp as in my pic. I'd say the big negative is no remote turn on if running amp so you'll need a separate switch to turn on and off amp.

This is very good, but since I'm profoundly hearing impaired, it is not strong enough for me, with the top volume. It's a great little space saving device instead of a humongous stereo receiver, but I'm getting a stereo receiver. It is not the fault of this product. I have an 80% hearing loss.

I gave it five stars because the installer said it had amazing sound and he would buy one the next time he needs a headphone amplifier.

I absolutely love these. I am extremely organized and pretty much label everything. When we got a new desktop computer with new speakers and new webcam, there were cords going all over the place! These labels were recommended to me by someone, so I ended up purchasing them... And I was NOT disappointed. Super easy to use and there are a LOT of them. Plus, I like that they give you 5 different colors. The labels stick on the tabs just fine and the tabs themselves seem quite sturdy. Not only did I label all the cords running underneath the computer, but I also labeled everyone's phone chargers, the camera charger cords, and the wireless headphone charger. My dad saw what I had done (my masterpiece) and quickly bought some for himself so he could label his thousands of Christmas lights & cords... Really, they can be used to label pretty much anything. (Keep in mind that the tabs are zip-ties, so you can label anything that can be zip-tied.) I would highly recommend these to anyone!

I received this as a free review sample. Mine has been affixed to the back of my vehicle for nearly a month, and has even weathered a storm and a few hot days.

If you properly prepare the surface of where you intend to affix this sticker it will stay put. The reason why I docked it a star is because there were no instructions other than a terse three step blurb on the package. Frankly, that did not go far enough.

You need to make sure the surface to which you are going to affix the sticker is ABSOLUTELY clean. A good rubdown with alcohol or even Windex, followed by a thorough drying with a lint free cloth works wonders. Also, do not affix it in the hot sun, and also let it sit in the shade or garage for at least eight hours before driving. I did mine in the early evening and by morning it was firmly in place.

One nice thing about this, aside from the decorative aspect, is it's highly reflective. Since there is not much continuous surface in the design, it is not going to reflect back to a driver behind you and blind him or her, but there more than enough reflection to be easily seen on a dark night.

[[VIDEOID:b39077a4e85c55f7862c0edd1d64557c]] I can‚Äôt speak to the gen 3, but I know I wasn‚Äôt the only one bummed that I can‚Äôt keep the headset on to use for my PC, while the PS5 is on since you need the base plugged into the PS5, while turned on, to use the Microphone. While my PC is connected with a long series of AUX cables and extenders, I can still use the headset while my PS5 is turned off. Finally! The USB 2 power is connected to a power strip with a dedicated USB port for charging, the USB 3 end is in the back of my PS5. Exactly what I needed, although the cable is pretty short so make sure you know how far you need things to be.
This is the best earphone for audio books. Been ordering it for years.
Bought to replace sticking ball in Lgitech M570 - Very smooth operation now. Happy Camper!

I have started using this laptop as my everyday device and I am loving the speed and versatility!
This is my first 2 in 1, and I am not sure how often I would use it as a tablet, as it is fairly bulky and kind of heavy for a tablet. Functionally, it is great. The touchscreen is very responsive and it flips back and forth between orientations quickly.
As a laptop, it has a 500GB SSD, which is very speedy and good capacity. Their is only 8GB of RAM, which I will likely upgrade soon, but I have not had any issues with it being limited by RAM so far.
For standard browsing and streaming, it has been very quick and I have had NO issues. The speakers aren't the best, but a huge upgrade from my last laptop.
It does not have a dedicated graphics card, but I have done some light gaming (World of Warcraft, Diablo 3/Immortal) and it has held up with no lag so far! I don't think it would handle new, graphics intensive games well, but that is to be expected from any integrated graphics card.
One note, if you have this in laptop mode and flush with your desk/lap it will get fairly warm. The main air flow in on the bottom and the back, so I would prop it up a bit for better cooling.
Overall, I would definitely recommend this as an everyday laptop, with touchscreen/tablet mode available as needed!

At this price point it is fab for my needs:  for workout from my fitness app and audio is great and very comfortable.  Easy to sync to the phone. The touch to pause, increase volume is more like a big tap than a touch: that‚Äôs okay given price point.  The sound quality is pretty great for general uses.
I love my speaker!

It's an OK product.  Not exactly the best at noise cancelling on a plane.  The fit is a bit uncomfortable on a long haul flight.  I get a better sound quality from my Apple headphone.  For the given price, it's only an ok product.

** update 2014 ** 3 years later and still going strong - hasn't given her a bit of trouble - flawless

SWEET! 6 square inches bigger than my 40in and now I am wanting one in the Family Room!

**2012 Update ** the sound is hooked up to speakers, when I unhooked them and just used the TV the sound was fine but not impressive.

The picture and the color is gorgeous.

I am very pleased and super happy with this purchse. I have both wired and bluetooth earbuds and these tips works on both quite well. The memory foams are particualrly useful. I have weird shaped ear-canals and I needed two different diameters for each of the ears. So having a few to chose from really helps!

I love the sound and it's heavy but comfortable.....however the cooling aspect is a joke. My laptop, ASUS Republic of gamers, was overheating so I had to switch cooling mats making this an expensive speaker dock for our crappy laptop.

I regret this purchase.
Arrived fully charged, paired easily with my older Mac even tho other machines with Bluetooth on. It just works! Sweet.

Great Value for gaming and entertainment.  Rich vibrant colors.  Good dual built in speakers.  Fast refresh with 4K.  And a good size for my computer desk.  I have had this now for over 6 month a still love it.

The set up was really easy as the software component stepped you through the whole installation process with no issues.

The picture quality was a lot better for the price of this camera: at 720p it was a good quality in the usual chat sized window. Note that the picture was very sharp and shows wrinkles, pimples and all! However, if you blew up the size to full screen, there were noticeable delays in the picture. The audio was fully synced regardless of the window size. Note that you need a fast processor, which may not come with your portable computer.

The auto focus worked well and responded very quickly.

We actually hooked to our computer that was linked to your HD TV: actually worked! But if you are camera shy as the details are pretty good on this camera.

Additional enhancement preferred: lense cover for privacy just in case you forgot to log yourself out.

Is this worth it compared to other brands out there like Logitech: yes, but to get the full benefits you need a HD computer screen and that it is PC compatible only.

I am completely amazed that I get a speaker that takes 2 seconds to hook up! This has revitalized by Onkyo music components. I LOVE IT !!

First of all, I disconnected one of my old speakers, plug this in place of it, within 2 seconds, and BOOM... there it is! The sound is beautiful. Even when you crank it up, you still get that nice crisp sharp sound. Pink Floyd never sounded so good, as least not on my old set.

I love this because it is ONE unit. I love it because it is for your home entertainment system and doesn't require WiFI. But folks, this is the center unit, use it as that and you will be amazed.

Usually, most Speaker Systems I receive, it takes an act of Congress to get it going!

This is simple, wire to the red and back knobs in the back. It is lightweight, attractive, and super great! Rizzo

I love these wireless Shure earphones. In the morning when I go for my walkout with my dog, they are a staple with my attire and allow me to listen to my audio books without the hassle of wires connected to my iphone. Shure has been a staple to me since I was in my twenties (I actually used to be in a band and had Shure microphones), so I can testify to the quality of the Shure name (I like their sound quality better than my Bose headphones at about a third of the price). These are noise isolating and will work wonderfully for air travel as well.These would make a great Christmas gift for someone you love.
This is a great portable speaker. Its small enough to easily fit in your pocket and provides pretty good sound. Down side is that it does not get very loud

Ok, so I have to admit at first I was wondering why someone would spend this much on a Bluetooth headset that isn't a feature-rich entertainment one like those from Sony or a major fad brand like Beats, both of which I have some experience with. But this, no... this is actually something different. This is a serious tool for serious use with serious built quality and seriously useful features. Seriously.
For example, the telescoping mouthpiece means you'll get unparalleled mic quality compared to headsets that pick the mic up by your ears (looking at YOU, airpods!), both in clarity and isolation from background noise. You can also physically bend it out of the way, or use the button on the mic itself to mute. Try doing that with airpods. Then there's the button based features. Shortcuts and touch-sensitive buttons are cool on aesthetic devices, but the physical controls on this are an ergonomic user experience DREAM. Everything is easy to access and control, no apps or press-and-hold or counting LED blinks, etc. Sort of makes me miss the old days of phones with physical switches and buttons. When you want your equipment to get serious, this is the sort of user experience you expect. Then there's the charging rack. OMG I love that, I can store it on my desk and it's charging automagically. Pick it up and put it on, ready to go. Never needs to be charged because it's been charging in between uses. Finally, I'm really impressed with the USB dongle option. You see, the one thing I really dislike about wireless headphones is that you usually need to pair it with a device, then unpair it to switch to another device. For example, using my Sony headphones on my phone and tablet, if my wife wants to borrow them for a zoom meeting, I need to pair with her device but then also unpair with mine so that it doesn't keep trying to reconnect to it. Sometimes we just give up and use a wired headset to avoid that mess. Non-bluetooth wireless headsets have a dongle, which makes it easy to swap what you are connected to (no unpairing needed, just move the dongle) but then you can't connect to devices without a USB port like a phone. This is the best of both- you can pair it with your phone, but ALSO use the USB to quickly connect with your desktop or laptop without going through the process of pairing and unpairing. This is the kind of usability and professional quality I would expect from a brand like Plantronics, and all the while it works well as a stereo headset for music/gaming/etc as well. Very comfortable to wear for long hours, I'd highly recommend it for serious users.

This is a great speaker. It is really easy to pair with your device via Bluetooth. The sound quality is really good. The lights are pretty mesmerizing. The water proof and dust proof capabilities make me happy, given that I use it in the kitchen next to my sink and outside while I am doing yard work. It performs really well for our uses. When the battery gets low, it verbally tells you the battery is getting low. So, no watching for some random light or waiting until it dies. It does have audio input jacks, as well.

One ear bud refused to play sound. Discovered this was extremely common. Spent a half hour troubleshooting, when I could‚Äôve been working on my current novel. Tried every fix suggested online in multiple forums and videos. I have NOT had this problem with $20 cheap wireless buds and certainly not with $200 Bose. I‚Äôd sworn off Beats years ago due to bad quality, but gave them another try.  I regret it. It‚Äôs not worth the aggravation, let alone the hassle of returning defective earbuds. No excuse at this price.

[[VIDEOID:6ec8de62fb5875f835eddb76d60637cc]] Seems like a nice speaker. It‚Äôs small and portable.

I like the design. It feels light and seems easy to carry.

Overall it‚Äôs a nice speaker I think. Quality matched the price I thought

Finally, a solution that really stops your headphone cord from tangling up but also protects the wires from becoming detached sooner from the earbuds and connector. I can tell you that I have ruined many earbuds because of tangled cords but no more. Cordskinz is the best solution and works amazingly well. Plus they are super easy to put on and it comes with a skinning tool to help you put them on your earbuds. Now, they don't work on the flat cabled earbuds but they work perfect on the round ones, which these are made for. Maybe they will expand their skinz and make them for the flat cables one day but for now what they have is amazing and if you have earbuds you need these for them to keep them safe. Plus, they look awesome and because they are so easy to switch out you can have a new color for your buds to match your every outfit.

I purchased this to make a portable toilet out of.
Doesn‚Äôt work as well as first thought. It‚Äôs ported and I needed a sealed box.
The stink comes up through the port on the side. Even screwing the speaker in tightly, the stink still comes out the port. Especially when rap music is played
Speaker is great and has amazing sound. Was easy to set up with my phone and play whatever I want with no problems. Super happy with this speaker.

[[VIDEOID:87e2404de3b2f278a3e1a1b4708a8c9]] These headphones are cute for kids. I think they fit my 5 (almost 6) year old pretty well.

I also like how the fold up small for easy storage. Seems very nice overall

Banana connectors fit much tighter than a RCA connector and for a person unaware of the difference; it would be easy to cause damage on ether end of the speaker wire to the female connected components. Therefore, I would recommend studying the literature or talking to the manufacture (for both connected ends if necessary). For instance,: in most cases if unaware, it would be easy to cause physical damage simply installing a banana male into a female component just by the tightness, (no clearance between M/FM parts that can fool you into thinking this is as it should be because the male banana is designed to squeeze into the female end and, probably remain as such even after someone trips over an AV receiver  speaker wire, and the A/V falls on the floor because the banana connector was so tight you could lift the A/V by the speaker wire. A banana male connector is designed to expand during installation. If you are in need of banana connectors, these connectors are extremely well made and are a very good bang for the buck.  They are also reusable and do not need any special tools other than basic wire strippers.

I was looking for a camera that would work with Windows Hello on my new desktop. I asked if this camera would and I received an answer that, yes, it would. It doesn‚Äôt. Since then I‚Äôve researched and cameras for Windows Hello must have the ability to detect certain 3D patterns and are necessarily more advanced than this type of camera.

Knowing this I decided I would use it for my Zoom meetings. Forget that idea. The microphone is AWFUL. No one could understand me and told me I sounded like I was under water.

The video is not any better. Everything is distorted like a fun house mirror. Maybe I received a defective product.

I uninstalled and reinstalled the software to no avail.

This is definitely a product I would avoid.

Thanks for reading my review. I enjoy writing them as I value reading other‚Äôs reviews when I‚Äôm making a buying decision. I regularly update my reviews to reflect any changes I may discover and to include helpful tips you may need if you purchase the product. I will always make every effort to answer any questions I can as it is my pleasure to help.

I personally think that Bose makes the best sound equipment on the market. They really care about the quality of sound. This speaker is very small, but it pumps out SERIOUS sound. It lasts 13 hours on one charge, so you get lots of playtime. You can easily take it on the go or carry it around the house to keep the music going. It makes a great gift for a music lover. I HIGHLY recommend this speaker.

Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided helps make your decision a little easier.

Perfect fit under my computer monitors and takes up little space. Also the quality of sound is rather nice. Pairs very well with my existing speakers / bass combo. Also like the fact that I can bluetooth my phone to the speaker if I want to listen to something else while working on my PC. Directions were very helpful on how everything gets setup

For an inexpensive and lightweight pair of headphones, these are suprisingly well made. My kids break these as the school year goes on and it's nice to have a reasonably priced set to replace them with.

My husband is over the moon with his new speaker. It BOOMS! He hooked it up in about 10 minutes via a HDMI cable connection into our Vizio tv. It‚Äôs low profile and easily fits on our console table, tucked in the back. You can walk mount it too. I can cast onto the tv thru my phone and quickly change a song on video. The remote works fine too I just always misplace the dang thing so using my phone is easiest. The clarity of sound is exactly what you‚Äôd expect from Sony. Excellent bass, crisp high tones. The biggest design flaw on this is‚Ä¶the control buttons are on located on top. So my cat, in the middle of the night PRESSES THIS SPEAKER ON and the ‚Äútest‚Äù music cranks thru the house. üêà‚Äç‚¨õ Other than that, it‚Äôs flawless.

I have crappy 2nd and 3rd gen Dots. I can't stand how they sound on their own, so I use 3rd party speakers, which greatly improve the quality. The speaker base for the 2nd gen has been fritzing, so I thought why not spend more money for a single product that should work better and hopefully sound as good.

Well, friends, it does not sound as good. I don't know if I have a bum unit ‚Äî I don‚Äôt think I do ‚Äî but Alexa's voice sounds awful. Podcasts are fine, and music is fine ‚Äî not great, but fine, and so much better than her voice, which is why I don't think it's a bum unit. Alexa's voice is so muddy it's almost un-understandable. I'm returning it. I'll just get a new Bluetooth speaker to go with my old Dot.

This product has one slight flaw.  It worked flawlessly on my Avaya IP phone when I worked for a major metropolitan fire department as their Telecommunications Field Supervisor, but now that I work for a smaller company with a 1990's generation Premier phone system, it sits over the speaker and causes feedback when the speaker is used as an intercom.  I am sure that this is a problem with the phone, but I gave this 4 stars because they could have designed it to take up less space on the phone or to pass sound without reflection which would have solved this problem.  Be carefull if you are using a phone where the speaker is under the handset.
So far so good, two months into daily use. It's worth mentioning they're more comfortable than my previous earbuds.
Worked perfectly, jus what i needed to install aftermarket speakers

Features:

1. Frequency Response: 15-25,000 Hz
2. Impedance: 60 ohms
3. Weight: 2.4 ounces
4. Sensitivity: 103 dB SPL/1mW
5. Distortion: Less than 0.2 percent
6. Cord: Straight, Dual Entry, 4feet
7. L plug (for computers) plus audio plug adapter (for stereos)
8. Titanium-coated high-polymer diaphragm
9. Foam ear cushions for open "hear through" sound
10. Volume control on cord
11. Flexible headband sling
12. Lifetime warranty
(Okay, I don't have a clue what items 2 and 4 signify, but I thought I'd include them here for those of you who do)

Pros:

1. Very light and comfortable.
2. Ear cushions pivot back and forth for a comfortable fit
3. Ear cushions are replaceable
4. Headband adjusts for head size, both width and height
5. Flexible headband sling holds it in place, unlike other models that keep sliding off your head
6. Titanium is way cool
7. The sound is excellent, especially given the price. It is much, much better than the one I was using before. Heavy bass ROX!!!
8. Volume control slider on the cord puts volume adjustment at your fingertips
9. Aesthetically pleasing
10. Clearly marked for left and right ears

Cons:

1. Four foot cord is rather limiting
2. This model doesn't include a microphone for those who like to chat on-line
3. I'm spending more time listening to music when I should be doing something else

Overall: Great value for the price

Rated: 4.5 stars

Amanda Richards, June 10, 2008

I bought these to use while exercising.  I have a pair of earbuds, but they irritated my ears when I wore them for longer periods of time.  These are very comfortable and so easy to use.  It was simple to set it up the first time, but now it connects to my phone automatically when I turn them on.  The sound quality is great and it cancels out the noise around me.  They hold a charge for a long time,  but they also come with a cord so you can plug it into your device if you want.

I have bought two of these, the first through Amazon Warehouse. I returned that one because it wouldn't even turn on. The second one I still have, because it at least plays a record, but now it won't play anything via Bluetooth.... And I've had this thing for about 6-8 weeks. I don't know what exactly you call it, but it would be nice if the needle arm would automatically retract once it is finished playing a record. But it doesn't, so I have to very carefully pick it up so I don't scratch the record.
Really, these do look cool and retro, and I'm afraid they're just not well made.

Flimsy shipping packaging. Scuff on top right of screen. Shipping package did not contain outside label required for lithium batteries. On my trade in, I had to print the lithium warning label in color, per Amazon directions.

I paired my Airpods easily. Overall, nice enough. Nice not to have eye fatigue caused by glare.

Negatives.

1 No real browser. I realize this is a reader, but here‚Äôs the issue. I subscribe to the Amazon owned Washington Post at a recurring bargain price of $ 30 per year. It was originally a Prime Day deal. The entire newspaper including all comics and ads. Even though it is linked to my Amazon account, as an Amazon subscription, with payments to Amazon, I cannot read it on my Kindle reader, just my Fire or IOS devices. To read it on my Kindle Oasis, I must take the monthly subscription for $ 19.95 a month. Same with all subscriptions. This is a major disappointment. For that reason, I can‚Äôt recommend it.

2. I got the 32 gb, because I also have Audible. I thought I could listen to Audible, as I read the book on the Oasis. You can‚Äôt. For example, I have the Audible, ‚Äú Sandman). I also have the Kindle reader version. It is a very graphic comic book, by graphic, I mean great illustrations. What I need to do as I go through Sandman, is listen on my IPhone, while following the comic pages on my Fire. That enhances the experience greatly. Since I need to use two devices simultaneously, I use the Fire, as it appears in color, vs the BW in the Oasis. If I knew I would need two devices, I would have saved $ 25 and purchased the 8 GB.

The batteries are decent for budget brand rechargeable cells, they back a very usable amount of mAh for my kids RC toys and game controllers. The charger is interesting however... unlike my other battery chargers which feed from the AC wall outlet, this uses USB. It has both micro USB and USB-C, which is very useful because I use both for different kinds of devices and I readily have one or other available and can choose accordingly. Options are good. What isn't as good, however, is that most of my USB sources won't feed enough amps to charge 8 batteries at a time with any sort of "high speed". Even a 2.5Amp charger won't really feed enough juice to charge all 8 rapidly, and most of my chargers / laptops / etc are feeding more like 0.5amp anyway. Those are much slower.
That's not necessarily a bad thing- slow charging is actually well known to be better for battery life. I'd rather charge up 8 at a time slowly than 4 rapidly followed by another 4 in the same amount of time as 8 slowly. But it is kind of misleading to claim this is a fast charger.

This little plug works and it works really well. I am using it to charge my iphone and ipad via a Micro USB charger I use to charge a Bose Speaker. I've had it for a couple months and its still good as new.
Sound great massive magnet,  Can‚Äôt wait time get my amp and try it out with that.

Very impressive specs and the image is beautiful.  Lacking in connections and other enhanced functionality such as ethernet, apps, multiple HDMI etc but all of this is handled by my receiver and ROKU box so this is exactly what I was looking for.  Image quality is on par with the big names such as SAMSUNG, LG etc.  If you are looking for a great quality BIG picture this is it.  FYI - the pictures do not show the VESA mounting holes but they are there.  200x200.

I used as directed on a 55" OLED and found it no better than a slightly dam cloth. I admire the flashy packaging and bright colors, but honestly feel it was not worth the money spent. I personally believe you could buy a spray bottle (bright color if you wish) and some microfiber cloths and come out better on the end.

I agree it won't damage your screen. I agree it will get the screen clean but no better or easier than a damp cloth and careful wiping.

My son sleeps with this on every night. Nice speaker.
Wire broke after several months, but that says more about my son than the device. We bought another as a replacement. Can't beat the price.

I love these so much I purchased a second set for home use.  Originally I purchased them for work -- to keep my power cord and earbuds from tangling in my laptop bag.  They look great, don't squeeze the cords and have a nice interior lining.  No fuss; great value.

Great case with lots of storage and capacity to hold my 17 inch laptop. This size case is usually cramped and poorly organized but this case solves all those problems. Plenty of pockets to separate your things and it‚Äôs TSA friendly so you don‚Äôt have to drag it out at the airport. Case feels balanced and laptop feels secure and safely stored. Looks great and is easy to carry. I can see where it might carry too much stuff and would be heavy, but if you‚Äôre carful, it‚Äôs a go everywhere case. (I voluntarily reviewed a free sample).

I ordered this speaker set online as a replacement for an old Logitech set that I had and I really miss my old one. :( The sound on this one is just okay, but sadly there are no knobs on it to control the bass and the trebel separately so you cannot get great sound or bass for parties etc like I could with my last model. It also means you're stuck with bass if your roommates want to sleep which has cut down my music listening time quite a bit. The remote control is handy but only has on/off and volume features which is disappointing because I thought the ability to change bass and trebel would be there as well. Last but not least, I hate the way the remote is attached to the speakers. It has a Y shaped cord so it constantly gets wrapped up in my mouse cord or power cord to my lap top. It is a fairly inflexible cord so it is constantly in the way. The sound is quality and I like Logitech speakers but I would definitely recommend ordering the version with the ability to control the subwoofer independently.
Great price! Great sound! We loved that it has all the features we needed plus speaker terminal hookups!

I got this for my boyfriend's second TV because I want to watch regular TV at his house. It was extremely difficult to screw in the antenna connector to the port on the TV. Other than this, set up was a cinch. He lives in a small town in central New Jersey, so the 25-mile reach is not limiting.

Attached are pictures of the antenna and some TV pictures. This antenna comes with an installation pamphlet and one square of double sided tape to affix the antenna to the wall.
OK, NOT SUPERIOR FOR AUDIO WIRES!

These headphones feel fine at first, but left me with a big headache after wearing them for the day at work.  I returned them and went back to wearing my earbuds, but it may very well be more that I'm not a headphones person than that these are particularly uncomfortable.

More electronics in the home means a need for more outlets. An ordinary extension cord will do the trick, but if you want something that looks nicer, has more functionality, and protects against power surges than one good option is the APC P11U2 APC Surge Arrest.

This surge protection device is great for those who need extra outlets for plugging in electronics and other things. It has eleven sockets plus 2 USB ports for a total of 13 places to plug things in and keep them running. An indicator light will tell you if there is an overload, which is highly possible when there are so any plugs. We don‚Äôt have this problem because we use this on our kid‚Äôs tech table. It allows them to plug in their cell phones, tablets, kindles, and other items- all which use minimal power- and get everything charged all at once without them fighting over limited outlet availability.

Each of the outlets on this surge protector has a safety closure, which is good for keeping out unwanted items. This can be useful if you have young children- wouldn‚Äôt want junior sticking a paper clip or other item inside one of the sockets. And a light glows to indicate that the surge protection is working as it should.

If I could change one thing about this, it would be the length of the cord. It would be better if it was just a little longer because it would be capable of reaching further. But other than that, this surge protector has worked just fine for my needs. It has ample space to plug in and charge all of our household electronics, keeping them ready for use and protecting against power spikes in the process.

Seems like a nice set of earbuds

I like the design and think they look really good. They remind me of black AirPods

The case is nice for keeping them organized and I like that you can charge them in this too

Didn't work.  Right out of the box it barely worked.  Got it hooked up to the WiFi but the speaker didn't work.  You couldn't hear anyone answer the door bell.
