I work for the United States Postal Service and recently purchased the OontZ Angle 3 Plus Bluetooth speaker for use in my LLV truck on my rural mail route. The speaker performs beautifully and I wanted to protect it to, from and while at work so I purchased this case. I was mainly wanting a safe way to transport and store the speaker, but after reading the other reviews I was hoping I would be able to keep it clean in the case and still enjoy my music on my route. I received the case and used it at work yesterday. The case is extremely nice and I appreciate the interior mesh pocket and the carabiner clip. I have no need for them now, but I'm sure they will come in handy if I ever take this speaker on vacation and need to take the charging cables along and want to clip the case to my day pack. As for playback while in the case? Yeah, it was terribly muffled. It didn't work for me as it apparently has for others. Yet, the case itself is exactly what I was wanting for taking it to and from work. I like how smooth the zipper is and how heavy duty/reinforced the stitching for the zipper is. The interior is not as thickly padded as I would have expected, however it does protect the speaker. I deducted one star due to the mediocre interior padding. I hope that, if the company ever revamps this case design, they beef up the padding a bit.

I just started using my camera yesterday and my first impression is that this thing seems very fragile.  Hope I don't drop it, as it might not survive the fall.  It is extremely small, light and compact.  Think of two packs of cigarettes or two packs of playing cards.  It is that small.  Great for travel due to the light weight and compactness.  Got it for about $90 on sale; would hate to pay more than that for it. Very easy to operate, but if you have big hands, this will be too small for you.  Be warned that it won't take more than a couple minutes of video without a memory card, so you'll have to put a little more money into it if you really want to do video or really much of anything.  The first video I took came out pretty decent, but it was in good light.  I tried some still shots inside at night and they came out very dark in spite of the flash.  The flash doesn't seem adequate, so this is probably a camera best used outdoors or in the daytime.  Great camera for a kid.  This is a good camera for small hands and a great size for kids.  If they break it or lose it, you aren't out a bundle.  As another reviewer pointed out, it does only take video in the ASF format; not MPEG, as the advertising suggests.  I think MPEG might be just music files.  I didn't need to install the software to capture the pictures or movies on my computer (Windows XP).  Another great thing is that this is a complete package.  It has the camera, a carrying strap, a carrying case, USB cable, TV cables, headphones, battery, battery charger and software.  It does not come with a lens cap and the cap is not available either.  You can buy an optional tripod for it and with the small size, I think that could be useful in some situations to help hold and stabilize the camera.  I am not sure how you store music on it; I probably won't use that feature, but it seems like it would be a nice compact music player; again you'll need a memory card to save much of anything on it.  One problem I had so far.  The memory card (which you have to buy separately--a standard SD card) slips in the bottom under a little rubber membrane.  The first time I held the camera I accidentally popped out the card and lost the shots I was trying to take.  This might be a problem and I am thinking I may have to put a piece of heavy tape over the bottom to hold the membrane and memory chip in place and prevent ejecting the memory again.  Another downside that I see is the battery.  You can't just pick up some spare batteries at the corner store and pop them in.  You have to use the special rechargeable battery.  If you don't have a spare one charged up, your camera will go dead and you'll have to wait until you can plug in the charger and recharge the battery.  That's another $20 for a spare battery.  My digital camera uses standard AA batteries, so I can use either rechargeables or regular batteries.  If this camera used regular batteries, it would make it larger and heavier, so the small rechargeable does help on the weight and size.  Don't buy this if you are a serious photographer.  Buy it for occasional use, for easy portability and as a first camera to learn on.  Controls are easy and straightforward.  Nice camera for the money, but not for serious photographers.  It does a lot for a tiny little thing; sure doesn't make me want to go back to the days of huge video cameras that you had to hold on your shoulder, due to the weight.  Minaturization can go too far and this is about as small as I would ever want to go; might be easier to use if it was just a tiny bit bigger.

I was looking for some replacement headphones for two sets in my family when I had the opportunity to try out some of the new Carlos Santana line of headphones. Let's see what happened.

WHAT ARE THESE LIKE?
These headphones come in a great box which will appeal to fans of Carlose. It is well decorated and presentation is done so well, it would make a great gift. These are the black ones, and there is also another set available in white under a different listing.

ARE THESE REAL LEATHER?
According to the case,t these are leather padded ear cups and the lower half of the headband. I am still not sure about this. It is possibly bonded leather. Bonded leather is made from leather scraps chopped up and blended with binders. Sheets made of this mixture are printed with leather look imprinting. Technically it can be called leather, but it really is not leather as I define it..

EAR CUSHIONS AND HEADBAND
These black headphones are comfortable. I can wear these headphones longer than many others I have used. My daughter who ended up with these, uses them constantly and raves about them. These can be worn for several hours without a problem. She has sweaty ears and these are not nearly as frustrating for her as many others.

CORD FOR CORDED LISTENING
This comes with a cord which is only 38 inches long. That is a bit short for me. I find it is annoying and not quite as long as I would prefer, but my daughter does not use it so I guess it is not a problem for her or if you are like her, you won't mind either.

HOW DO THESE SOUND?
We are all surprised at how really good these sound. The bass is well defined and clear/strong, and the mids and highs are definitely clear and not muddy. The bass is not overwhelming either, which is a problem with some headphones.

HEADPHONE CONTROLS
The controls can be a bit difficult to read, but once you know where they are, you can figure it out pretty quickly. The +/- and play/pause buttons are separated by the noise cancellation button which is good.

HOW ARE THESE ADJUSTABLE?
These adapt to all sorts of comfortable positions.. They go longer, tilt in and out and rotate from side to side.

ARE THESE ABLE TO FOLD TO BE COMPACT?
These do fold flat and compact if you need to travel with them or store them in a smaller storage area.

CASE?
This did not come with a case.

SOUND CANCELLATION PERFORMANCE
The noise cancellation is awful. It hardly works. When noise cancellation is turned on, the sound gets pretty compromised. It becomes almost muffled in a way and the base definitely goes down.

OTHER FEATURES WITH THESE HEADPHONES
The ability to know how much power is left on the headphones while using the phone is nice, but it does not help if you are using these some other bluetooth device and not a phone. During phone calls, people hear just fine and we can hear them too (several of us tried this feature with our phones)

THE BOTTOM LINE
At this price point, these headphones are a step up from what I usually get when getting headphones for this price range. The sound is well defined and well balanced. Compactness for storage is great, and the comfort is also very good. The only disappointments are noise cancellation, short cord for corded listening, and buttons being a bit difficult to read.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. With better performance from noise cancellation, these would be really really good. As they are, they are still pretty great. They are a great gift to yourself or someone else and are some of the nicer headphones I have used in my journey through headphones of all sorts as well as those the family has obtained. They are not B&O or Turtle Beach, but they still are pretty good.

First time I put these on on the plane, I thought they did an amazing job blocking the noise. Then I realized I hadn't even turned the active noise cancellation on... wow! What a difference!

They also work and sound great as a Bluetooth headset. They also work great with or without being on with a wired connection.

So you can turn it on and off, turn the noise cancellation on and off, and still use it when off with the included normal headset cable!

Includes all the cables and if needed, older airplane plug adapter, AWESOME semi hard case. Bought a second one.

What really convinced me the person showing that it can be really loud outside, i was pretty disappointing. Comparing how big it is,the speakers are not upto what you pay for. Quality of sounds need alot of improvement. i would say more suitable for small room or bathroom.. i think a feature or an app to turn off the light from phone would be beneficial and a nice addition to the speaker.

My wife and I decided to upgrade our entire living theatre setup this February. We purchased this soundbar for $798 and a Vizio P759-G1 TV for $1234. The best part of this setup is that the Vizio TV and soundbar support ‚Äúcommon mode‚Äù transport of Dolby Atmos. This means that our Apple TV 4K can be plugged into any of the five HDMI ports and this soundbar will receive (compressed) Dolby Atmos. The majority of our movie watching happens on the Apple TV 4K with iTunes movies that have Atmos soundtracks. This form of Atmos is already compressed (Dolby Digital Plus) so we aren‚Äôt really losing any quality. We love our new setup in our smallish living room. The 10‚Äù subwoofer is also a huge improvement over the 8‚Äù woofer in the Vizio SB4551-D5 soundbar we had previously. The passive radiators inside the bar also help with its musicality. There‚Äôs actually a lot of detail in the mids versus other bars. Vizio has always made very ‚Äúmusical‚Äù soundbars, but this one is exceptional. We moved that system to our bedroom. Now we have full surround sound in two rooms (one with full Atmos!) and we couldn‚Äôt be happier.

Not exactly made for working out in the barn which is where I use wireless speakers.  My son however loves it and uses it often while he‚Äôs playing on the computer since he says the sound is better than the computer‚Äôs speakers

We were able to figure it out and I love them. Great for riding on the lawnmower while cutting the grass or working out. The sweat doesn't bother them!

This soundbar is one of the best I've used and I have gone through a number of them over the years. This one has amazing sound and hook up was a breeze. It works amazing with my tv, computer, tablet, and even phone if I need it too. I am loving this and so is my family. This soundbar is the bee's knees for sure and I am very happy with it.

The main thing I am looking for in a dock is the ability to use 2 external displays, which this does with flying colors. Specifically, I am using 1x 1440p and 1x 1080p. For it to work, you need to install a quick driver, which is simple.

The biggest thing with this dock, it the size (get it?). It requires external power, and it comes with an AC adapter. This thing would not be easy to pack up and travel with. If you will be traveling a lot, I would recommend a more portable option.

Other than the size, this is a great dock. It has 16 different ports, including 2x HDMI 2.0, 1x DisplayPort 1.4, 2x USB-A 3.2 Gen2, 2x USB-A 2.0, 1x USB-C 3.2 Gen2, 1x Ethernet, 1x SD, 1x TF, 2x 3.5mm Audio, 2x Power Delivery out (USB-A, USB-C; charge only).

One thing I really appreciate it that I can use the power delivery ports to charge even if my laptop isn't hooked up (because this is powered separately).

My least favorite thing about this dock is the price: at $300 (as of Dec 18, 2022), it is priced on the higher end of similar docks. Still a great dock, just an expensive one.

I gave it to my husband for Valentine's Day. It has a pretty good sound, not as loud or clear as another one we have, but overall, it is amazing that such sound can come from such a tiny speaker. It is pretty small, which is good. So far, after two days, I would recommend it as a nice purchase.

These headphones are really awesome. Looks great, feels great, and folds up really nicely for easy transportation. The only issue I have with it is when you mute the headset; there is no visual indicator that the headset is muted (only a chime that can easily be missed).

This cable runs from my server room to the next room by going through the wall and attic. Tested this cable before hand for a couple days before running the cable through the house and worked fine. After the install it worked fine for about 3 months and then stopped working. I checked the PSU that came with the cable and it appears to be dead.

I was able to use a powered hub that seems to be enough to power a keyboard, mouse and audio card without using a PSU on the cable end itself.

I have worked with a lot of Bluetooth headphones, all of which have their strengths and weaknesses. These headphones by Panasonic are on the less expensive end. The question is whether they are worth the asking price. In my opinion, they could be better and are still priced a little high.

Comfort-wise, I do not care for these but this is a personal preference. I like a headphone that fits tightly and presses down on my head, and these are very light-fitting. They adjust well enough and there should not be too much trouble getting these to fit almost any head, but keep in mind that they‚Äôre not the type that clamps down tightly.

The build quality is sub-par. These are very lightweight and feel quite flimsy and fragile.

I found an issue in the sound profile. The bass is good and not too heavy, and that‚Äôs good news for me. I dislike strong bass which is good for giving me headaches. The midrange is on target too and the music has some depth. Where the problem lies is in the highs. When listening to music I noticed some distortion in the highs. It‚Äôs not in-your-face and it doesn‚Äôt ruin the listening experience unless you are really fussy about your music. These will be fine for listening to speech, though.

I had no trouble connecting these to my laptop via Bluetooth. These come up quickly and connect without any issue and are ready to go in seconds. These aren‚Äôt the absolute fastest connecting phones I have worked with but they are among the faster ones I have used.

There‚Äôs no protective case for these phones in the box, not even a sleeve. These do fold up nice and compactly but I am not sure what is the point without a case in which to store them.

As I write this, the asking price for these phones is $60 which is a bit high in my eyes. If the sound profile was perfect, or if the build quality was higher, I would be more amenable to that price but the truth is that less expensive phones can be found that have a better sound profile and are constructed more solidly - and they have a case.

These are not bad phones, but I think they leave much to be desired. The build quality is mediocre, the sound profile is imperfect and the cost is a little high for what is in the box.

Great little speaker.  Can't speak to music quality but I read a ton of audiobooks, so this is great to carry around the house so I can "read" while doing chores & such.  Never had any issues after several months of use, plus the battery lasts a long time (never measured, but it's never died on me...I just charge it now & then when I think about it).  Highly recommend esp for audiobooks.
Needed to upgrade my old bluetooth device to be able to connected multiple devices. This is working great. Easy to install and no issues so far.
Great sound but very difficult to use the microphone to talk to someone it‚Äôs has a lot of static.

I have worked with a lot of headphones, active noise canceling (ANC) phones in particular. ANC phones are interesting in that while they are good at stripping out white noise they frequently do not sound quite right because they twiddle the sound profile, usually in the bass range, to compensate for the sound frequencies they filter out. Also, there are varying levels of ANC, the standard to which others are compared is Bose. This headset by Jabra came as a huge shock to me, both for the very balanced sound profile and the aggressive ANC function.

This headset is on-ear, not over-the-ear. Usually I am a bit wary of on-ear headphones as they tend to be a little uncomfortable. These have very soft, leather-like pads and they are actually quite nice ‚Äì for a while. After about an our of wear they start to get slightly uncomfortable for me, though taking them and shifting them a little makes them fine again.

The ANC function is VERY aggressive, approaching the same level as Bose but not quite. It is able to wipe out the sounds of the A/C, a fan, engine noise and more. Like Bose, when these are first turned on the ANC gives the wearer a sensation of pressure on the ears. Using this without feeding in noise, it is possible to enjoy relative quiet when traveling, reading, studying or enjoying similar activities.

The sound profile is on point. The bass is present and unmistakable, but it is not pushed forward so much as to dominate the whole profile and drown out the midrange. The midrange is bright and warm, giving music the right depth instead of making it sound like it‚Äôs either in a tunnel or in a barrel. The highs are very good ‚Äì solid but not piercing. Jabra has nailed the sound profile where a lot of others have screwed up.

This is also a headset for talking, and call clarity when using with a mobile phone is very good. I have had excellent results using this headset and it has worked extremely well for me. There is a caveat, though ‚Äì because this headset covers both ears, it is not suitable for use while driving in many jurisdictions. It‚Äôs great when in the office, but know your local and state laws if you plan to use it in a motor vehicle.

There are two ways to use this headset and connect it. It has built-in Bluetooth and it pairs and connects very quickly with my phone. It also has a USB dongle for connecting to a PC, though it can be connected to the PC via Bluetooth too. My observation there is that volume levels are reduced when connecting to a PC via Bluetooth.

The headset comes in a crush-resistant case and includes the USB dongle and a USB cable for charging.

I can find little about which to complain with this headset. It does get slightly uncomfortable for extended wear, but it has great ANC and a very balanced sound profile. As a headset it works great for talking, too, and the Bluetooth pairing is fast. This has already become my favorite set of headphones for streaming music, though because of laws where I live I cannot use it as a hands-free set while driving.
Wow great sound! Fits perfectly under my TV - really nice bass and seems like surround sound with out all the wires and speakers

I use messenger bags as book bags to take books and tools to and from work every day. I favor canvas bags because they are tougher than nylon and they are a bit more masculine-looking. This particular messenger bag is a little more stylish than some of the others I have seen and so far I am happy with it.

A messenger bag is characterized by the fold-over flap that snaps closed over the main compartment. This particular bag has a very colorful and decorative weave that makes up the entire flap and the result is a softer and more supple flap than if it had been made of the same canvas material as the rest of the bag. That is not a fault or imperfection by any means but needs to be mentioned as a difference. Compared to the flap, the rest of the bag is more coarse and rigid.

Everything about this bag suggests quality. The stitching is very tight and the materials are even and there are no imperfections (nicks and cuts) that I can find on this bag. The stitching used to attach the shoulder strap to the metal loops on the bag, as well as to attach the leather trim to the canvas, is visibly thicker and stronger than what was used to hold the canvas portions of material together. I like the fact that there is some manner of reinforcement on the bottom of the bag (stitched inside so it is hard to know exactly what kind of reinforcement was used).

Instead of actual snaps, the flap is attached to the front of the bag using magnets. These make it a lot easier to open and close the bag.

In the main compartment of this bag are three pockets, one zippered and two smaller pockets that are open on the top. The smaller pockets are ideal for cell phones, small note pads, a calculator and the like while the larger pocket is big enough to accommodate a checkbook or a small book; it is not quite wide enough to handle a DVD case. There is a front pocket that is just barely wide enough to handle a 10‚Äù tablet (though I would put a tablet in the main compartment instead). Finally, there is a zippered pocket on the back that is slightly more narrow than the front pocket because of the zipper and is good for papers and maps.

This is a nice messenger bag and I like it. It is made very well, it is spacious enough to handle a couple of technical books and it looks nice.

Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

These earbuds are a little on the bulky side (at least for me), but the sound quality is decent and I like the wire that attaches the buds. I've lost the separate bluetooth earbuds multiple times but the ear phones with the wire that connects to the device gets caught on EVERYTHING so these are a Godsend! Lasts for hours and charges up quickly. They eventually do hurt my ears after wearing them for an hour or so but then you should be wearing them for that long and my ear holes are on the smaller side even with the small silicone ear attachment. Really decent and worth it to have!
Normal apple headphone quality

These earbuds are so big and bulky. I am a woman and couldn‚Äôt stand wearing them. They hurt my ears no matter how I wore them. My husband tried them as well and said he preferred a pair he already had because the sound quality wasn‚Äôt as good and they looked ridiculously big.

This small device packs a lot of technology in for barely over $20. Easy to pair via Bluetooth and transmit via the fm radio. Call reception is very good. I plugged in a USB thumb drive with flac files and the music playing on the radio sounds great. I also hooked up my Astell & Kern AK Jr via the aux input and again got very nice audio quality with the radio. Also charged my iPhone quickly. Highly recommend and lots less expensive than replacing the stereo in the car.

Very comfortable to sleep in, and the sound is much better than I expected. You may have to open up the headband (there is a Velcro closure to allow for washing) o move the headphone pieces a bit in one direction or the other so that each one centers exactly above the ear. The fabric is very soft. This product is also great for running in the wintertime.

The video quality of this camcorder is equal to the price point, basically don‚Äôt expect the same video quality as a $2000 camcorder.  Great camcorder for the young budding videographer,  for recording birthdays, vacations, graduations, and private video recording etc. The video recording time varies depending on the video recording settings that are selected and condition of the battery.  The led lamps will be an added drain on the battery and will greatly reduce the recording time.  The led lamps NOT IR lamps for true night vision, they only add additional lighting to areas that have dim light areas that are being recorded.  As mentioned previously this camcorder would be an ideal gift for the young person who is just getting started with videography.

Presently using this with my Sansa Clip+ running Rockbox, been using it for a couple weeks without incident, so it is supported. Great if you want to run FLAC or audiobooks or both, haven't had the slightest issue.

Also, still incredible they can fit that much space on such a tiny chip.

These really cancel out the noise quite well. I had a set of similar earbuds but one found it‚Äôs demise in the toilet (not a good day).
I tried to find the old pair since I liked them but no luck. These popped up as an item that was similar. I liked that the charging dock shows the battery power as my wife has a set from a different seller that doesn‚Äôt show this and it‚Äôs quite frustrating to gauge battery life.

The standard ear plugs that came with the device worked for me but there are a couple more size options.

The sound is great and since they snug right in your ear it‚Äôs easy to keep them in and not falling out. I don‚Äôt notice any static and have actually found they are louder than my other pair (I‚Äôve had to adjust the volume down on my walks from my previous pair).

Great set. They are a little hard to get out of the case but that‚Äôs the same issue all of these earbuds have since there‚Äôs not a tiny handle piece to grab hold of (just a rounded top of the earbud).
Great and highly recommend!

Our family is a bunch of speaker and ear phone fanatics. Everyone has different likes and I tend to like a well balanced music. Muffled really bugs me.

I wanted to have a nice balanced speaker that no one will take so I decided to get this one for ME. It has a nice solid housing and I figured it was worth getting since my favorite speaker seems to get misplaced a lot. Let's take a look.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This is a very solid speaker. It is heavy duty and it has metal housing. The sides are not as fragile as others I have used which sound this good. It comes in a beautiful gift box which has cushioning and the typical Santana design to it. The speaker itself is pretty heavy so it is not something you toss in your backpack and run off with. It needs a bit more care than that.

CHARGING
This has a USB charger that will take about 4 hours to charge it up with. There is also a connection where you can get a FAST charger from the company, but you have to contact them for it. The charging cable comes with it just need a USB outlet. The directions warn to only use the original cable that comes with this to charge or there might be damage to the speaker. The voltage must be 5V with current rated at 115A.

CAN THIS RUN WHILE CHARGING?
I do not see in the instructions warnings against this, and it does work while plugged in.

PLAY TIME
This speaker runs out of juice pretty quickly. If you want it to last the entire time of 10 hours, I highly suggest you not put the volume up past 30%. Any higher and the battery time runs down pretty quickly. At 60% you are at the edge of running this down pretty quickly- as in 4 or 5 hours play time only.

PAIRING
I have had no issues pairing this with tablets or phones using Android. Just like when you turn the power on, it says PAIRING in a very loud voice so you will know when it is in pairing mode.

VOLUME
The volume button on this is tricky. If you are not thinking and just quickly press the volume once, instead of it getting slightly louder, you will skip a track. You have to press the volume down and not let up if you want the sound to go up or down depending on the button you press meaning +/-.

CARD SLOT
This speaker can also work off of a TF card (also known as a microSD card). You just have to change from bluetooth mode to card mode using the MODE button.

IS THERE AUX CAPABILITY?
I have an old MP3 player that has higher quality recordings than anything new I have. That only uses AUX and it works great with this.

PAUSE / PLAY
You can pause or play music with this using the MFB button

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
Let me tell you, this thing ROCKS. I mean it. This speaker is fabulous. Not only does it work great out of the box (after being fully charged) but it sounds better and better as you break it in. It fills the house with music that is great quality and does not have interference or any lag issues either.

WHAT ABOUT BASS, MIDS AND HIGHS?
I have to say that this speaker is one of the few that I have used which does a beautiful job of intense bass, balanced clear highs but the mids are not muffled at all. It is impressive and what I thought a speaker always should be.

CAN YOU USE TWO TOGETHER?
This allows you to add one other speaker to the system so you can have them in two places. I do not have another Europa speaker at the moment I can test that with.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Although this blows any other wireless speaker I have had out of the water, it does blow through power rather quickly unless the volume is pretty low. It is not only amazing out of the box (After charging) but it gets better with more use. This baby ROCKS.

MY RATING
Finding a speaker which does not overwhelm you with out of whack bass, piercing highs, or muffled middles is not always easy. This speaker seems to divide it all out very well. It is one of the nicest speakers I have used (wireless) to date. FIVE STARS!

Not only do I love this, but would definitely consider a second one along with the fast charger in the future to round out the whole system.

ANOTHER THING
This product has a notification on it that some of the proceeds from this product will go to help underprivileged children through the MILAGRO foundation (miracle) that Carlos Santana and his family started in 1998.

One more thing to stop all conversation!  Our granddaughter loves these - first of all, the color - and then the sound quality.  It was difficult to separate her from them when it was study time, but the good thing is that she likes them enough to take care of them.  We‚Äôve bought so many earbuds - it looks like this set may actually be around for a while.  The sound quality is excellent - we had to give them a try!

This has everything I needed in a power strip: length of cord, flat plug, and six receptacles.  It's perfect for two bedside lamps plus phone and Kindle recharger. I plan to order a second one for my livingroom.
I've had 50 dollar headphones before, and they were way better. This par of beats had terrible noise isolation, and volume. Wouldn't recommend.

I purchased this case based on other reviews because of the excellent keyboard (removable), and Zagg's reputation for quality products. The case offers excellent iPad protection, and the keyboard is exactly the right size and very responsive!  Very easy to set up the Bluetooth connection with the included instructions. The case is lightweight, but offers excellent protection. The only thing I would strongly suggest is adding a screen protector to your iPad. When this case is closed, the screen rests directly on the keys of the keyboard. Otherwise, this case is excellent and I will use it solely when traveling.  I highly recommend this case and keyboard for those who prefer typing on a real keyboard as opposed to the virtual keyboard. It is specifically designed for iPad with custom keys added to access various options with keystrokes (closing apps....).
i break headphones easy these look cool and can withstand anything LOVE them

If you have a lot of devices that you use with your computer or your laptop, you know you never have enough USB slots. This has a mini hdmi, 4 regular USB slots, 1 fast USB slot and a USB C slot. Not to mention your television, internet, audio hookups. Has all I need.
A really nice set of speaker mounts with lots of flexibility. you can definitely twist and turn them to get the preferred position and they can be shrunk to fit closer to the wall.

So impressed with this tiny speaker! When fist turned on, the power and connect tones are clear and unique, not obnoxious, and upon connection the volume is usually much louder than expected. The sound coming from this little guy is HUGE and CLEAR! It would be too loud for comfort for me before it distorts, so I can‚Äôt even say whether it distorts at all. Fantastic sound! Recommended!!

Really wish I had figured out the new straight edge before I bought it. It's like the Surface Pro.

AND it doesn't have an audio jack! You have those new thick edges, why not have a jack!?

Not at all like previous iPads or the 10.5 iPad Pro. If you have one of those, keep it!!

This has proven to be a very nice little acquisition. We got it primarily as a way to unlock the songs on our iPods so we could share them, or enjoy music without being tethered to headphones, but it has ended up being our bed stand iPhone charger and portable music player.

The sound put out by these speakers has a Bose-like quality (not exactly Bose equivalent, but a similar, warm, full sound.) This is not a particularly loud sound system, but it does fill our small bedroom adequately to a reasonable volume. It will not fill a large room or outdoor area for sure, or belt out heavy metal, but does great at an adult contemporary listening level.

After getting this, one thing became quickly evident. The lack of a remote kind of sucks. At first I figured it wouldn't be a problem, but since you must use the controls on the ipod, (the speakers only have volume and power controls built in) you need to move to the speakers to skip songs, change volume or turn off. This doesn't seem like a big idea, and for the price, it is understandable that there is no remote, but I found that it is worth the extra money to get a speaker system with a remote.

One thing I really like about it is the portability and the ability to run off of batteries. We have used it a couple times at night to play owl calls to hear owls call back to us. Also, since it is so portable we move it all around the house and garage which is very handy.

Pros:
Nice full sound (although not overly loud)
Highly portable
Battery power option
Nice and small
Well designed

Cons:
No Remote
Picks up dust quickly, hard to keep clean
Limited controls, you must use controls on iPod
No equalizer controls

All in all, it fills a niche for us and we are happy with the quality of the product an the sound. It is all around nice set of speakers at a nice price.

My 19 year old daughter recently inherited a car from her grandmother. There were 2 things that I had wanted her car to have - Bluetooth and a rear view camera. The 2012 Honda Civic had neither of those. This car multimedia player arrived at the right time. It wasn't too difficult to install. My husband while assisted by our daughter completed the whole thing in less than an hour. Prior to the installation, we had ordered an install kit for the car model. This unit works very well with Apple Play! It basically displays your phone on it so your phone on it. So you use the touch screen method to access your music, driving maps, etc. It comes with a microphone for phone calls. They installed it near the ignition, but the quality of calls isn't that good. The next time our daughter comes home from college, they're going to try it somewhere else. Overall, our daughter is very happy with it. It has wires specifically for a rear view camera, so guess what we're installing on her next visit?

I really like these little speakers. The volume control and on/off switch are pretty nice considering the small size and reasonable price. Sound quality is about what you'd expect - slightly better than portable "laptop" speakers, but good enough for me. They certainly beat the built-in speaker in my LED monitor!

This case offers nice protection for my iPad air (gen 3). The cover has provisions to allow folding it into a stand to use the iPad as a monitor and of course, cutouts for all ports, speakers, etc. There's also a slot in the fold for storing an iPad pencil. Nice!
Comfortable headphones arrived quickly and packaged great!!

Very satisfied with the S3821 unit.

I purchased this at Costco's online site as it was on special for $ 30 off. That's why it's not shown as an Amazon verified purchase.

Overall excellent. A few issues and one dislike.

The digital optical cable provided was flimsy and didn't work.
So- I decided to try the Coaxial cable provided. It fit the Vizio soundbar, but not the Vizio TV.
Next, I went with the RCA cable, analog connection. Disappointing sound, but still better than my TV. Subwoofer was nearly nonexistent.

The next morning, I found an old high quality optical cable I had in storage. Connected immediately with noticeably higher quality sound. Also, the subwoofer sounded a lot better after the optical cable replaced the RCA cable.

My dislike is the led light system that you must use to find the right input. Finding the right input by sound is certainly possible, but I kept missing the connection by not waiting enough between presses. Look at the instructions provided. For optical cable, it's the lights out preceding the 4 lights to the right. Wish they just had a few lights with marked inputs.

Every time you go to bluetooth, the input automatically changes to the correct input, but you need to manually reset it for your sound input. Easy enough after a few times, but confusing at first.

Likes. VG sound. I previously had a Polk 5.1 system, but retired and we moved to a small condo. Had to give it away. So I have invested in HQ sound systems. With optical, subwoofer sound is noticeable and adds to the system sound. Where my Polk subwoofer sound output faced the floor, and boomed off the hardwood floor, this subwoofer sound is front facing, and relies on bouncing off the walls. That's better if you have carpet, and not hardwood. Voices are much clearer than my Vizio TV speakers. Hated using closed caption so often. That's why I got a soundbar.

Likes. Excellent and easy bluetooth pairing. Paired immediately to my Iphone 5. I have Amazon Prime, with free music streaming for many of my favorite songs. Pulled up Amazon music on my Iphone, picked a song and wow - great sounding music. Soundbar is worth the cost for this feature alone.

Likes. Subwoofer paired easily.

Likes. My Vizio TV remote controls the soundbar with a few exceptions. Need the soundbar remote to switch to bluetooth. Important functions are on the soundbar itself, if the remote breaks or gets lost.

Likes. Have it in front of the TV. Low enough that it doesn't interfere with the TV remote. Some soundbars would have covered the the Remote to TV receiver.

My deduction is for the LED light feature.

These Tomot speakers are inexpensive and pretty decent. They are attractive, black with red accents. They aren‚Äôt super large.  To me they seem to be about 4x6. They are small enough to fit on a shelf, or by a laptop. They are easy to use. There are no directions, but right out of the box, you can plug them in the computer (via USB or audio jack). The sound quality is good. Jazz, classic, rock and R&B all sound great. These are relatively inexpensive.  They work with a variety of devices. Only drawback, when not playing music, but still plugged in, these speakers make a slight noise. So for a very small investment, you get a decent pair of speakers.

I purchased these replacement pads for my Bose QC-15 headphones as the old pads were torn and needed to be replaced. I selected this set of pads based on the positive reviews here on Amazon with the thought that they would be the same as the original pads. While they look the same, they are indeed slightly different.

First things first - these pads are fairly easy to install though they do require a little persistence to get them to snap into place. The earphones themselves have small tabs around the edges designed to snap the pads' bases into place and hold securely, and if the pads are not snapped down they simply will not stay securely. The inner foam and cloth shield that covers the electronics is easy to install but I had trouble with the double-sided tape that holds them in place - the adhesive did not want to release the cover strip and I had real difficulty peeling that strip away without ripping the actual cloth.

Once in place, the phones look exactly like they did when they were new, but I found three differences. First, the phones no longer fit into the case as easily as they once did. Instead of just turning the cups to lay flat and simply putting them in the case, now I have to mess with them slightly to fit into the case properly, though they can be made to fit. More noticeable, though, is that the pads are not as effective as the originals for passive noise canceling. A fan that I have in my office used to be canceled out almost completely with the combination of passive and active noise canceling but is now more audible than when the original pads were in place. I would not say the difference is enough to render the earphones' ability to cancel noise completely compromised, but they are definitely not the same. Finally, these replacement pads are just a little less supple and soft than the original pads. It is not all that noticeable until comparing the original and replacement pads side by side. You have to really be looking closely for the difference to notice it, but it's there.

The difference in noise canceling ability is most noticeable when working in an environment with reverb. I use my phones to monitor sound coming through a professional sound board because these have always done an excellent job of eliminating reverb and leaving just what comes through the sound board. With these new pads in place, I can now hear a lot of reverb, even when I press the phones tight over my ears and have ensured that they completely cover my ears so it's not a gapping issue. The material is different, plain and simple.

These are not bad replacement pads by any means. They are very good, they are comfortable and they do make these phones look brand new again. That said, they were not manufactured by Bose and there are some differences. When considering the cost difference between these and Bose parts, the trade-offs balance out favorably. If you have to have an exact match with the original pads, these are very close but not 100% identical. If you are satisfied with a [roughly] 90%-95% match, these pads work nicely for a lot less than original manufacturer pads.

I did a lot of research as to what to get for my kids to replace their aging and damaged Samsung Tab A's. We decided that it was time to go to a Chromebook so that they could get more repetition with a standard keyboard and GoogleOS. They are still able to download all the PlayStore apps that they had on their tablets, but now with better hardware and longer support.
This model has 64GB of storage (with SD card option), so thats a huge upgrade. The RAM is 4GB, which is more than most cheap tablets these days, and you can tell. Its a LOT snappier than the Galaxys.
The 2in1 flip with the screen is my kids favorite part! They can use it like a "real computer" and then flip it to make a huge tablet screen instead. Much bigger than the 8" screen they had before.
For an entry level chromebook, these are sturdy, snappy, and cheap! I dare you to find something better for preteens at this price point!
NOTE: some of the reviews here complain about the speaker quality/power. This was one of the only things I was weary about when I finally committed to this unit. Those reviews are DEAD WRONG. The speakers are GREAT on these Chromebooks. The quality is clear, and they are louder than both of my other laptops and tablets. Playing videos through YouTube at 1/2 volume is much louder than the max of my other units. Don't let the "terrible speaker" reviews sway you.

What a piece of junk, has never worked, tried everything possible. Too late for a refund.
This is the only Amazon product I have bought that failed me. Simply wont connect to the car or my truck via Bluetooth

These do the job but the hardness of the earbud really hurt my ears.  The sound was good, quality is fair.  Battery life could be better.  If you have larger ears they‚Äôd be okay but my small sensitive ones were really sore after each use.

The Vansky Amplified Digital Indoor HDTV Antenna is a good option for those who want to cut the cord from the expensive cable companies. The setup is easy,  you just screw in the antenna to the amplifier, then the cable from the amplifier to your digital TV and adjust the location of where you get the best reception. Run the antenna channel scan on the TV and then you see how many channels you can pick up with the antenna. The antenna has a long cable so you can move it around to find the spot where you can receive the best signals being broadcasted. This antenna is only for indoor use. It works well for me and I'm happy with this antenna and I would recommend this to anyone who wants to cut the cord with paid cable television.
Using it to cool my home theater receiver, silent and cool looking!

When it comes to radios, so many of them just don't have the reception that they used to. I came across this one and decided it was worth the try. Unfortunately, the battery choice is annoying, but let's take a look at the radio..

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This is a pretty straightforward radio. It has AM and FM. Each band has a horizontal dial on it. The volume button is large and turns the radio on and off as well. You can adjust the tone from high to low which will either focus on voice or on base tones for what you are listening to.

HANDLE
The handle on this is sturdy and easy to carry.

ANTENNA
The antenna on this is sturdy and easy to pull out and push in.

JACK
There is a standard headphone jack.

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
This performs beautifully. The reception is exceptional and I can pull in stations that most other newer radios do not pull in any more. The sound is fabulous with a lot of depth to it.

BATTERIES
I really dislike that this takes 4 D batteries. Those batteries are expensive and tend to run out quickly. I don't normally carry them in the house for emergencies, but it would be worth having some since this radio is great and easy to hear.

WHO MIGHT LIKE THIS RADIO?
Anyone who loves to listen to AM still would love this radio. Many of them don't have it anymore which is frustrating. I also found that it is great for older people to have one of these. I know an older gentleman who has been bed ridden and home bound and he loves this radio. It is easy to operate, see, and great sound.

THE BOTTOM LINE
I like this radio. It is good to have on hand for emergencies or for good listening when internet is down or I just am tired of the internet radio channels and prefer to be local. The sound is great and operation easy. Fabulous reception.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This is a perfect gift for older people or those who really enjoy local radio and prefer an easy to use radio that has great reception. Just be sure to have D batteries for emergencies. If it had rechargeable features, it would be perfect!

Man, I got a new phone(galaxy s20) and they salesman hyped it up and it is dope but how is this the future with headphone jack?? I didn't notice till I got home and was like. What?!? But this thing is dope you can charge and listen at the same time(like why is that so amazing we've been able to do this like wtf) but needless to say, the future is here. Charges fast and audio great. I have it plugged in my car aux at all times(car doesn't have Bluetooth) and have no issues. I read some ppl said you have to plug it in the aux first before the phone. So idk ihave it plugged in at all times so idk. But yea, does what it's supposed to with no problem. The little box does get hot so keep that in mind, but doesn't seem to affect the product tho.

I have a room on my property which gets cold and damp. I was looking for a power strip that I could use in that room without having to worry about the dampness. After using it, I am considering another one to use under one of my fish tanks.

HOW THIS IS SET UP
This is set up beautifully for indoor or outdoor use. The outlets make it easy to use all six plugs with transformer plugs if necessary. The plug goes at an angle and is flush with the outlet instead of sticking out.

IS IT WATERPROOF?
This does seem to withstand the brief time I had it outside with rain and other windy weather. As I said, I wanted this to use for a damp room instead of outside, but it performed well outside through some rain storms. I am not considering a second one of these for under one of my fish aquariums.

CORD
I only wish that the cord was a bit longer. For use outside, longer cords help to set things up better. This one is very short for that. For my use, the room I wanted it for, it just fits, and if I get one for my fish aquarium area, it will just fit there as well.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Depending on what you use this for, it seems to handle well outside or inside . If the cord was longer, it would be perfect.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. It does perform well so far, but I just wish the cord was longer if I wanted to use it outside.

I bought these mainly for use at home for using with my iPad.  Sound quality meets my needs so I am happy with them.  The noise cancelling at home does have an effect, but will test them next week on the plane in place of my corded Bose headphones.  It will be nice to reduce the bulky case from my carry on.  Will revise my review if need to after trying them on the plane.  But fairly simple to use for this senior.  Very nice packaging as well.  Reminded me of the apple packs.  But with more color.  :-)

Loving these headphones. The sound is awesome, no problems with calls or hearing them or myself. Love the bass with these too. They were easy to pair with my phone and tablet and work great. They also fit my ears perfectly and don't make my ears hurt after wearing them for a long time. These have also been super awesome to wear at the gym and haven't been anything but awesome.

I love these. I normally have cheap headphones. I‚Äôm not much of a music person really but decided I needed something better than drug store check out lane earphones. I was ecstatic with these. Granted, my expectations were not DJ sound but I loved the sound on these. Very crisp. Very clear. Very comfortable. VERY happy customer.
Honestly, if I was designing them, I‚Äôm not sure how I could make them any better.

i bought it for my Inspiron 15 - 3583 -it was a tight fit for the keyboard section and most things lined up but only on one side-that left the screen portion floppy- then i looked at the picture of the sample and it was on upside down....it is weird but thats how they expect you to use it-i feel so ripped off that this isnt what i paid for at all!

[[VIDEOID:676a9c562ee284b4873a8774f1caf9d6]] With modern computers cutting down on the number of ports, relying on the speed of USB 3.1 Type-c to handle all of the I/O load, consumers now have to provide their own docks or dongles. This means that we are dealing with more cables and what is termed "dongle hell". This is just the reality, unfortunately. It's both more convenient (a single cable to connect all of your accessories) and less convenient at the same time.

Well, this isn't the fault of the HENRETY USB C Hub, it's just here to help resolve the problem that you are facing... and it does a good job of it. The hub is sleek, with an aluminum shell and high-quality ports.

In my use, I already have a small dongle to connect my laptop to an external monitor but I ran out of ports for it. I needed more ports, but I didn't need another HDMI output. I opted to save some money and get a simple USB hub and it really does work very well. I have a backup external drive connected that I periodically backup my video editing projects to and I also have my Dualsense (PS5) controller connected to it. I haven't had a problem yet.

If you just need some ports without the fancy HDMI, ethernet, and audio outputs save some money and get the Henrety hub.

We recently moved into a new home and I took the time to install all of my electronics so each connection not only works correctly but looks professionally installed.

Having the correct plates makes all of the difference in having an install look both clean and professional - this plate set is exactly that.

I installed one plate directly behind my flat screen TV mount and snaked the power cable and all of the HDMI and audio cables through to reach the other next to the power outlet where our streaming boxes are also located.

This matching plate is behind our entertainment cabinet that houses our surge protector, Fire Cube, Apple TV, Fire Cube and stereo.

This is an awesome wall brush plate set if you are interested in an amazingly clean, great looking, professional installation.

The [[ASIN:B009FHFFIG Sennheiser Momentum Over-Ear Headphone]] are circumaural  which means they cover the whole ear and they have a closed-back.  They are lightweight, gorgeous with soft brown leather cushioned earpieces, have two easily switchable cables, one for general use and the second for specified mac devices.  A MacBook is not one of the specified devices, but my iPod is.  With its swivel plug and embedded on the cable remote, I'm sure iPhone and iPad users will be as thrilled as I was when I tried it on a friend's devices.  Crisp, clear, complete, these need no amplifier, but they do need ears which are not larger than average or the whole ear coverage is lacking and therefore, so is the desired effect of a circumaural earpiece.  I've listened to music on a MacBook, an android phone, a Kindle Fire, and tested these on the aforementioned iPad and iPhone.  In each and every case, the sound was outstanding and my ears did not tire, nor did they feel uncomfortable or overheated.  Most sounds surrounding me were not heard and those nearby did not hear what I was listening to at any time.  Watching movies is enhanced every time and I'm finding that even when impulsively finding a video on the Web in my usual activities, I tend to grab these headphones to listen instead of simply hearing through the computer.  My favorite music in these earphones thus far today has been John Coltrane's [[ASIN:B000V698WE A Love Supreme]].  I tend to switch genres throughout a day, but thought this was worth mentioning.  Nothing like really hearing the instrumentals as they were intended to be heard!  Outstanding headphones.
We think their measurements are off because these are too big for our boat speakers.

This Bluetooth record player is so neat! I have so many old records and I can‚Äôt wait to use them on here.

It connects easily to Bluetooth and the sound quality is amazing for the size of this unit. It is a mix of vintage with modern. I love it.

Bought a new TV mount that drops the TV down in front of the fireplace.  Liked having the TV lower when we watch it but up and out of the way when not washing. However, when the TV is down it booked the DVR and BR player.  I used this to relay the IR single.  Works great, I plugged it into one of the USB ports on the TV and mounted the receiver to the front of the TV and the emitters to the back of the TV. The single is strong enough that I did not need to place the emitters in the devices themselves so I don't have wires to worry about when I move the TV.

Purchased as a backup, which became my primary BT phone headset after my other unit flew out a car window at 70 MPH. Refurb unit functions well except the audio is muffled compared to  the identical unit this replaced. Good for price paid

The one thing I don't like on this wired headphone, is the fact that it is wired. If it is used on a young child, they could get caught up in the wiring. Using it as a headband or to cover eyes works great. It is fleece material, so it is comfortable. The headphones can be removed ant the headband can be laundered as needed. I like that the speakers can only have the volume adjusted to a volume that is never too loud, so that a child never gets them so loud that they could damage their hearing

Handy. well made, and a perfect fit.
Excellent protection for the speaker.

I've always wanted a wireless off camera monitor for director/crew use on our freelance camera operator gigs, or for when mounting the camera somewhere difficult to see like the side of a car. A few years ago, a solution like this would have cost upwards of $2k, but now thanks to products like this one we can do it on a shoestring budget!
I attached the transmitter to a USB battery bank and used gaffer's tape to attach to my camera cage with my Sony A7S inside. On the other side, I took a flash bracket and mounted a 7" monitor, and once again used gaffer's tape to sandwich the receiver to another battery supply and secure to the handle of the bracket. Note that the receiver isn't designed to run off USB power like the transmitter is (why, I don't know), so I had to use a modified cable to make one end a USB - it is still only 5v, but I think it requires at least 2amps so it is pickier about what battery bank will work with it. My smaller battery supply didn't crank out enough power so it won't start (blue light would just blink), but a larger battery supply that I have did just fine.
Once the two were wired up, as a proof of concept I fired up the camera and had a live feed in full 1080p on the remote monitor, which worked fine as long as I was in the same room as the camera. Pretty useful! If you look at the included image, you can see both units on the floor working, but I'll need some shorter cables to clean it up in the future (didn't have any short cable available for this test, so it looks messy).
The only thing I wish Sabrent had done better is include a mount for the transmitter to attach to the camera hotshoe. They claim it comes with one in the box, and even show a picture of it mounted to a camera but it does NOT! It comes with a bracket that uses a thumb screw to attach to something, but it will only fit into a hotshoe if you have an adapter for your shoe mount that will accept a screw through it. The thumb screw and shoe mount that they show in the picture are not included in the box, which disappointed me. No matter, I'd still need a battery supply for this so I had to attach it to a cage anyway. But I felt like that picture was misleading in the product's image.
I also wish that they had made the receiver work off a standard USB plug as well so I wouldn't have to use a modified cable for it. It worked pretty well so I can't complain too much at the end of the day.
Although I was interested primarily in off camera monitoring, I discovered this device is very well suited to send your laptop's display to a TV. With the receiver on your TV wired up, the transmitter actually works like a dongle right out of the laptop's hdmi port, and just needs a short run of USB for power from the closest port. This is the cleanest use of this product that I can imagine, and it works well for that. Pretty amazing what it can do for the price these days!

I'm not a buyer of high-end ear buds. At my age my hearing isn't acute enough to hear much of the nuance of music through headphones, but I do like the sound to be much better than if I were holding a can and string up to my ears. That being said, these are the best earphones I've ever owned. When I first put them on, the bass response actually startled me and the middles and highs were present and clear --without any adjustment to my player. The "stays in your ears" feature actually works; you give them a twist in your ear and they stay put, as well as keeping out sweat. You can hear ambient noise just fine, but unless there's a high wind or other competing sound, you continue to hear the audio just fine.

I don't agree with other reviewers who report that the plastic earbuds fall off easily. I think those reviewers must be actually pulling the buds off to clean them and I don't believe that's the manufacturers' intentions. I clean mine with a mini-fiber cloth well moistened (but not soggy) with rubbing alcohol without removing them from the actual earpieces.

The reason I didn't give these earphone five stars is that there is no inline control --no mute off, or volume control. I like them VERY much, and would buy them again if I needed to replace.

This Splat stuff is really interesting. When I first got the jar, it was filled to the top with gooey shivery bright orange goo that is the same type of thing we used to get at the toy store and throw against the wall and watch it roll down.

This glob of goo, however, is supposed to be used to clean crevices in your car- speakers, dials, switches, vents, etc, that you can not easily clean otherwise. I did not use this goo right away, and almost a month later, I was surprised to see that the volume of the Splat goo went down by half. It had shrunk- and no one had taken any out either.

It is a bit weird to get used to using at first too, but it quickly becomes easy to manipulate into little places you want to clean.

When using it, it really does work. Little switches and indented areas that gather a lot of dirt and dust were cleaned well with no residue. The only problems I had were two:

---Don't drop it on the floor or it will grab every single stone, piece of dirt, or garbage it touches.

---Don't let it touch the windows or it will leave a smudge that you can only see at night when lights are coming at you and it can be very distracting. It does wash off relatively easily- but it takes a bit of work to get it back to the way it was.

All in all, however, I like Splat. As long as I don't drop it or let it touch any windows in the car, it does a good job. It is only useable for 50 uses and that is not a whole lot- but it is biodegradable. I have not used it up yet so I can not comment on the biodegradability of Splat.
These are nice earbuds usually my mom can have just one on all day without it going dead

Unfortunately there is too much lag between Nikon D3500 and MacBook Pro using HDMI. Quality is clear and crisp, but too much lag and audio does not sync properly if you do a video recording. As you get further into the recording the video lags further and further behind the video sync.

Note: there is a [[ASIN:B00QEY99DU Newer version] of this earpiece that I have also reviewed. Like that one I received this as a review sample. This one is still impressive for the following reasons: foremost is price. Even at full list this is an ideal way to use your phone legally in locales that enforce hands free laws (and the number is growing.)

It's also comfortable, which is surprising to me because I hate in-ear buds. In this case, the array f provided ear pieces in various sides ensures a good fit regardless of your age or size. Ironically the medium fit me perfectly.

Sound quality for music is not spectacular, but more than adequate for casual listening. I made and received calls and the clarity of those on both ends were also adequate. Not spectacular, but not terrible. When you consider that this is less than twenty bucks at the time of this review then in that context you are getting more than you are paying for in that department.

This may not be the best single ear headset on the market, but it's by far among the best in its price range - and since it is so inexpensive and does what it should do I am rating it five stars.

I have used active noise canceling (ANC) headphones for many years and I have come to expect - and look for - the subtle differences between them. I have worked with ANC phones from Bose, Sennheiser, Monster, Noontec and quite a few more. All of them have their strengths and weaknesses. This is my first experience with Sony ANC phones, and I anticipated good ANC functionality and a solid sound profile. At the price point ($300 as I write this) they need to be excellent to be worth any kind of consideration. These were a huge shock to me: the ANC is nearly on par with Bose and the sound profile is solid, giving better results than I imagined.

I will address the ANC function first, then the sound profile, and afterward I will discuss design and features. I apologize ahead of time for being long-winded, but I‚Äôd rather give too much feedback than not enough.

The ANC function is, in a single word, outstanding. Bose is the standard by which I compare others and very, very few headphones get anywhere near the same level of noise cancellation as my Bose sets (QC-15 and QC-20i, by the way). Those that get close usually have the same weird pressure sensation for which Bose is known. My primary test is a loud fan that I use for generating white noise when I want to drown out everything around me at night. I turned the fan on high speed, plugged the Sony‚Äôs buds into my ears and turned them on. I put them in ANC mode and the fan all but disappeared. All that remained of the noise was a faint, higher-frequency hiss (distinct from the ANC hiss which I will explain later). Of all the phones I have used, this set and the Bose are the only ones to wipe out that much noise. I also went into the bathroom and turned on the ventilation fan to test, and these phones again wiped out a large majority of the fan noise. For this fan, the Bose sets have a very slight edge but you have to be looking for it to notice.

The main difference between the Bose sets and these is the utter lack of that weird pressure sensation with these. If you don‚Äôt like that sensation but you want very high ANC, these are simply excellent. Like a lot of ANC phones, these generate a faint hiss that you really won‚Äôt notice unless you‚Äôre not feeding any sound at all to them and you‚Äôre listening for it.

The sound profile is also quite solid. Usually with ANC phones, because of the cancellation of certain bandwidths the phones compensate by twiddling the sound profile to fill in what was dropped, and usually this means overcompensation in the bass range (if you use Dre Beats, you know exactly what I mean). Heavy bass gives me headaches so I avoid headphones where the bass has been given too much boost. With these, Sony did not overdrive the bass at all but it‚Äôs still very solid and full - love it. The midrange is very warm and rich and music has the right depth. The highs are very bright and clear but not piercing. Overall, I am very pleased with the sound profile - not audiophile quality but closer than most.

In terms of design, these are a wireless earbud product with a neck harness. So, these are neither on-ear or over-ear phones. The harness and slack but adjustable wiring to the actual earbuds ensures that they can be set up so they won‚Äôt tug or pull when you‚Äôre working out, running or otherwise doing physical activity. Being wireless, there‚Äôs no cord to tangle up either. And, one size really does fit all which is a problem with some regular phones. The neck assembly has a leatherette padding that is soft and will not chafe.

The Bluetooth functionality works great. I paired these to my phone and they paired and connected in less than 5 seconds which is really all I could ask. After a full power-off, I turned them back on and they immediately connected to my phone again. I have no complaints there.

One of the really interesting features of these is the ability to turn off the ANC and use them without any cancellation, but they have another unusual mode that I have only seen in one other pair of phones - they have an ‚Äúambient sound‚Äù mode that you can turn on that dampens the feed in the buds and slightly increases the surrounding noise without turning off the ANC. Assuming the volume is not turned up too loud, this allows for carrying on a conversation without turning off the feed. I will say, though, that listening to my own voice coming through in this mode is disconcerting.

I do not know yet how long the battery in these lasts. So far I have not run them all the way down.

Included in the box are the phones themselves, a conversion cable so that they can be used with an audio jack (handy when Bluetooth is not an option), a cable for charging, an in-flight audio adapter, several silicone tips fo the buds so you can get the size right, and a protective carry bag.

The carry bag is the only complaint I have with the whole package - it offers little protection from drops and crushes. If you only are concerned about keeping everything together and keeping the set very clean, the bag is acceptable, but if you need better protection that consider getting a third-party hard case or use the original packaging box.

Sony got these right and even at the price tag these are easy to recommend. They‚Äôre comfortable (more comfortable than I expected for ear buds), they have excellent sound and the ANC function is outstanding. I prefer these to my Bose phones and will be using these instead.

I just ordered this for my 7th generation iPad and the case itself appears to be almost indestructible. In fact it is so well put together that it takes about 30 minutes just to install it with the iPad.

INSTALLATION
- Pull the stand off the case.

- Remove the silicone outer rim from the cover. I found removing the silicone rim hard to figure out until I took my fingernail¬†to peel if off the track that goes around the entire top of the case. It gets peeled off from the outermost edge.

- Unhinge the miniscule snaps (by the arrows) located around the case in order to open it. Once again, my stubby fingernails came in handy. It is only then that the iPad can be inserted.

- Insert the iPad into the open case. Make sure it is facing correctly based on the orientation of the case.

- DO NOT remove the plastic film covering the home button that is on the clear plastic case top. I did not know this and removed it and it damaged the cover with glue (see photos). It removed cleanly on all but one side where tremendous glue residue was left behind. The plastic film was partially up before I even began pulling it off and is typical of the type film I see covering watch faces, etc. so naturally I removed it as there was no mention not to in the manual.

- Re-fasten the top and "snap" it into place.

- Re-attach the silicone rim. Make sure that the rim once again is pulled up and over the top of the case and that the silicone edge is pushed into the track around the case. If it is not seated in the track, the case will not be sealed correctly.

With regard to the large smear of glue residue left behind by the thin plastic film that covered the home button. I contacted support to find out what can be used to remove this residue but there was nothing they could recommend with the iPad inside. They did say possibly hand sanitizer because it had alcohol in it but that should not touch the iPad. A damp rag did not work nor did a rag with water. This is extremely upsetting to me because it mars an otherwise nice looking case. However, they are sending me a replacement case with a possible return label for the "new" damaged case. I will update my review after I receive the new case.

The stand is detachable and has two heights that can be used in four positions. What this means is that the low stand can be used with the iPad in the portrait or landscape postion. The stand can then be reversed for standing up the iPad in¬†the portrait or landscape postion. I personally only like the landscape position for either height as it feels like the iPad is going to fall using in portrait mode.

Also note that the stand is not easy to just snap on and off of the case if one is storing it there. It takes a little bit of effort and time. Although, it can be snapped on the case for portability, I have chosen not to do this because of this difficulty. Instead I just choose to lay the stand on top of the iPad so it is easily put into service.

In summary, this is an excellent case that offers superb protection for the iPad. The case is extremely heavy. It is almost like carrying a laptop around from the olden days. I love the low stand angle with the iPad in the landscape position; in fact, that is the only way I like the stand. This postion is perfect for typing on the iPad as if one is typing on a keyboard.¬† I am, however, very upset about the glue left behind from the plastic circle strip that covered the home button which I should not have removed but which was not mentioned in the manual. Had my cover not been destroyed by this glue, I would have rated this 4 stars. If there was no glue residue and the stand was part of the cover and was not so heavy, I would have rated this 5 stars. I personally prefer a stand that is attached to the case. This requires setup each time as a separate piece.

UPDATE: I updated my review above regarding the home button sticker I pulled off. Otter box said it was not supposed to get removed because it is a fully enclosed system. I asked them to update their documentation to say this so others do not make the same mistake I did. I will post another update after my new case arrives and perhaps update this review to 4 stars if it is satisfactory.

UPDATE 2/29/20 - I finally got my replacement Otter Box and it is working fine. I now know not to remove that plastic film over the Home Button even if it looks like it is falling off or should come off.

One of the issues with some tower cases is the placement of USB ports. Some of the newer cases have USB ports on the front but often these are USB 2.0. Even when there are 3.0 ports on the front of the case it seems there need to be one or two more. AVANTEK's 5.25" drive bay USB add-on hub adds three USB ports as well as a 2.4A charging port.

The hub has two internal plugs. One is for power and one is for the USB bus. Be sure that your case and motherboard can support USB 3.0 and has the proper plugs.

Once installed, the three ports are immediately available to the operating system and they work like the other USB ports on the system. The USB speeds are best realized with something like a USB 3.0 storage device like an external hard drive, though USB 1.1 devices like mice and keyboards work just fine on this hub too.

What makes this hub interesting is actually the 2.4A charging port. This is very convenient for charging a cell phone, a tablet or similar device. My chosen device for testing chargers is a Magellan Roadmate GPS navigator, which is an ornery device that will not charge when powered on unless using the car charger that came with it. I selected a high-speed USB cable and plugged in my navigator and it charged up quickly when powered off. However, the navigator slowly drained faster than it charged when powered on. This was expected though it was worth a shot.

I am especially encouraged at how solid this device is - the ports are securely soldered to the PC board and the board itself is mounted on several posts to the frame which makes it much less likely to flex and ultimately break. I applied some direct pressure to the PC board (not a realistic scenario in use but a good test before installation) and the board really did not flex much at all.

I can't find any real issues with this hub. It's a solidly built device, it mounts easily and once connected provides 3 USB ports and a charging port on the front of a computer tower case. It is reasonably priced too which makes it a very good buy.

Disclaimer: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

[[VIDEOID:28659c44db1b2ab45b6e5de3804881a7]] I love that this looks just like apple products. Matches the design perfect and has a nice aesthetic.

Plugs into any iPhone with lighting charger. Aux will then plug into headphones or whatever you need too.

Purchased about two weeks ago and love it.
