The widget seems pretty well designed and is fairly intuitive. I've had no problems using it. Audio could be better and in some situations it works pretty well, while other time its almost unintelligible. I believe this is just the nature of the little pinhole mike pick up. Results will vary based on the situation. I have found that sometimes the audio appears out of sync, but I'm not sure that doesn't have something to do with playback software. On the best quality, the files are pretty big and it will keep a processor busy watching the video.

Overall, it's a great little package that includes cables, power pack and just about everything you'll need except the mini SD card. Some of the earlier mini DVRs were poor quality and lacked features as well as cost a lot for the size convenience. This device takes the mini DVR to a whole new level that is light years beyond some of the earlier stuff. Having tried many other little minis, I can say that this just blows them all away and clearly has been developed to a much more advanced level.

Once you have played with it for awhile, you'll find endless uses. With a bit of creativity, concealment is pretty easy and battery life is quite good.

I use two of these units on combination with the tripp lite receivers.  They run 24/7 and have been working for over a year.  Be sure and use good ethernet cable, I can get over 200ft with good cable and about half of that with lesser cable

Well.. I needed to find a headset that could perform double duty. Not ever purchasing a Bluetooth/noise canceling headset before I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect! To say the least.. I had to rely on reviews and what I found sounded promising!

The sound is better than expected. Being one
who was born in the 70‚Äôs.. I actually was around when this style of headset made its rocking debut for the first time- Let‚Äôs just say.. the sound/fit and quality have reached new heights!! DON‚ÄôT anyone be fooled by the retro throwback style.. this is a fit that is actually comfortable now and not, head throbbing tight on the temples- or, tweaking ones
ear due to the cup made to fit.. Um?! Oh yeah, made to fit no one.. !! Instead these have enough stretch to make it feel nice and adjust in height/angle. I will say- there‚Äôs a wee bit of ear sweat bc, the material used doesn‚Äôt breathe 100%.. Yet, I'm sure it must be necessary to create a better sound quality!

I won‚Äôt lie...These aren‚Äôt featherweight as if, you could just forget you have them on- but, You can definitely notice the attention to detail that went into making these ergonomically shaped and the care in using light weight material. Where I noticed the weight of the headset most, is when I‚Äôd lean my head forward to look at my phone (interesting- we all look down to use our phone- we don‚Äôt ever bring our phone up?!) But, doing this I could feel the weight in back of my neck.. Now, I‚Äôm sure after using these a few times, you would build up those muscles pretty quick! But, just Something to keep in mind-
First need was to take on road trip so, I could hear music I liked. Sound itself was not like anything I‚Äôd ever heard and I know, it sounds ignorant but- if this isn‚Äôt your thing.. how Would you know what to expect?!! Yesss!!! I have used earphones before..
ie. On a plane or, book on tape at the pool, etc.. Style used is the type that slips into the ear and plugs into a device. I‚Äôve also used AirPod before as well.. But, with this Srhythm or, as I like to call it- ‚Äúretro‚Äù headset.. Best way to describe differences to a lament like myself: Imagine watching a movie at home on a regular TV vs. watching the same movie in a kick-butt dolby theater with surround, upgrades, whistles and bells! Either will suffice. But, knowing the difference- Why would you ever want anything less.. HeLLo!!!
The Noise canceling option is just a flip of a button and I‚Äôm wondering why these aren‚Äôt a mandatory gift for parents bringing newborns home from the hospital! They don‚Äôt make every sound disappear, rather.. they deafen the noise to let you think and concentrate- this was my other need in getting this headset. I have the hardest time typing emails and papers with verbal conversation happening around me‚Ä¶ Knowing this is a weakness, I wanted to try this novel concept- and Wow! it‚Äôs perfect for what I need- I‚Äôm sold and a total fan!!! It takes out all the noise clutter yet, let‚Äôs you hear needed sounds if necessary. If you have this issue- try this, you won‚Äôt be disappointed.
I‚Äôll admit hooking into Bluetooth was intimidating so, my kiddos did it for me in about 2 seconds. (I don‚Äôt care enough about certain things to learn it myself‚Ä¶) The ability to use all options this offers will prob. be too much and not fall in my wheel house- but, for those who want extras.. these have them! Or, you can choose to use in simplest form and be happy with your purchase. After pricing against others brands of the same quality.. these are hands down the best deal.. if you buy, Im sure these won‚Äôt disappoint!!

I received this as a review sample. I had low expectations regarding the sound quality, but was pleasantly surprised. In particular, the mid range response is rich and full, with a decent high end that does not break up, and a low end that turned out to be unexpectedly boomy. Not in your face boomy, but not anemic either.

Also, this paired and connected easily to my Note 3 phone. I did not make test calls with it so cannot credibly discuss that feature. I also only wear it occasionally and normally for an hour or two in the evening or morning if I am outside, so cannot validate the battery life claims. Even if those are in the ballpark (and I suspect they are) then their specs are excellent for any speaker in this price range.

Finally, the cap keeps my head and ears warm in thirty and forty degree weather, which we actually have in central and north Florida Granted it is not many days out of the year, but when we do have sub thirty degree weather a cap such as this is greatly appreciated, and is a key feature in my opinion.

Regarding the speakers protruding as claimed by another reviewer, that is true to a point. But they do not look horrible (or not to me anyway). My high rating is based on the sound quality, ease of pairing and play time, and the fact that they keep my ears warm.

Smart watches have gotten more popular with the release of the Apple watch. They tend to have a standard set of functions, such as access to instant messaging, email, time, alarms and a lot more, typically tied to your phone. Not all smart watches are alike, though, and offer different sets of functions, better connectivity and other various differences from one another. This particular smart watch offers the mainline set of functions, setting itself apart through the user interface which is more polished and clean than most others with which I have worked. That said, I have a couple of quibbles with it, leaving room for a little improvement.

This is a standard-sized watch with a rubber wristband that can actually fit a larger wrist like mine. I have trouble finding watches and watch bands that fit me, so the fact that this one fits me is a pleasant surprise.

Powering it on, the user is immediately greeted with a complex and fairly complete visual menu system with tiles for every function available to the user. This is a standard presentation for a smartwatch, but this one looks a bit more polished and clean than the others I have seen. Switching to other menu screens just requires a swipe gesture, as to be expected. I have big hands, and this means that, for me, using a stylus makes working with this watch a lot easier. This is not the fault of the watch but a reality of working with a small device.

My first issue with this watch came when I paired it to my phone. The date and time on the watch were off, so I expected that it would grab the time from my iPhone when I paired it. It did not. Instead, I had to dig for the clock application and manually set the time. I dislike this and think that having it set itself when it is paired is much more accurate and cuts effort on the part of the user. For Android users, there is an application to allow for syncing up the time, date and more, but iOS users are out of luck for now. To the manufacturer's credit this is made clear on the product listing so this is not a surprise. Regardless, I am of the opinion that the watch should fetch the time, not rely on being sent the time. In the grand scheme of things, though, this is an annoyance, not a deal breaker.

There is a fairly comprehensive list of functions provided by this watch in addition to time/date and phone answer. Through the menus the user has access to call logs and function, Bluetooth functions, a remote finder function, a pedometer, a sleep monitor, a reminder function to get up and move on occasion, calendar and clock functions, audio functions, video functions and a few more.

One of the interesting functions that this watch offers is a camera. So, I tried to use it and it complained that there was no memory card available. Reading through the limited documentation included, I was unable to find anything about a memory card. I finally noticed that the back of the watch has a small groove where it can be popped off, and when I removed the back I found the battery which is removable (replaceable - another pleasant surprise). Under the battery is a slot for a micro SD card.

Adding a memory card comes with a big catch. It requires removing the battery to get at the holder which in turn clears the clock and resets it to midnight 01-01-2015. So, adding the memory card requires me to set the time again. And again if I remove the card.

Although I think the time sync functions of this watch are lacking, it is otherwise a good smartwatch. The interface is professional and polished and the whole provides access to a large number of useful functions. It's priced well too. Overall, this is a solid offering worth a look if you are wanting a smartwatch.

Disclosure: I was provided a sample of this product in exchange for a fair, honest and thorough review. Even though I received this product at no/minimal cost I have rated and reviewed this product without bias, based solely on my experience with it.

I bought this for Xmas for myself, it is now March. It is heavy and falls over a lot on uneven surfaces. If you plan on taking it with you or playing it in the car for a while I would bring the charger (which is a wall charger, not usb). I wish there was a usb port so I could charge it in the car. The charger port on the back of the speaker is just trash. There are days when we want to listen to the speaker but it's dead because the charger isn't charging it. The cord comes out of the charging port constantly. I see this being the reason it's unusable very soon. My device at home doesn't see the blue tooth device of the speaker, so I've never been able to even use the Bluetooth option.
It does get very loud, has great bass. I know there are better products.

I needed something to listen to audio books and youtube videos on.These are very nice for that. I thought the tilt was really silly, but it seems to help a lot with the sound.Who knew? Plenty loud, I have hearing issues and these are fine. Set up was straight forward and super easy. Its a lot of speaker for a little price

I really like the high resolution playback and the four speaker driver setup which means each has it's own separate way of playing and sounding it's best I really don't dislike anything about it, it has all if the feature that I'm looking for so no complain their also I like the function that it can also be connected to the app so that's a plus (motion plus lol) anyway I will update the review as I go along and listen to the speaker more.
These are the beat headphones I've ever had.

You NEED these if you have AirPods Pro. The earbuds are great but there is a crucial flaw, they fall out of my ears easily despite tip size. If my jaw moves (talking, smiling, chewing) the earbud works loose. I got tired of catching them or feeling embarrassed when one or both would fall out of my ears and go rolling around on the floor. Once it happened in a restaurant. Thank goodness for the quick reactions of our waiter! He saved me $200. While I am relieved, this is seriously not a laughable situation.

Thank goodness a product like this. Since I have purchased them (8.99 for FOUR pairs) I have NOT lost my earbuds once! These are comfortable and easily taken off and put back on since the case will not close with them on. If you just need a quick charge you can leave them on and they will charge with the lid open. I highly recommend these. Do not waste your money on flimsy over the ear 'hooks' when these are the best thing going out there.

Love this stand. I use it for my iPad and iPhone interchangeably. Quality design and quality materials. I bought this with the Bluetooth keyboard that looks like the Apple keyboard, all set up together it looks like I have a mini Mac computer at my desk. Love it!

I received this as a free review sample. This is NOT a bluetooth device. These phones are strictly for 3.5mm stereo connections. That means that this will work with a wider variety of devices.

The sound quality to my ears is why I awarded it five stars. There is definitely a crossover built into these phones because I could hear the separation of low and high frequencies, with a prominent bass in one ear. Also, there does not seem to be any compression at the high end of the frequency spectrum, which gives these phones a more natural sound. I listen to mainly acoustic jazz (piano jazz trios, vocalists, and similar), so I appreciate the realistic sound these phones provide.

There are a few areas that I would love to see improved: the cable is long and would be nicer if it were flat, tangle-proof. Also, the controls are a little too high up on the cable in my opinion. I can easily reach them, but when testing them I could not see the buttons. Of course, those are not show stoppers - just my own preferences. And regarding the controls, I already am familiar with their placement from use and memory, so that is really a non issue.

The phones are comfortable. They ship with small, medium and large tips and I used the ones that were already installed. The fit was perfect. These also ship with an extra set of premium, noise blocking tips. I have not tried them since the regular tips are more than adequate for me.

Other nice features are the zippered, hard case, velcro cable wrap and shirt clip. To be sure, they are value-added items, but the real value is the sound quality and these phones have that without a doubt.

Bottom line: if you want hard wired phones that allow you to listen critically to music (or transcribe it), this is a surprisingly inexpensive solution. I have used everything from high end studio in-ear monitors and premium phones, and these come close at a much more affordable price. I am not saying that these are as good as the expensive phones, but am saying that bang for your buck these are hard to beat and will surprise most audiophiles.

WOW! I've had this for about a month now and it is really great! Use this when I work from home or I am on the road. Blazing fast. Light as a feather. Easily connected to Bluetooth keyboard and mouse. The dongles work perfectly. At home I have extended the desktop to the ASUS IPS monitor - no problem. Sound is really good. I have not had any problem with the location of the power button or keyboard layout that other reviewers experienced. This is a great work-box for me. My 'work' computer was my HP Envy, which is a great laptop.......I find myself using the Zenbook more and more when working at home. This has also replaced my Samsung Galaxy Tab 10 as my 'mobile' tablet. So light and thin; easy to take with.

PROS
Super, super fast - this is the most responsive laptop I have ever owned
Incredibly light and thin - so portable, you will take it with you all the time.
super responsive keyboard & touchpad
touchpad auto-disconnects when Bluetooth mouse is enabled(sweeeeeeeet)
Easy to extend desktop with a VGA dongle
Connected Bluetooth devices perform perfectly - no drag at all
WIN10 is pre-installed

CONS
The power supply is a large, square 'plug' that covers at least 2 of the outlets on your surgestrip. Terrible design :-(
Dont buy if primary use will be Video streaming - glass screen is like a mirror/glare is a problem with video - difficult to find a video glare-free angle
There is a known WIN10 issue where pop-up dialog boxes are super-small and are extremely difficult to use. Microsoft is working on it
The first thing you should do is uninstall Macafee (pre-installed) - blocks so many apps., including Chrome (sigh)

UPDATE 03/29/2017
Just an FYI - I use this daily and love it, however I am now noticing the battery is getting hot after an hour or so of use. This is a new development. I am not sure what is causing this, but did want to share. I think I may have to shell out some cash for a new battery, which would be unfortunate. I have never had a laptop battery heat up like this before and have never had to replace a laptop battery. Not sure if others are having the same issue, over time.

I have received this item for review.

These headphones have a nice fit and are adjustable, the quality is not premium but they deff. Arent even near the worst that has come across my desk. In my opinion they are what i would expect for $20.

I tested these headphones for multiple things, they are extremely comfortable to wear or dangle around the neck.

The sound is tolerable, much better than everyday city noise.

The product had no issues connecting using many different devices.

I would recommend this product to anyone who is looking for an affordable headset that will not be upset about the reality of it being $20.

Wow! I needed computer speakers for my Spanish class to listen to the news, music, etc. Since I am an auditory person I wanted the Bose 99 dollar speakers.But my husband who is the breaks in our relationship said to try the Amazon brand for 15 dollars.Well, he won! Awesome sounds!

No problems with either fitting my iPad mini or making the bluetooth connection.  I haven't really had occasion to use the keyboard too much, but when I have used it, there were no unpleasant surprises, such as text not showing up on the screen.  I do plan to use it while traveling, and already can say that for protracted iPad use, like responding to emails, I'm going to like it much better than the onscreen keyboard.  The  only issue I have encountered is that I haven't figured out how to make the on screen keyboard go away.  It just pops up, covering half the screen,which is an annoying intrusion.  I'm sure there must be something in settings to deal with this issue, or maybe the product's website,but I just haven't taken the time to find the answer yet.
The sound is there.  Better then the t.v.'s speakers, but not too much more.  But for the price, we we'd expect a studio sound system however we expected more from Vizio.
Basically you get what you pay for. It is not the best quality but it is affordable and it does the job. Once the speaker is on the battery isbdraining even if you are not using it.

I bought this product because I always feel like my tablet is never loud enough when I want to watch movies. This speaker is awesome. Of course it's not surround sound, but it definitely has some juice!

Downside: I could argue that the 4 hour charge isn't very long, but I have an outlet that connects to a USB and think that is a great remedy to still use the speaker and help it with it's charge. The biggest thing is just not to forget that it needs charged so you aren't surprised when it won't turn on.

SOUND QUALITY: It's actually really good. Even when you turn it up, there's no distortion or at least none that I have noticed just yet, and it really does reach pretty far. I'm not concerned about how far it can connect really because you still want the speaker near you usually, unless your listening to music and want to leave your device in another room... Overall, great buy!

These headphones were very nice. They were easy to use. They were comfortable for my daughter. I really like that they have in line control mute. The quality was good. They worked great. We used them for virtual school. They were attractive. I would recommend them.

Great earphones. I use them like every day. As long as you take care of them and clean them out and stuff, they'll last you a good while. The sound quality is good and I love all the functions it has. Plus, the app that goes with it that you automatically have in a Samsung phone makes it even better. You can change the functions and equalizer among other things. I recommend getting a case for these though, as the case is smooth, so it can slip out of your grip or whatever and they can fall. Getting a case for these is a good investment. Aside from that, I don't really have any cons. Great headphones. Convenient, and have a good battery life.

Trying to write a review on these is a little tough because I there is some good and not so good. I think the quality of the materials is fine, the end pieces have magnets in them so if they are hanging around your neck they stay together so you won't lose them. Stays in your ears pretty good, but not really noise canceling at all. The on/off button, connecting and volumes are all good and easy to use. The range is not very good past 15-20ft or walls in an apartment if you move a lot. Fine if you keep your phone with you. The rectangular pieces (volume button/mic) that sits around your neck feels a little weighty and it's fine if you are just sitting at your desk, but not for working out. It pulls, and moves and you have to do a lot of readjusting. Sound quality is not terrible, but not great. 1 being the worst, 10 being the best; Sound 5, noise canceling, 4, comfort, 6, distance, 3, design, 4. These would be okay to have as a second pair if you are stationary, listening to audio books.
No where near audiophile quality but OK for Kids

This is a beautiful Photography Ball. It's so pretty I'm storing it in my curio cabinet. Unfortunately, my camping-at-the-beach vacation had to be canceled, so those photos will come from the future. The case for it is brilliant. I like that a clip is on the case, so it can easily attach to a gear backpack. It's nice that the tripod, adapter and polishing cloth is included in a foam cushioned box. This makes for an excellent presentation as a gift. The adapter will allow you to use the included table-top tripod, or any other tripod.

These also make awesome photos for doing some differently composed portrait photography. It's a lot of fun to just play around with it and see what happens. Also, it's pretty enough to simply display in the home.

I find this to be a very fair value. The ball is nice, clear and free of defects. It's exactly what I was expecting and I'm not at all disappointed.

Thanks for reading my review. I hope you find it helpful and will click the Helpful button below.

After trying all major brands (Philips, Sony, JVC, etc.) these are the first pair of headphones that last more than just a couple of months (I am a very sweaty guy and I use these at least 5-6 times per week to work out, so they have it rough), they produce great sound, they barely ever fall out of place even when running, the adjustable clip-on feature is very confortable and does not irritate the back of your ear at all, and the gum tip never falls off, without which you can't put them in your ears.

I am not ever switching to any other brand after trying these.

I am so pleased with this keyboard case.  Feels very good to the touch, easy typing.  The backlit keys are a great feature since I like to work late at nights and turn of the lights so I wont disturb my hubby.  It adjusts to multiple positions and holds up very well.  The swivel feature of the screen is very useful when I don‚Äôt need to use the keyboard.  Keeps charge well, and stays connected with Bluetooth.

Quick review:

We just had an alarm system upgrade and the whole system was replaced. I told the installer and company installing the alarm I didn't want any false alarms via motion sensor!! Well 3 false alerts later all via the motion sensor I looked into a replacement motion sensor myself and I found this model with dual detect.

My installer came out swap out his garbage with the Optex MX40PI and now we just had to wait and see if this motion sensor would trigger any false alarms..... 3 months later no issues, no false alarms and works like a champ. We have cats and 2 of them are larger size and like to run around like crazy in the house and no issues, so we are very happy with this unit !!

So if your having the same issue I was with the cheap motion sensors installed, replace them with these Optex MX40PI and you will be happy campers. No more false alarms :)
Ive bought 4 pairs of these and the left speaker keeps blowing out, there junk, they last about 3 months.

This Boombox has the best sound quality I've ever heard in any small stereo I've ever owned. Everything sounds wonderful and I was especially impressed by how beautiful Christmas music sounds. The instruction pamphlet is very detailed, however I found the buttons very intuitive to use.

To be honest, this Boombox has everything you could wish for besides a remote. That is the only thing I miss about my old CD player. But that CD player only lasted less than a year. I'm hoping this one will last a lot longer.

Some of the features this has include:

Cassette Recording and Playing
Two great speakers for stereo sound
Sleep timer (15, 30, 60 or 90 minutes)
3 Favorite Radio Station Buttons
Audio in for connecting Smartphones, Digital Music Player and other audio devices
Battery Powered (6 C batteries) or AC
Mega Bass button (Press this button and you will have rich sound)
Logical placement of on/off button and volume controls
Ability to listen quietly with headphones

I'm enjoying this Boombox and can recommend it highly for the excellent sound quality. CDs play quietly and listening to favorite music is a true comfort.

~The Rebecca Review

P.S. I just ordered a third one. They last exactly a year from purchase every time. It is the CD player that goes after a year of use. I can't find anything better than this so that is how it goes.

Sound quality is excellent at least for me. I am not an audiophile but the sound is perfect for me. I did not have any of the issues some report about having to insert and remove them because the sound was not set right for the VR headset. For me they just worked out of the box.

Comfort is not so great. Usually my head hurts from the headband of the Quest long before anything else but these hurt my ears before the headband hurts my head. I am not blaming the earbud company as they can not make their earbuds fit everyone's ears but for me they don't fit well at all. I have gone through each of the 3 different sets of rubbers and picked the best out of the 3 but still they hurt after an hour of use.

So sound quality gets 5 stars from me. Comfort and fit gets a 3 1/2 but ill round up to 3 3/4 but since that brings the total to just under 4 1/2 I have to give them a 4 star rating.

Why the 4 stars you say? Well, frankly, I like volume with my music.  I really hoped with the Harmon Kardon signature sound that  the sound would be dynamic; it's just not. I'm not even a huge bass head, but I like to be allowed to have a decent amount and it just doesn't get loud enough. Also, the Tone Pros (the next model down) have true noise reduction; these do not. On both models however the sound on phone calls is the best I've ever experienced. I really like the retractable concept; I found with the LG Tone Ultras that the dangling of the earbuds got caught in things, and I like that I can wear the Infinium around my neck and retracted while waiting for the next call.
These are the best and most reasonably priced earbuds I have ever had.  I use them when I run and they consistently perform well.

Does exactly what I needed. Much heavier that I expected it to be. And, there are more ways to mount it than listed in the instructions. The clamp portion could be removed from the base and the base bolted/screwed to a vertical surface also. I drilled a 1/2" hole through my hobby workbench (countertop) and used the included base to bolt it down. I have another one on the way. Now I have to find a place to store all the spare parts, just in case I want to mount it some other way. The only issue I had was one set of VESA mount screws was too long even with the spacers. The other set mounted the plate flush to the back just fine.

[[VIDEOID:50a509ca92ee072cbb2d2a4c48213b4d]] I love my wireless ear buds, but they are too expensive for me to share with my son.  When I saw these at such a good price,  I decided to buy him a pair.  I wasn't expecting much, but the sound quality and battery life is as good as my airpods.  I really appreciate the case.  I think it will protect them, but also keep them from getting lost.  I also like that you can charge them directly from the case.  It's very convenient that I can charge the earbuds several times before I need to recharge the case.

I work in photo/video for a living, and I can tell you that good LEDs aren't cheap. I have worked with hot tungsten lamps for high output and smaller LEDs for lightweight smaller setups, but LED lights that can compete with the output of Tungstens are pricey.
That being said, this is a FANTASTIC light. It has high output yet has the pros of LED panels such as lower power consumption and heat, as well as being dimmable and color adjustable from the panel or remote control. I had the opportunity to use this for a job yesterday setting up an interview in an office setting. My tungsten bulbs would have been too bright and need gels to match the rest of the office. My other smaller LEDs would have cast smaller spots and we all know a larger light source casts a more pleasing glow. It seemed effortless to get the amount of light we needed in a short time.
HOWEVER, I did find that the mounting point was a little bit difficult to use. There are two bolts to secure it to the stand, and both need to be loosened to mount it properly. It took me a few attempts to get it on the stand, one side felt like I was screwing the bolt the wrong direction most of the time. Meanwhile, the light is large and kept wobbling during this overly complicated procedure. It didn't feel like a premium product during that, which I found odd considering the price point. I have lights that cost about half of this one that felt more premium during mounting. But, that being said, once the lights are up it works a treat!
So, a solid 4 stars from me. Almost 5 if the mounting were easier or the price lower to make up for that. But as a light, it does what it should do and well.

Great headphones, I bought these for a train trip the Mrs was going to take a year or so ago back. They worked wonderfully for her and helped quieten the trip. We now use these to watch the Apple TV, while not bothering the others. Well that was till my 9 year old figured out how to pair these to the computer and or his iPad. I for the life of me cannot figure out how he learned to pair them. But thats always the way with new tech the kids know it all.

I love the over the ear covers, they make wearing them for extended periods of time more enjoyable. Even after a few years the battery is still working well. Love the quality of the sounds, though I don't need the wide range of sounds as other professional types might.

I had high hopes for this little turntable. It looked perfect for my oldest son who is a huge 80's music fan and thought he should hear it in its original format. We were excited to unbox it and play the two albums we picked up at the used book store. First impressions were OK. The case looks nice and love the two speakers built in. Opening it, we were underwhelmed by the plastic turntable, stylus arm and rather cheap looking controls. But we were still excited.

The sound was also a little disappointing. The two speakers are underpowered and all high end so it was pretty tinny. But the absolute worst was that they stylus is so head light that it skipped constantly. We put a small glass bead on it and the weight actually slowed the turntable. We backed off and placed a quarter on it and it played about right. But again, I was underwhelmed by the underpowered turntable. Also, we noted that one of the spongy pads on the turn table was not installed properly and put a list to the album. We fixed that and fixed the quarter to the stylus and we were able to get it to play through Adam Ant's Friend or Foe album. The scratchy quality of between songs brought me back 40 years to my own first phonograph, which I think was pretty crappy, but probably better than this one.

It works, its nostalgic. We have had fun and will probably get an album at every used bookstore, garage sale, or antique store we find them in, but we will need to upgrade if he goes beyond just enjoying the novelty of it.

If you're familiar with the brand then they live up to their same sound standard. I do wish the case was more rugged so that I felt more comfortable with how they would survive a drop, if that day ever comes. A feature which I detest is that the earbuds do NOT work independently of each other. The right one can be used without the left but the left CAN NOT be used separately. If the right earbud is in the case charging then the left earbud will not activate. This is one of the primary reasons why I chose to upgrade from my previous wired set and since I did not know that that would be an issue I did not look for that function in the description and reviews. In fact I still do not know what they would call this feature and in reading up on other wireless earbuds have not see it described or listed. I do also wish they were a little more snug/secure in my ear. Anytime I open my mouth, to eat for example, they become dislodged.
Exquisitely Powerful Long Lasting Speaker. Nice and powerful. Highly recommended.

Terrible quality, it failed twice in less than 1 year.  After paying shipping to have it fixed once I have right at 100 dollars invested in this speaker and it failed again.  First and last time I buy polk speakers.

Would not purchase or recommend I paid a lot for this and it only worked twice and the rest of the time it wouldn‚Äôt full charge.  And kept hearing a buzzing sound while I talking to people on Bluetooth and could hear it too.

UPDATE: This speaker, like every Anker product I've owned, is quality!! I charge on Sunday night, use it average 4 hours a day, and the charge lasts a whole 6 days if not the entire week. Rarely does the charge expire before I put it back on to charge on Sunday night (if it does it is Sunday morning). The sound quality is unparalleled and the durability is fantastic (I'm not constantly dropping it or anything but I've probably dropped it a few times).

Original Review: My ex-boyfriend had one and he‚Äôd bring it when he‚Äôd come over. All I had was a giant early 2000s Apple speaker that weighs 20 pounds and had cost over $400 new... it doesn‚Äôt move off the top of my fridge much - lol. This is AWESOME!! The sound, the portability. Highly recommend!!
Works great. I put some of the speakers outside on my porches.

Not happy with my "upgrade" from a fire box. Streaming is generally fine once it is working, but, man, can it be slooooooooooow to load the home screen, respond to a button press, etc. Also, it sometimes randomly fails and provides zero feedback. For example, I recently adjusted my wifi access point to use a DFS frequency. The fire stick stopped connected to the wifi with "unexpected error". I tried a variety of things including "forgetting" the network, rebooting the stick, etc. Never did I get a useful error message. This thing is supposed to support a/n/ac, but it can't deal with a DFS frequency. No other device in my household had this problem. We've had other random issues here and there.

Fwiw, I do provide the usb connection for power, but it complains about not having usb power. I don't get it. 'course, there's no useful feedback about why it doesn't think it's getting usb power (even though it is...)

Couldn‚Äôt use this at all. Way too big for my head and no way to adjust, and these speakers need to be pressed pretty good on your ear or obviously you‚Äôll hear everything around you. No point in these if your head is too small for them to stretch well.

was warry about the clamp, and seems like it's rather strong.
The platform can not be lay flat. There is a small slanting forward angle.
Not that elegant comparing with my other stand, but functionally good enough. 5 stars. I feel Pandemic makes these home office related items all jacking up price, but not much to complain.
Very small! But the sound is good! Worth it for a good name brand speaker. No issues.

Greatest thing about this clock is the Bluetooth. Most Bluetooth speakers you buy you have to pair it to your phone each time you use it and even tho that's not super inconvenient, with this clock when you turn it to Bluetooth mode it automatically syncs up. You just have to see it to get what I mean, it's just really easy to use
I love this for my cassette player. Fits amazing and has a little pocket for headphones. Great quality!

The only thing that separates this tablet from others in this price range is that it boasts LTE connectivity. Unfortunately, I do not have a sim to try with this tablet so I did not test it. Beyond this functionality, everything about this tablet is pretty much sub-par.

The screen resolution is barely HD. 1280x800 on a 10" screen means that the pixels are quite big and can be distracting. The audio quality is tinny and underpowered as one would expect and the cameras are nothing to write home about. The size and weight is fairly standard. It is about the thickness of an old cell phone such as an LG G5 and it is slightly heavier than a Samsung Tab A 10". I do need to say that the screen bezel isn't big.

The OS, on the other hand is pure Android with no extra bloat and to add to the good news, Netflix does run on this tablet (Neflix updated their app a while ago to stop running on "unknown" android devices). Most Android apps are expected to run on this tablet and for me, all apps that I wanted to use (comic book reader, plex, netflix, and youtube) run and I didn't feel any lag in using them.

The Achille's Heel of this device is its wireless drivers (which covers WIFI and Bluetooth). I use a bluetooth headset with this tablet and at least once per day, the drivers crash and is unrecoverable. An error is displayed every few minutes and only goes away with a reboot.

In the end, there are better choices out there.

This is a very cool digital art tool. It's a combination of wacom-style drawing surface and external monitor, so you can draw directly on the screen like paper instead of looking at the computer screen while you sketch.
Ideally, you can use a USB-C port on a device that supports it so that you can combine displayport and USB input device into one cable. However, it seems like you'd need an additional USB for power in many cases, and in my case I needed to use the three-wire solution: One HDMI out from the computer, one USB for the pen input signal, and the 3rd USB for power. Kind of a rats nest of wire and not very portable. It really makes me wish I had bought a Surface or Lenovo Yoga with the active Wacom pen built in so that I get this functionality in a much cleaner setup, but at least with this it is a pretty cool addition to my desktop without buying a separate computer. And now I can have something else on my PC screen while this operates as a drawing canvas screen #2. Cool for a desktop, not so much for a laptop, since there are 3 wires to connect at a minimum.
I've noticed that the driver is a little bit difficult to use sometimes- I've had to set up the drawing area in settings only to have it default when I reboot to the original drawing area and need to be set again. I'm still getting used to it. But when it works, it IS really cool. You need to find software that can support it properly, like Krita for example, if you want to get the full effect out of the pressure sensitive drawing. That being said, it feels kind of expensive and I wish it were a more straight forward and seamless experience for the money, but I don't think there's really a better way to do this with an existing PC.
If you want to add drawing capability to an existing computer instead of buying a Surface/Yoga/iPad Pro/etc, this is the way.

I think the speaker is fantastic for it's size. This would be the 6th speaker I have tried out in this last year and I like it the best so far. Even over the name brands. It took just a moment to set up and it connects to my computer and phone effortlessly, every time. And the charge lasts forever. It was an excellent point and I'm very happy with this little speaker. I would definitely have to tell you to consider this one.

I have three main uses for tripods, food photography, nature photography and to hold up a spotting scope. This tripod succeeds wonderfully at two of those. It is great for nature photography and supporting the spotting scope. I am 6' 3" and I love that height of this tripod. even without extending the center post, I can comfortably use the tripod when standing.

This is a fantastic birdwatching tripod for my spotting scope. The carbon fiber material is light and rugid. Vanguard has remembered the little things, for example, the upper legs are padded which is huge in when trying to spot an owl in Minnesota at twenty below. The insulation makes the tripod much more comfortable to handle, equally when shooting images of Northern lights.

The legs are fairly sturdy although I feel that here is a little more play in the carbon fiber over my older aluminum, Bogen tripod. I was a little disappointed that there are just a few angle settings for the legs. They click into 30 and about 60 degrees. It would be nice to have more granular settings, so I find myself altering leg lengths more than my other tripod. The feet are well designed with hard steel spikes with nice rubber feet for indoor uses. Both options allow for good stable footings.

Also there are some great other details like leveling bubbles on the top of the tripod and ball head. Also, I like that they though to include a hook at the bottom of the center post for adding stability weights. The leg releases are easy to use and have held tight during all my time in the field with the tripod.

Where I wish they had put more into this tripod is the ball head. It doesn't seem to live up to the tripod body. I miss a pan handle and while I appreciate the feel and functionality of the locking knobs, it just seems like it is not the pro quality of the rest of the tripod. There is a second leveling bubble on the head itself which is fantastic. But probably the biggest drawback is the quick release plate. It is not quick at all, it requires quite a bit of screwing with thumbscrew to attach. Also there is not set screw on the "quick" release plate.

Pros
+ Height
+ padded legs for comfort in cold weather
+ Light Weight
+ Great feet, both the grippy robber shoes and the steel spikes
+ built in leveling bubbles
+ Functional and strong leg locks
+ built in hook on bottom of center post
+ Second leveling bubble on the head

Cons
- No built in strap
- Carrying case is ok (this is more a neutral than a con)
- the head is not great
- limited leg angles
- Head could be better
- Somewhat awkward and slow quick release plates
- Lacks a panning arm.

In General, this is an awesome tripod, but for the money I would have expected a little more, especially a strap and a better head unit. But I have to admit I love this tripod. I would have put 4.5 stars if possible, but for $500 my expectation for a "Professional" tripod head is a little higher. But for my uses it's awesome, it holds the Spotting Scope will but again, lack of a panning arm hinders it. From the shoulders down, the best I've seen.

I'm going to swallow my pride and admit that it took me a REALLY long time to figure out how to get a good fit/seal with these headphones. Honestly, 30 minutes of fiddling with them, and I was ready to give up and send them back - they were uncomfortable and offered no better sound than my $10 pair of bud headphones. BUT...if you happen to have the same problem, hang in there! These headphones really are incredible!

What I didn't realize at first was these come with one of the optional "wing" skins already on. I had been trying to put another pair of the wings on over it, and it was awful. But lo and behold, when I took the one skin off and put the correct wing size on...then figured out the right bud size for me...then figured out exactly how to twist them in, allow the wing to hook under the groove in my ear, and press slightly to get a good seal in my ear canal...WOW, these have amazing sound!

They have been very easy to pair with any device, I love the charging dock, and I've been able to run them a long time before re-charging. I might be most impressed by the range, though. I do use these when working out, but more often I use them while doing housework, and I can go several rooms apart - putting laundry away, even going outside to dump the garbage - and the sound stays constant. And once I figured out the fit/seal in my ears, they have been comfortable to wear.

I've had a number of Bluetooth headphones and the overwhelming majority of them have an "audio interface" that makes sense - some bare bones, some quite pleasant. This interface is in the form of sounds the relate to each of the functions - power on/off, paring, etc. These headphones have a TERRIBLE interface. When you power them on an annoyingly loud series of tones blares in your ear. The tones rise in pitch. When you continue to hold the power button, to access the paring mode, all you hear is an extremely brief, muffled tone. Apparently, the makers thought this was enough of a signal to indicate you're in paring mode. Believe me, it is NOT obvious at all. When you power off the headphones, you hear the same annoying loud series of tones. In this case, the tones do not decrease in pitch, which one might expect.

By comparison, the audio interface of my other Bluetooth headphones are a joy - unfortunately, they do not have volume controls or skip and rewind. When powering them on, a pleasant female voice says, "Hello", and when you enter pairing mode, the same voice says, "Ready to pair." When pairing is established, the voice says, You're connected", then tells me how much charge I have - either full, medium or low. These Cootree headphones do none of that. You'll be lucky if you're able to tell if they've been turned off properly.

In terms of sound quality, they're okay - nothing exceptional. In terms of fit, they're okay as well. Again, nothing exceptional. To my knowledge, they do not have an active noise cancelling function, other than what little noise they may happen to muffle by covering your ears. I mention this only because the rating form asks about it.

I was looking for a simple sort of cd clock radio to keep on a nightstand.  It's amazing how difficult it was to find something like that that fit my needs, and I ended up with this unit although I really wasn't intrested in the iPhone/iPod connections.  I went to a local electronics store and first tried a litte Sony machine, was set to buy it, and then the salesman showed me this Phillips unit.  The sound was overwhelmingly better on the Phillips unit.  I admit I'm not an audiophile, but I just want something that sounds good when I played CDs at bedtime.  I quickly dismissed the little Sony and went for this unit.  Since having it about a week now, I really like the sound from the CD player.  I did try my iPhone 4 on it to see if it would connect, and it did and it played music like a champ.  Strong and clear.  I have a rubber bumper on my iPhone and had to remove it to make the phone fit properly but that's no big deal.  In fact what I'm thinking of doing is reprogramming my older iPhone (first generation) with nothing but music on it and leaving that plugged in the Phillips unit.  I keep my iPhone 4 in a different charger in a different room so it doesn't disrupt my sleep AND so I won't forget it when I'm leaving the house.  So far I'm a happy camper with this little Philips unit.  The only con is the brightness of the backlit display which is rather bright.  I placed the unit in a different part of the room where the remote still works but the brightness of the display doesn't affect my sleep.  I like a dark room!

This card's R/W numbers aren't amazing, but I didn't really expect them to be. For the price, the fact that you get 2x cards with 64gb is impressive! I'm not familiar with this brand and I'm not sure if I'd trust it with mission-critical storage (flying a drone for work, for example) especially if it requires high speed data to read and write, but for something like a media player or dashcam/security camera recording, this would be a great option to throw in.

For now, I'm formatting one to use in a Raspberry Pi project and the other will probably go in my car's media player. Definitely a good deal for the storage space.

This is THE bluetooth speaker in which to compare all others. It is plenty loud for a battery operated speaker and VERY durable. The battery lasts between 5-6 hours on a decent volume and can operate while it is charging. I honestly cannot complain about this product at all. I got exactly what I was expecting and am very pleased.

I use this to connect my MP3 player to a 3.5mm jack I installed in my car's center console. The low-profile 3.5mm connector was very important to me because I wanted to make the connection as slim as possible to avoid accidentally torquing it, catching things on it, or applying pressure to the jack when moving things in and out of the console.

It works quite well for this purpose. the connector is slim - about as slim as they come, such that it basically clamps right up against the side of the player and the wall of the console. The plug itself feels solid and has a small snap when connecting to things. The cable is soft and almost as flexible as a woven cord, even if it does prefer some orientations to others. Sound quality is typical - which is to say, as good as every other cable I've owned.

The only thing I didn't like about the cable was the colors - it really doesn't go with the car interior and stuck out as a result, a bit distracting. So I used a Sharpie Pro - the big chisel-tip type - to turn it black. It is cotton sheathing, so this is quite viable. I was careful - after inking the entire cable and letting it dry, I washed it in warm water, then dried it and ran a soft, clean rag over it about a hundred times, until it came away basically clean. After the fact, while you could tell the original black bits from the inked threads, it's just different shades of black, rather than looking blotchy. I imagine using something like RIT black dye would be about equally effective, if you heated it and let it soak for a good long while.

So I would recommend it. The braided cable looks premium and is much easier to work with than its equally-thick rubber counterparts. This makes it easy to handle the MP3 player while it is still plugged in.

I bought this keyboard for my Nexus 10 tablet.  It works great and connects quickly via bluetooth when turned on.  It comes with a case that keeps the keyboard protected and also acts as a stand for tablet.  The keys feel great on the fingers as well. So glad I bought this keyboard!
works fine. Hope it can clamp thicker monitor.

This came on time and was well packaged. Initial impressions weren‚Äôt that great. Poor quality with all materials used.

Pros: Three record playing speeds. Has RCA outputs to hookup to better speakers.

Cons: Sound quality isn‚Äôt that great with the built in speakers. They sound cheap. The aesthetic of the case could have been put together better, maybe with higher quality materials. Did not come with a Needle.

Overall this could have been a quality item had they took a little more care in building them.

These little speakers are a bit heavy because of the wood so they won't topple over like light speakers. The sound quality is phenomenal, VERY good sound. Plenty of bass and boom from them too! I have them hooked up to my jukebox and they truly upgraded my listening experience! The remote and Bluetooth functions all work perfectly!

Overall these are fantastic speakers and for the price point, I'm pretty surprised!! Didn't expect to love them this much!

These are good walkie-talkies. I like the flexibility as far as power. We use the rechargeable batteries to save money, but you can use AA also. I also like that because when my son goes camping, he can bring extra batteries so it lasts longer. It has a lot of weather information, which is good, especially when camping.

These were easy to use. They are compatible with other FRS/GMRS radios, which is great for us. We have a variety of these radios and a big family. I thought they worked pretty well. They were clear and had fairly good range. I really like the micro-USB charging option too. These are good for adults and for kids. They were pretty easy to use. I would recommend them.

The primary lens I have on my camera is a good 18mm-55mm lens and it does great for capturing images that are a foot or more away. When I get much closer than that my camera is unable to focus properly and I end up with a crummy shot and I either have to give up or back up so that it can focus ‚Äì not what I want most of the time. These magnifying lenses are a good solution, but there are somethings you have to keep in mind when using them.

I will start with a statement that should be obvious: make sure you have the correct lens size when you are purchasing add-on lenses like this set. This particular set can be used only with a lens where the thread size is 55mm. If you have a lens that has a different sized thread, you should consider looking for this kit in a different thread size. You can use a ring adapter, but getting the right size at the start is better.

There are four lenses in this kit, a 1x, 2x, 4x and 10x lens, each increasing in power as the numbers suggest. You can somewhat view these as magnifying glasses for your camera, but that metaphor is not completely accurate. They do magnify the image for you, but they allow a closer shot as well and you can get very close to your subject when you have one of these attached to your lens. Perhaps a better way to describe them is to realize that they make your camera very nearsighted and your camera can see close-up well and distance not at all when using these lenses.

The main thing to remember about them is that as they go up the scale in strength they introduce a lot more edge distortion. This is most obvious with the 10x lens. If you take this lens and hold it so that you can see things through it clearly in the center, you cannot help but notice a large area around the edge of the lens that is distorted. The effect is less then you get it close to something on which you wish to focus but it is something to keep in mind. If there is too much distortion, use a less powerful magnification lens.

These particular lenses have a little bit of heft to them but they are not what I would consider heavy. Because they are glass they are a bit more substantial than resin or plastic lenses.

Overall, these are nice lenses. I have been able to use them for taking very close shots that I otherwise would not be able to take with my camera, such as ridge detail on a penny or dot patterns on magazine print. These are not real-world examples but they definitely show off the capabilities of such lenses. If you are looking for good magnification lenses for your camera, this is a good set that works well. Just make sure you have the right thread size before you buy.
